title: Operations & Research Assistant
description:
Please review this job post completely before applying.



Job Title: Operations & Research Assistant

Type: Full-Time

Hours: 40 hrs/week (must overlap EST)

Location: Remote

Start Date: Immediate (within 1 week)



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company, but this role is focused on operations, research, and task support. You do not need real estate experience to succeed here.



We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented professional who can manage
, conduct web research, process assigned tasks, and support leadership with projects and decision-making. This is a role for someone resourceful and motivated — not a simple “calendar/email VA.” You’ll be given responsibility and trusted to deliver results with minimal supervision.



What You’ll Do



? Manage
 communication daily through Outlook (respond clearly and keep inbox organized)

? Conduct research on service providers (pricing, reviews, quality, terms) and prepare clear comparison presentations

? Process a variety of assigned tasks — from organizing data and documents to preparing reports and summaries

? Use task management tools (ClickUp, Asana, or similar) to stay organized and track deadlines

? Communicate updates and progress via Slack and other tools

? Join Zoom calls as needed to collaborate or share results

? Quickly learn new tools or processes by researching online or watching tutorials (YouTube, guides, etc.)

? Provide reliable support to leadership by ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on time



Must-Have Skills & Requirements



? 3+ years in an operations, executive assistant, or research-heavy support role

? Excellent English (written and spoken) — professional and clear communicator

? Strong web research skills — able to find, evaluate, and summarize information independently

? Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)

? Familiarity with task management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Trello, or similar)

? Comfortable using Slack, Zoom, and ChatGPT for communication and task execution

? Highly detail-oriented, organized, and dependable without direct supervision

? Strong workstation setup: desk, chair, reliable desktop/laptop, 1–2 monitors, headset, and camera

? Positive energy, motivated mindset, and the ability to “vibe” well with the team



Nice to Have



? Experience preparing structured presentations (Google Slides, PowerPoint)

? Vendor research or procurement support background

? Prior remote work experience with structured task management systems



Why Work With Us



? Long-term, stable position with consistent hours

? Opportunity to take on diverse tasks and grow into higher-level responsibilities

? Professional team that values independence, results, and reliability

? Supportive work culture with room for personal contribution



How to Apply (Read Carefully)



We do not accept direct applications on OnlineJobs.ph.



Apply only using this link:


/1uMRkxneOR1Kn0C3UdI9_6A1avdy



Only applications submitted via the above form will be reviewed.

title: Accountant
description:
SENIOR ACCOUNTANT





Location: Philippines

Reports to: Head of Accounting

Employment Type: Full-Time Independent Contractor, Remote





At Firm Five, we modernize bookkeeping and fractional controllership. We serve a client base of emerging brands with $2M–$50M annual revenue in Canada and the US, helping them not only maintain their financial reporting but also optimize and automate their financial processes. Our clients rely on us for all things accounting and administration (we don't do tax work), and we take pride in delivering clarity, efficiency, and financial insight.





POSITION SUMMARY:

We are looking for an experienced and strategic Senior Accountant that will handle the full accounting cycle for US and Canadian clients. Your primary responsibility is to complete all the accounting in QBO or Xero for clients in various industries on a monthly basis.





COMPENSATION RANGE:

PHP 70,000–110,000 per month, based on experience and skill level





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Chart of accounts setup

Bank reconciliations

Bank categorizations

Receipt management

Profit and loss, balance sheet, cash flow statement preparation

Accounting for sales tax (No actual tax filings)

Accrual accounting and balance sheet adjustments

Excellent client communication via slack and
 (in English)

Adjusting entries and COGS

Opening balances and catchup bookkeeping





QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting

CPA designation in the Philippines

3-5 years experience managing full cycle accounting for a book of clients, ideally in an accounting or bookkeeping firm

E-Commerce or inventory experience preferred but not required





CHARACTERISTICS TO SUCCEED:

Passionate about numbers, accounting, and client management

Excellent communication skills with a passion for simplifying financial data

Proven project management skills with an ability to withhold deadlines successfully

Dependable collaborator with a strong team-oriented approach

Thrives in a high-pressure environment while navigating many competing priorities

Reliable internet and work from home equipment (laptop, keyboard, mouse)

Backup power supply





WHY YOU WILL LOVE WORKING WITH US:

Competitive Salary & Benefits

Early employee incentive plan linked to growth of the company

Fully Remote with Flexible Hours (9AM to 1PM EST + 4 flexi hours)

Paid Holidays & Vacation

Paid Sick/Personal Days

Growth Opportunities

Bi-Weekly pay direct to your bank account via Wise

No screen tracking tools





OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY & INCLUSION:

At Firm Five, we are committed to fostering a culture of equity, inclusion, and respect. We value diversity in all its forms and believe that every individual deserves to be treated with dignity and given equal opportunities to thrive. We strive to create an environment where all people feel welcome, supported, and empowered. We are dedicated to continuous learning, reflection, and improvement in our practices and policies.

title: Senior eCommerce Accountant
description:
SENIOR ECOMMERCE ACCOUNTANT



Location: Philippines

Reports to: Head of Accounting

Employment Type: Full-Time Independent Contractor, Remote



At Firm Five, we modernize bookkeeping and fractional controllership for fast-growing businesses. We serve eCommerce and service-based companies with $2M–$50M in annual revenue across Canada and the U.S., helping founders move fro
ssy numbers to clear, decision-ready financials.



We don’t do tax work.

We do take ownership of accounting, systems, and process improvements—and we do it well.



POSITION SUMMARY



We are hiring a Senior eCommerce Accountant to own the monthly accounting and reporting for a portfolio of U.S. and Canadian eCommerce brands.



You will be responsible for end-to-end monthly close in QuickBooks Online or Xero for clients selling on Shopify, Amazon, Walmart, Etsy, and similar platforms. This is a senior role suited for someone who can work independently, spot issues before they become problems, and communicate clearly with both internal tea
mbers and clients.



COMPENSATION



PHP 100,000–140,000 per month, based on experience and skill level

Performance-based increases and growth opportunities available



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Set up and optimize eCommerce-friendly charts of accounts (revenue, payment processors, COGS, inventory)



Perform monthly reconciliations for banks, credit cards, and platforms such as:



Shopify Payments, Stripe, PayPal



Amazon, Walmart, and other marketplace settlements



Maintain clean transaction categorization aligned with eCommerce activity



Prepare monthly P&L, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statements



Record accruals, inventory adjustments, landed costs, and COGS entries



Track sales tax liabilities (no tax filing required)



Handle opening balances and catch-up bookkeeping when onboarding new clients



Identify and resolve discrepancies in revenue, payouts, returns, fees, and inventory



Communicate clearly and professionally with clients via Slack and
 (English)



Use or learn tools such as A2X, Webgility, or similar eCommerce accounting software



QUALIFICATIONS



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting



CPA designation (Philippines required)



3–5+ years of full-cycle accounting experience, ideally within a US , Canadian or AUS firm environment



Hands-on experience with eCommerce or inventory accounting and marketplace reconciliations



Experience with QBO or Xero (required)



Familiarity with Shopify, Amazon Seller Central, A2X, Webgility, or similar tools is a strong asset



Prior experience supporting U.S., Canadian, or Australian clients preferred



CHARACTERISTICS FOR SUCCESS



Comfortable owning monthly close with minimal supervision



Detail-oriented but able to see the bigger picture



Strong written and spoken English communication skills



Organized, reliable, and deadline-driven



Proactive, solution-focused mindset



Stable internet connection, dedicated workstation, and backup power supply



WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING WITH FIRM FIVE



Competitive compensation paid bi-weekly via Wise



Fully remote role with flexible schedule

(Core overlap: 9:00 AM–1:00 PM EST + 4 flexible hours)



Paid holidays, vacation, and sick/personal days



Early employee incentive plan tied to company growth



Supportive, low-drama team environment



No screen tracking or time-monitoring software



Clear processes, expectations, and room to grow



IMPORTANT NOTE



This role is a full-time independent contractor position.

Government-mandated PH benefits are not provided; however, Firm Five offers paid time off and paid holidays as part of the engagement.



OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY & INCLUSION



Firm Five is committed to building a respectful, inclusive, and supportive workplace. We value diversity of background and perspective and are dedicated to creating an environment where people can do great work and grow their careers.

title: Procurement & Inventory - REMOTE
description:
About Cube Care Co.

Cube Care Co. is a manufacturing company dedicated to producing high-quality products for the healthcare and commercial sectors. We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Procurement & Inventory Specialist to oversee sourcing, purchasing, and inventory management to ensure smooth and cost-effective operations.



Position Summary:

The Procurement & Inventory Specialist will be responsible for sourcing materials, negotiating with vendors, managing purchase orders, and maintaining accurate inventory levels. This role ensures the company has the right materials, in the right quantity, at the right time, while minimizing costs and avoiding stock shortages or excess.







Key Responsibilities:

-Manage and oversee the procurement process, including sourcing, vendor evaluation, and contract negotiation.

-Develop and maintain strong vendor/supplier relationships to ensure timely delivery and cost-effectiveness.

-Monitor and maintain optimal inventory levels to meet production schedules without overstocking.

-Conduct regular inventory audits, reconcile discrepancies, and implement effective inventory control measures.

-Coordinate with production, operations, and other departments to forecast material requirements.

-Prepare and process purchase orders, invoices, and procurement documentation.

-Track and analyze inventory KPIs (turnover, shrinkage, lead times) and provide regular reports to management.

-Continuously identify opportunities to improve procurement and inventory processes.

-Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.



Qualifications:

-Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field (preferred).

-3+ years of experience in procurement and inventory management, preferably in a manufacturing environment.

-Strong knowledge of inventory management systems, procurement processes, and vendor relations.

-Proficiency in MS Office and ERP/inventory management software.

-Excellent negotiation, communication, and organizational skills.

-Ability to analyze data and make strategic purchasing decisions.

-Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills



System Requirements:

-Computer Processor: Minimum 5th generation Intel i5 processor or equivalent

-Computer Memory/RAM: Minimum 4.00 GB

-Computer Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX - No Linux, Unix, or any operating system other than what is required.

-Internet Speed: Running on a 5.0 MBPS plan or higher (Both primary and backup) - If your backup connection cannot serve as your primary connection, that does not qualify as a backup connection

-REQUIRED Headset: Noise-cancelling headset connected via USB port

-REQUIRED WebCam: At least 3 megapixels capable of 720p recording

title: (L&D) Learning & Development Specialist
description:
We are a US-based custom manufacturing company committed to innovation, quality, and service. We are looking for a results-driven Learning & Development Specialist to lead the design, facilitation, and continuous improvement of employee training programs across the organization. This role is key in enhancing employee experience from day one through effective onboarding, compliance education, leadership development, and product/system training.



If you're passionate about empowering people through learning and have a strong background in instructional design, training facilitation, and tracking development progress, we’d love to meet you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Design, implement, and maintain structured employee onboarding programs for new hires.

- Develop and deliver compliance training to meet company policies and legal requirements.

- Create engaging and scalable leadership and management development programs.

- Coordinate and document product and system training for different departments.

- Utilize LMS (Learning Management System) to assign, track, and report training progress and certifications.

- Collaborate with HR, team leads, and department heads to identify training needs and close performance gaps.

- Analyze training outcomes and make recommendations for improvements based on data and feedback.

- Ensure all training content is current, accessible, and aligned with company values and goals.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in HR, Education, Psychology, Organizational Development, or related field

- 2+ years of experience in corporate training, L&D, or employee development (not just general HR)

- Hands-on experience with LMS platforms and tracking learning progress

- Strong content development and facilitation skills (online and in-person)

- Excellent interpersonal, communication, and project management skills

- Knowledge of adult learning principles and instructional design best practices



Nice to Have:

- Experience in e-learning tools (e.g., Articulate, Canva, iSpring)

- Background in HR, talent management, or employee engagement

- Certification in Training & Development or Instructional Design



Why Join Us?

We're picky for a reason, we want smart, strategic, growth-minded tea
mbers who value fun, learning, and making a real impact. If you're energized by the idea of helping others succeed, learning fast, and contributing to a growing company, we’d love to hear from you!

description:
AI & GEO On-Page SEO Strategist and Content Writer (City Pages)



Type: Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term

Location: Philippines preferred

Salary: 50,000–80,000 PHP/month (based on experience)

Hours: 40/week



Overview



We’re hiring an AI & GEO On-Page SEO Strategist to improve how Hellamaid’s city service pages perform in Google’s AI-first search environment.



This role is about on-page structure, entity clarity, and GEO SEO, not link building or generic content writing.



What You’ll Own

- On-page SEO strategy for city service pages (e.g., Calgary, Edmonton, Toronto)

- AI Overviews and GEO SEO optimization

- Page structure, headings, internal sections, and entity coverage

- Improving existing pages for clarity, depth, and search intent

- Creating repeatable on-page frameworks for city pages



What We’re Looking For

- Strong understanding of on-page SEO and GEO SEO

- Experience optimizing city or local service pages

- Understands how AI search interprets content and entities

- Can explain why changes improve rankings and visibility



How to Apply (Required)

Send:

1) Your CV or portfolio

2) A Loom video (under 5 minutes) explaining:

- How you would improve the on-page SEO and AI visibility of this page

- Page to review: 

- What you would change, add, remove, or restructure, and why



Applications with a Loom video will have a better response.

title: Funnel Builder / Advertorial Page Builder (Funnelish)
description:
Hey,

I am looking for a skilled Funnel Builder to help me build and format advertorial funnels inside Funnelish for my eCommerce business.



This is a hands-on execution role focused on turning a written advertorial into a clean, engaging, high-converting page.



What you’ll be doing



- Building advertorial-style funnels in Funnelish

- Structuring the page properly (headlines, body text, sections, CTAs)

- Creating and adding attention-grabbing visuals (images, simple graphics, GIFs if needed)

- Making the advertorial interesting, easy to read, and not boring

- Using visuals to increase readability, break text, and guide attention

- Optimizing layout for desktop and mobile

- Ensuring clean spacing, hierarchy, and overall flow



What I provide



- Ready copy (fully written advertorial)

- Clear instructions and expectations



Your job is to bring the advertorial to life visually and structurally inside Funnelish.



---



ROLE



You are responsible for assembling, formatting, and visually enhancing advertorial funnels so they are ready to launch and test.



---



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Build full advertorial pages in Funnelish

- Create or source simple but effective visuals that capture attention and improve readability

- Ensure the advertorial feels dynamic and engaging

- Optimize for mobile-first readability

- Deliver work on time and communicate clearly



---



RESULTS



- Fully built advertorial funnel ready to launch

- Clean, professional, and engaging page layout

- Visuals that support the story and prevent reader fatigue

- Minimal revisions needed



---



REQUIREMENTS



- Experience with Funnelish

- Understanding of advertorial-style pages

- Ability to create or source attention-grabbing visuals

- Strong eye for layout, hierarchy, and readability

- Good laptop or PC setup

- Stable, fast internet connection

- Strong attention to detail



---



IMPORTANT NOTES



- This is initially a gig or project

- If everything goes well, there will be more projects, ongoing work, and better opportunities with bonuses over time

- I am looking for someone reliable who can grow with the business

title: Video Editor
description:

What Type of Videos?

title: Acquisitions Associate (Property Management)
description:
Role Overview

The Acquisitions Associate is responsible for building and managing Parity’s property acquisition pipeline. This role owns the front end of the development funnel: identifying absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties, maintaining a clean and accurate owner database, conducting outbound outreach, and negotiating purchase terms that align with Parity’s mission and financial parameters. This is a hands-on role that blends data management, outbound communication, negotiation, and coordination with legal and development teams.



Key Responsibilities

1. Acquisition Pipeline & Database Management

• Build, maintain, and continuously clean a database of absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties.

• Aggregate and verify ownership data from public records, tax data, and third-party sources.

• Track owner status, outreach history, responsiveness, and deal stage in Parity’s CRM or database.

• Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across systems.



2. Owner Outreach & Relationship Management

• Execute outbound outreach campaigns via phone,
, and direct mail.

• Respond to inbound inquiries from property owners.

• Build rapport with owners and clearly communicate Parity’s mission, process, and timelines.

• Maintain consistent follow-up to move owners through the decision-making process.

3. Deal Evaluation & Negotiation

• Conduct preliminary deal screening based on location, condition, and feasibility.

• Negotiate purchase price and basic terms within pre-approved parameters.

• Coordinate property walk-throughs and inspections with internal teams.

• Prepare internal deal summaries and recommendations.

4. Transaction Coordination

• Work closely with legal counsel, title companies, and internal staff through contract and closing.

• Track deal milestones and ensure timely progression to settlement.

• Maintain organized records of contracts, correspondence, and transaction documents.

5. Process Improvement & Reporting

• Help refine acquisition workflows, templates, and outreach scripts.

• Track and report on key metrics such as outreach volume, response rates, conversions, and acquisitions.

• Identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to increase acquisition velocity.



Required Qualifications

• 2–5 years of experience in real estate, acquisitions, development, sales, or a related field.

• Strong organizational skills and comfort managing large datasets.

• Experience with outbound outreach (calls,
s, mail campaigns).

• Demonstrated negotiation skills and comfort having direct financial conversations.

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication.

• High attention to detail and follow-through.

• Experience with property acquisition.

• CRM and database experience (Airtable, HubSpot, etc.).

• Comfort working in a mission-driven, fast-paced environment.



Compensation, Growth, and Benefits

• Competitive compensation commensurate with experience

• Opportunity for performance-based bonuses as the company grows

• Direct mentorship from the founder and CEO

• 21 days of paid time off

title: Bookkeeper (AR)
description:
The Bookkeeper (Accounts Receivable) will be responsible for managing and maintaining accurate AR records, ensuring timely invoicing, collections, and payment application. This role plays a key part in maintaining healthy cash flow and supporting Cube Care’s financial accuracy and reporting.



The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and comfortable working with customers, internal teams, and financial data in a fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities



Accounts Receivable



Prepare, issue, and track customer invoices accurately and on time

Monitor accounts receivable aging and follow up on outstanding balances

Apply customer payments (checks, ACH, wire, credit cards) to the correct accounts

Resolve billing discrepancies, short payments, and unapplied credits

Communicate professionally with customers regarding invoices, payments, and account status



Bookkeeping & Financial Support



Maintain accurate AR records in the accounting system

Assist with month-end closing activities related to receivables

Reconcile AR sub-ledgers to the general ledger

Support audits and provide AR documentation as needed

Collaborate with sales, operations, and customer service teams to ensure billing accuracy



Process Improvement



Identify opportunities to improve AR processes and collection efficiency

Help maintain clear documentation of billing and AR procedures



Qualifications



Proven experience as a Bookkeeper or Accounts Receivable Specialist

Strong understanding of accounts receivable processes and basic accounting principles

Experience working with invoicing, collections, and reconciliations

Proficiency with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, NetSuite, or similar systems)

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple accounts and deadlines



Preferred Qualifications



Experience in healthcare, B2B, or service-based industries

Familiarity with hospital or large institutional billing processes

Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field



Experience working with U.S.-based customers



System Requirements



Processor: Minimum 5th-generation Intel i5 or equivalent

Memory: Minimum 4 GB RAM

Operating System: Windows 10 or Mac OSX

Internet: Minimum 5.0 Mbps primary connection with reliable backup

Headset: USB noise-cancelling headset (required)

Webcam: Minimum 3 MP, capable of 720p recording



Why Join Cube Care?



Work with a U.S.-based manufacturing organization

Play a critical role in financial accuracy and compliance

Clear ownership and accountability in your role

Long-term opportunity with a values-driven company

Collaborative environment with leadership visibility



Culture Fit



We maintain high standards. We value professionals who are detail-driven, accountable, strategic, and eager to learn. If you take ownership of your work and thrive in a fast-moving environment, we want to hear from you.



Please create an application on this link to be considered:

title: Technical Recruiter
description:
Job Title



Offshore Technical Recruiter (Technology and Engineering, Autonomous Vehicle Focus)



Company



Twenty80



Location



Remote, Offshore



Work Hours (Required)



You must work US hours.

You will work either:



Pacific Time (PST) schedule

or



Eastern Time (EST) schedule



You must be available during normal US business hours for the time zone you choose.



About the role



You will recruit technical talent across Technology and Engineering, focused on:



AI, ML and Robotics



Engineering



Data Science



LiDAR



Design and Development



Safety and Security



You will also support recruiting tied to the Autonomous Vehicle vertical. If you have direct AV recruiting experience, you will stand out.



Roles you will recruit for



AI/ML Engineer, Robotics Engineer, Perception Engineer, Autonomy Engineer, Computer Vision Engineer, Embedded Software Engineer, Systems Engineer, Firmware Engineer, Controls Engineer, Electrical Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, LiDAR Engineer, Sensor Fusion Engineer, Localization Engineer, SLAM Engineer, Software Engineer, Full Stack Engineer, Backend Engineer, Frontend Engineer, Mobile Engineer, Functional Safety Engineer, Safety Case Engineer, Cybersecurity Engineer, ISO 26262 Engineer.



Key Responsibilities



You will:



Source and engage candidates daily through direct outreach



Build pipelines for hard-to-fill technical roles



Run first-round screening calls and qualify candidates



Present qualified candidates with clean summaries and strong notes



Coordinate interview scheduling and keep candidates engaged



Maintain accurate updates and notes for every candidate



Deliver consistent weekly recruiting output and pipeline reporting



Mandatory Candidate Submission Requirement



Every candidate submission must include a short voice recording from the candidate.



The recording must confirm:



Interest in the role



Current location



Availability to interview



Compensation expectations



Work authorization status (if applicable)



Why they are a fit



No recording means no submission.



Autonomous Vehicle Vertical Experience (Preferred)



If you have recruited in the Autonomous Vehicle space, you should be familiar with hiring for:



Perception, prediction, planning, localization, sensor fusion



LiDAR, radar, camera systems



Functional safety and safety case work (ISO 26262, SOTIF)



Common skills like C++, Python, ROS, CUDA, OpenCV



Requirements



You must have:



2+ years recruiting technical roles



Strong sourcing ability for engineering talent



Strong English communication (spoken and written)



Ability to run real screening calls and ask smart questions



Speed, responsiveness, and reliability during PST or EST business hours



Comfort working with clear activity expectations and quality standards



Important: Read this before applying



If you send a generic response or you do not follow the apply instructions below, we will not respond.



If you send a fake response or an AI-generated response, we will not respond.



Be direct. Answer the questions clearly. Real experience only.



How to Apply



Send your resume plus short answers to these questions:



Which of these areas have you recruited for? AI, Robotics, Engineering, Data Science, LiDAR, Safety/Security



Have you recruited in the Autonomous Vehicle vertical? If yes, list 3 roles you filled and the types of companies you supported



What recruiting systems and sourcing platforms have you used?

Examples: ATS systems, recruiting CRMs, LinkedIn sourcing, resume databases, job boards,
 outreach platforms



Do you prefer working PST hours or EST hours? Confirm you can work full US business hours for that time zone



Are you comfortable collecting a short voice recording from every candidate before submission?

title: Purchase Ledger Accounts Administrator
description:
Primary Purpose of Position:

• Ensure Purchase Invoices are matched to purchase order and any Prices discrepancies raised with Stock controller in a accurate and timely manner.

• Reconcile AP statements

• To assist with the entering of accounts data on the purchase ledger as required for 4 companies.



Key Performance Indicators

• To ensure Purchase Invoices are accurately entered on to the system by the 2nd working day of the following month to ensure that suppliers are paid on time. Target less than 1 NCR per month on entry accuracy.



Essential Criteria

• The role will include but not be limited to

• Entering purchase invoices – match to purchase orders and delivery notes. Any price discrepancies to be raised with the stock controller.

• Review open GRN’s

• Reconciling statements, investigating and resolve any anomalies

• Answering
s from both suppliers and customers

• Posting Direct Debits and amounts not on Creditors to Nominal Ledgers and bank accounts

• Creating Creditor accounts on PG/FP/MF

• Month end check list and completing tasks assigned

• Assist with year end audit requests

• Accounts administration experience. AAT qualified or similar.

title: Project Manager For YouTube Agency
description:
Project Manager – YouTube Agency



Part-Time - Remote ? Scale To Full-Time As We Grow



What We Do:



At Our Company 
, We run a YouTube agency helping businesses grow their youtube channel and make more sales for their business.



Clients record videos ? we handle everything else (editing, titles, thumbnails, ideas, posting, strategy).



Here are some of our client channels:


 


 


 


 


 


 


 


 


 



We need a Project Manager to ensure every video moves smoothly through our system and meets a high quality standard.



This role requires strong organization, communication, and quality assurance skills.

You will oversee production across 10–20 active clients, making sure each video is completed accurately and on schedule.

- Editors

 links

11. Upload videos on clients' YouTube channels (add titles, thumbnails, descriptions, timestamps, schedule posting)



12. Ensure all deadlines are met and flag any potential delays proactively





Experience Required:

We are specifically looking for someone with experience in:

- Notion (project management)

- Slack (team communication)

- 
 (video review & feedback)

- Managing multiple editors

- Handling tight deadlines across many projects

- Can work 9AM-2PM EST (2PM-6PM GMT) starting off 

- 1PM-5PM GMT can also work starting off

- Can Ramp To Full-Time Long-Term (Within 3-6 Months From Starting)



Compensation & Growth

- We want someone long-term, and we reward performance.



???? Base Salary

- $1000/Month For Part-Time

- $2000/Month For Full-Time





???? Monthly Incentives / Bonuses

Earn monthly bonuses for:

- Hitting deadlines

- Keeping projects on track



Quarterly Bonuses

- Additional bonuses every quarter. 



???? Long-Term Retention Plans

- Long-term loyalty and performance bonuses as you grow with the team.



How to Apply

If you’re interested in this role, please complete the following steps:

- Send us a short Loom video (2–4 minutes) introducing yourself.





In the Loom, please share:

- Who you are

- Your experience with project management and ideally experience in a similar company 

- Why you think you're a good fit for this role

- Why you want a long-term position with growth

- Any past references / company you worked with and what you specifically did in that role

title: Go High Level Manager
description:
Job Description: GoHighLevel Expert (2–3+ Years Experience)

Role Overview



We are seeking a highly experienced GoHighLevel (GHL) expert with 2–3+ years of real-world, hands-on experience building, managing, and optimising GoHighLevel accounts for businesses.



This is not a short-term or task-based role. We are looking for someone who wants to build a long-term working relationship with a growing company, take ownership of systems, and become a key part of our operations.



If your experience is limited to basic funnel building or short-term exposure, this role will not be suitable.



Key Responsibilities

Core GoHighLevel Responsibilities



Build and manage full GoHighLevel account structures (Agency + Sub-Accounts)



Design and optimise advanced workflows (multi-step, conditional logic, webhooks, internal notifications)



Build and manage pipelines, stages, automations, and opportunity tracking



Configure CRM custom fields, tags, and smart lists at scale



Create and optimise
, SMS, voi
 drop, and WhatsApp-style workflows



Implement appointment booking systems with round-robin logic and calendar rules



Set up and troubleshoot two-way sync (contacts, calendars, pipelines)



Advanced & Expert-Level Tasks



Build snapshot templates that can be deployed across multiple sub-accounts



Manage trigger conflicts and workflow prioritisation



Diagnose and fix workflow loops, missed triggers, and duplicate automation issues



Implement custom values for scalable account management



Configure rebilling, Stripe products, and SaaS mode (if applicable)



Integrate external tools via webhooks & Zapier



Set up lead attribution, tracking, and reporting



Manage
 deliverability (domains, SPF, DKIM, warm-up processes)



Handle GHL bugs, updates, and platform limitations with workarounds



Required Experience (Strict)

You MUST Have:



2–3+ years of hands-on GoHighLevel experience



Experience managing multiple sub-accounts



Proven experience building complex workflows from scratch



Experience troubleshooting live production automations



Experience working with real businesses, not just demo accounts



Strong understanding of CRM architecture inside GHL



???? If your experience is under 1 year or limited to basic funnels, please do not apply.



Screening Tasks (Mandatory – Do Not Skip)



To ensure we speak only with true GoHighLevel experts, all applicants must answer the following:



1?? Workflow Logic Test



Explain how you would build a workflow that:



Stops a lead receiving SMS once they reply



Moves the opportunity to a new pipeline stage



Notifies a tea
mber internally



Prevents the workflow from re-triggering if the contact re-enters the funnel



(We are looking for logic, not screenshots.)



2?? Snapshot Question



Describe:



When you would use a snapshot vs manual setup



One limitation of snapshots that most beginners don’t realise



3?? Troubleshooting Scenario



A client reports:



Leads are booking appointments



But no confirmation SMS is sent



And the pipeline is not updating



List at least 3 possible causes and how you would diagnose them.



4?? Deliverability Question



Explain the steps you take in GoHighLevel to:



Set up
 sending from a new domain



Protect inbox placement



Applicants who cannot confidently answer these questions will not be considered.



What We Are Looking For (Personality & Commitment)



Long-term mindset – not a quick freelance job



Takes ownership and responsibility



Proactive problem-solver



Clear communicator (written and spoken English)



Comfortable working with founders and senior teams



Willing to grow with the company



What We Offer



Long-term, consistent work



Opportunity to become our go-to GHL architect



Flexible working hours



Competitive pay based on experience



Respect, trust, and autonomy once proven



How to Apply



Please include:



A brief summary of your GoHighLevel experience



Answers to the 4 screening questions above



Examples of real GHL systems you’ve built or managed



Applications without detailed answers will be automatically rejected.

tal pill cases. Founded in December 2021, the business has been operated by two brothers from Washington, DC since then. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



We are looking to hire a Customer Service Representative to join our growing remote team.



About You

-You should be self-motivated and looking to work hard - as you will be expected to work hard, contribute and execute without supervision to help the whole team.

-You are highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities without sacrificing quality.

-You take pride in your work and are proactive, anticipating the needs of the company and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



Key Responsibilities

-Respond to customer inquiries, order issues, and service tickets through Helpscout (or similar
 based platforms).

-Manage returns and exchanges, providing alternative solutions to maximize customer satisfaction.

-Coordinate with the Operations team on inventory, rush/priority orders, and related tasks.

-Document and report recurring customer concerns to leadership, suggesting improvements to enhance service quality.

-Maintain accurate, timely, and professional communication across all channels.



Required Experience & Skills Experience

-2+ years of
 based customer service experience in an e-commerce setting

-Familiarity with customer service platforms (Helpscout, Gorgias, Richpanel, or similar)

-Strong experience using Shopify for order management

-Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to work independently.

-Proactive problem-solving mindset and commitment to delivering outstanding customer experiences.



Communication & English Proficiency

-Strong written and verbal English skills.

-Ability to effectively communicate with customers via

-Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build rapport and de-escalate difficult situations with customers.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and external partners via
.



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1500 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Days: Saturday to Wednesday (Thursday & Friday off)

-Work Hours: 40 hours per week, 8 AM-5 PM EST, with 1-hour unpaid break.

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company



To Apply

Fill out the application form here:



This application includes a number of questions in order to ensure we hire an outstanding candidate for this position, so please be advised in advance that it will take time to complete. We start screening as early as the application form stage. 



Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. Applications on OnlineJobs.ph, DMs, and messages sent via
 will not be reviewed.

title: Junior AI Operations Specialist (Marketing Focus)
description:
Job Title: Junior AI Operations Specialist (Marketing Focus)

Type: Full-time

Compensation: £250-£300/week

Reporting to: Director of Paid Media



WHO WE ARE



Digital Roo is a UK-based lead generation company that partners with financial service brands to deliver high-quality, compliant, and scalable leads.



We combine expert media buying, creative strategy, and automation to help our clients grow predictably across platforms like Meta, Google, Bing, YouTube, and TikTok.



We’re scaling fast — with major growth plans for 2026 — and we’re building a small, world-class team to help us get there.



THE ROLE



Here's the unique opportunity: You'll start by building AI systems and workflows for our marketing team, but this is a pathway to becoming an AI-powered media buyer.



Think about it: Traditional media buyers spend 80% of their time on manual tasks — pulling reports, analyzing data, writing ad copy, adjusting budgets. AI can do most of that.

The future belongs to media buyers who know how to use AI as a superpower — and that's what you'll become.



Your Journey:



* Weeks 1-3: Build AI workflows and automation for our marketing operations, learn how campaigns work from the inside

* Weeks 4-8: Start managing small campaigns using AI-powered workflows, apply your automation skills to real media buying

* Weeks 8-12: Own full campaigns as an "AI-first media buyer" — someone who moves 10x faster than traditional buyers



You'll learn media buying with AI as your unfair advantage from day one.





RESPONSIBILITIES



Phase 1: AI Operations Foundation (Weeks 1-3)



* Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) to automate reporting, data analysis, and performance summaries

* Build AI-powered workflows for repetitive tasks (ad copy generation, audience research, campaign analysis)

* Experiment with automation tools (
, Zapier, n8n) to connect our marketing systems

* Help the media buying team by using AI to analyze campaign performance and suggest optimizations

* Create AI-powered dashboards that auto-generate insights from campaign data

* Document your workflows so the whole team can benefit



Phase 2: AI-Powered Media Buying Apprenticeship (Weeks 3-6)



* Learn campaign setup — the AI way: Use AI to build account structures, generate ad copy, research audiences

* Start managing small test campaigns: Apply your AI workflows to real budget decisions Automate the boring stuff: Use AI to handle data pulls, performance monitoring, and routine optimizations

* Focus on strategy: Because AI handles the manual work, you'll spend more time on high-level decisions

* Get hands-on with platforms: Learn Google Ads Editor, Meta Ads Manager, tracking systems (but use AI to move faster)



Phase 3: AI-First Media Buyer (Weeks 6-12)



* Own full campaign lifecycles — but with AI doing 80% of the manual work

* Use AI to generate and test 50 ad variations in the time it takes others to create 5

* Build AI-powered "campaign doctors" that auto-diagnose performance issues

* Scale campaigns faster because you're not bottlenecked by manual tasks

* Become the most efficient media buyer on the team — because you have AI leverage

* Train others on your AI-powered workflows



YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU…



* Want to build a career in marketing: You're not just interested in AI for AI's sake — you want to use it to drive real business results

* Are a fast learner: You don't need to know media buying now, but you need to pick things up quickly.

* Are obsessed with AI: You're already using ChatGPT, Claude daily — and you see the potential for AI in every workflow

* Love experimenting: You try new tools, break things, and figure out what works

* Love numbers: You're comfortable with spreadsheets and can spot patterns in data.

* Are naturally curious: You ask "why" and "what if" constantly.

* Take ownership: You don't wait to be told what to do — you figure it out.

* Communicate clearly: You can explain your thinking and findings in writing.

* Are proactive: If something's broken, you fix it. If something's unclear, you ask.



REQUIREMENTS



* Hands-on experience with AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity, etc 

* Comfortable with Google Sheets or Excel (formulas, pivot tables are a plus but not required).

* Basic understanding of digital advertising (even if just from using
/Instagram).

* Genuine interest in learning media buying and performance marketing.

* Willingness to learn technical tools: Google Ads Editor, Meta Ads Manager, tracking systems

* English Fluency: Excellent written and spoken English for internal meetings and ad copy testing.

* Analytical Mindset: You must be comfortable with complex data interpretation and presenting findings to the team.



Nice to have:

* Any prior experience with paid ads (even personal projects or small freelance work)

* Basic Google Sheets/Excel skills (especially if you use AI to automate spreadsheet work)

* Experience in marketing, eCommerce, or analytics roles



Most Important:



* You're hungry to grow and see this as a career opportunity, not just a job

* You're detail-oriented — small mistakes in media buying can cost thousands

* You're resilient — campaigns fail sometimes; you learn and move forward



WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT



* Direct Impact: You’ll be working directly with the paid media director in a high-growth environment. Your decisions will move the needle every single day.

* Continuous Learning: We move fast. You’ll be expected to learn new tools (including AI-driven workflows) and improve your strategy weekly.

* Data-First Culture: We don’t guess. We test, analyze, and iterate. If you love performance marketing, you’ll love our process.

* A-Player Environment: We only hire smart, capable, self-motivated people. There is zero hand-holding here—just ownership and results.









HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please complete our short survey first (link below).

Only applications submitted through the survey will be considered.



>> 



If selected, you’ll receive an invitation to an initial interview.



OUR HIRING PROCESS



1. Survey/Quiz – Complete a short questionnaire to assess fit and attention to detail.

2. Initial Interview – A brief conversation to learn more about you.

3. Paid Test Task – Selected candidates complete a real-world task (2–3 hours) to demonstrate skills.

4. Final Interview & Offer – Final alignment and next-step discussion.

(In some cases, we may bring on multiple candidates for a one-month trial and keep the best performers.)



SUMMARY



If you're someone who's obsessed with AI, wants to build a career in marketing, and is ready to become a next-generation media buyer — this is your opportunity.

You'll start with AI as your superpower, then grow into a media buying role where you'll outperform traditional buyers by 10x.





>> Apply now by completing the survey linked above.

title: Executive Assistant to the Founder
description:
About Us:

Welcome to Assign – where global talent thrives! We connect exceptional professionals like you with leading U.S. businesses, enabling you to showcase your skills on an international stage.



At Assign, we believe in fostering an environment where talent can grow and flourish. We're committed to personal and professional growth and aim for service excellence in everything we do. 



By joining our network, you will be a part of a vibrant community shaping the future of work, transcending borders, and transforming businesses. Be a part of our journey as we shape the future of work!



Hours: Full-Time, 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST



Job Description:

We’re looking for a proactive, resourceful, and highly organized Executive Assistant to provide high-level support to the Founder and help bring structure, clarity, and efficiency to day-to-day operations.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, anticipates needs before they’re spoken, and can confidently take ownership of priorities, follow-ups, scheduling, and logistics.



You’ll serve as the operating backbone for leadership — ensuring meetings are prepared for, tasks don’t fall through the cracks, and the Founder can stay focused on selling, decision-making, and building the business rather than managing admin details.



The ideal candidate is not just task-oriented — they are systems-minded, highly dependable, and able to create an organized working rhythm with leadership.

Key Responsibilities:

Day & Priority Management (Non-Negotiable)

Own and manage the Founder’s calendar, including scheduling, preparation, and thoughtful buffers.

Build daily agendas and highlight the top 3 priorities each day.

Review upcoming meetings and provide quick prep summaries (who, why it matters, what needs to be d
).

Track follow-ups across Slack,
, meetings, and documents so nothing gets forgotten.

Maintain visibility into what’s pending, blocked, or awaiting decisions — and push items to completion.

Create a clear, repeatable update system so leadership always knows what’s in progress and what’s done.





Lifestyle & Logistics Support

Coordinate domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, itineraries, and confirmations.

Handle logistical tasks that pull leadership out of flow (booking client coffees/dinners, researching options, scheduling plans).

Take ownership of “random but important” requests end-to-end, ensuring leadership can delegate with confidence.

Sales Administration 

Update CRM records with leads, stages, notes, and outcomes.

Log outreach activity and responses consistently.

Schedule sales calls and support follow-up coordination.

Prepare simple weekly sales summaries showing pipeline movement, activity, and next steps.

Organize sales-related information so it is always easy to reference and up to date.





Systems & Process Organization (How You Work With Leadership)

Build a structured operating process for how tasks are delegated, tracked, completed, and communicated.

Turn real-time workflows into clear systems such as:

Checklists

SOPs

Templates

Maintain organized documentation in Notion as a single source of truth.

Proactively flag inefficiencies, duplicated work, unclear ownership, or time drains.

Suggest and implement improvements that make leadership’s workload lighter and operations more repeatable.





Tools & Systems:

Notion — dashboards, documentation, SOPs, centralized systems

ClickUp — task tracking, priorities, timelines, follow-ups

Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

Slack — communication and coordination

Zapier or 
 (preferred but not required)





Qualifications:

Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or in a similar role supporting leadership.

Extremely strong organizational skills with a detail-oriented and Type A approach.

Excellent written communication and ability to summarize clearly.

Comfortable following up confidently and ensuring closure on tasks.

Skilled in Google Workspace and familiar with CRM tools (or willing to learn quickly).

Strong judgment, discretion, and professionalism when handling sensitive matters.

Calm under ambiguity — able to build structure while things evolve.

Proactive self-starter who anticipates needs and takes ownership without waiting for instructions.

Systems-minded: able to turn messy inputs into clear, repeatable processes.



What We Offer:

Full-time, long-term role with consistent EST hours

Paid Time Off (PTO)

Paid U.S. holiday leaves

Medical stipend after 3 months

Direct collaboration with senior leadership

Clear opportunities for growth and professional development

A collaborative, supportive, and people-first work environment



How to Apply:

Interested applicants should apply using this link: 



Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. Applications will be accepted until the role is filled.

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
About Us:

Bond Street Procurement is a New York–based FF&E procurement firm working behind the scenes on large-scale multifamily, hospitality, and mixed-use real estate projects across the United States.

We partner with developers and designers to manage everything required to turn approved designs into delivered, installed spaces—accurately, on budget, and on schedule.

What makes Bond Street different is how we operate. We run a transparent, fixed-fee procurement model, meaning our incentives are aligned with our clients’ success—not vendor markups or commissions. Every purchase order, invoice, and budget is tracked carefully and shared openly. That level of trust only works when the team is organized, detail-oriented, and accountable.

Our projects involve real complexity: large furniture packages, tight timelines, multiple vendors, and constant coordination. As a remote-first team, we work closely across time zones and value ownership, communication, and follow-through. Tea
mbers are trusted with real responsibility and have direct visibility into how their work impacts major U.S. projects. Strong performers grow with the company and take on expanded responsibility over time.

Hours: Full-Time, 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST



Job Description:

We are seeking a Purchasing Agent based in the Philippines to support day-to-day procurement operations and work directly with our Operations Lead.

This role is execution-focused and detail-oriented, responsible for keeping purchasing, tracking, and vendor coordination running smoothly across multiple active projects.

This position is critical to freeing up senior leadership to focus on clients and strategy—so reliability, organization, and follow-through are essential.

This is a core support role at Bond Street Procurement.  You’ll play a key part in keeping projects organized, on schedule, and within budget—while helping the senior team stay focused on clients and growth.  Strong performance in this role leads to increased responsibility and long-term career growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Procurement & Purchasing

Prepare and issue purchase orders for FF&E and OS&E items once selections and budgets are approved

Coordinate pricing, lead times, quantities, and specifications with vendors and manufacturers

Support bid comparisons, quote leveling, and value-engineering efforts

Ensure all purchasing aligns with approved budgets and project requirements

Vendor & Logistics Coordination

Communicate with vendors to confirm production schedules, ship dates, and delivery details

Coordinate shipments to designated warehouses and confirm receipt

Track order status and proactively flag delays or issues

Collect and organize invoices, confirmations, warranties, and related documentation

Budgeting, Tracking & Reporting

Maintain detailed tracking logs for purchase orders, deliveries, and payments

Support budget-to-actual reporting throughout the project lifecycle

Keep all records accurate and up to date in internal tracking systems

Assist with project close-out documentation and final reconciliations

Internal Support & Operations

Work closely with the Operations Lead on daily procurement tasks

Support standardized operating procedures for purchasing, tracking, and reporting

Assist with ad-hoc operational tasks as project needs evolve

Tools & Systems:

Fohlio — FF&E specifications, selections, and project documentation

Google Workspace — Sheets, Docs, Drive, and Gmail

Notion — internal tracking, documentation, and workflows

Qualifications:

2–5+ years of experience in procurement, purchasing, or supply chain roles

Experience with FF&E, furniture, hospitality, real estate, or construction-adjacent industries strongly preferred

Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets / Excel

Experience coordinating with U.S.-based vendors and teams

Highly organized with strong attention to detail and accuracy

Able to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

Strong written and verbal English communication skills

Dependable and execution-focused, with a strong sense of ownership over work and outcomes

Proactive, resourceful, and comfortable working independently with minimal oversight

Team-oriented with a commitment to clear communication, accountability, and follow-through



What We Offer:

Full-time, long-term role with consistent EST hours

Paid Time Off (PTO)

Paid U.S. holiday leaves

Medical stipend after 3 months

Direct collaboration with senior leadership

Exposure to large-scale U.S. real estate and hospitality projects

Opportunity to grow into expanded operational responsibility over time

Clear opportunities for growth and professional development

A collaborative, supportive, and people-first work environment



How to Apply:

Interested applicants should apply using this link: 



Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. Applications will be accepted until the role is filled.

title: ???? We’re Hiring: General Virtual Assistant (Social Media and Basic Quickbooks)
description:
???? We’re Hiring: Operations & Content Virtual Assistant (20 hrs/week)



We’re looking for a highly organized, proactive Virtual Assistant to support a thought leader in speaking, podcasting, content, and business operations.

This role is not task-by-task—it’s ownership-driven. You’ll help keep multiple moving parts on track and make sure nothing stalls.

If you love systems, deadlines, follow-ups, and turning ideas into published work—this is for you.



? Role Overview



Hours: 20 hours/week

Check-in: Weekly 30–45 minute call

Style: Outcome-based, deadline-driven, proactiv

Tools: Excel, Canva, LinkedIn, podcast platforms, QuickBooks, basic SEO tools



???? Key Responsibilities & Time Allocation

1?? Speaking & Conference Pipeline (Primary Priority – 45–50%)



You will manage and grow the speaking pipeline using an existing Excel tracker.

Weekly Expectations:

Research & add 15 leadership / HR / tech conferences

Prioritize best-fit opportunities

Draft 3–5 tailored speaker applications (for review)

 event organizers for deadlines & speaking details

Build relationships with event planners

Keep tracker fully updated with status

Weekly Success Looks Like:

15 new opportunities added

3–5 applications drafted

No stalled or incomplete entries

Tracker always current



2?? Social Media & Podcast Operations (30%)



LinkedIn (Business Page):

Repost/adapt 2 posts/week from personal page

Draft aligned copy (reviewed before posting)

Post 2 additional weekly posts (research, influencer reposts, or originals)

Podcast Management:

Coordinate guest recording schedules

Create Canva images per episode

Write show notes & upload transcript

Upload episodes to Spotify, YouTube & other platforms

Publish short clips to LinkedIn & YouTube

Draft 1–2 launch posts per episod

Upload episodes to website with images, descriptions & transcripts

Publish within 48 hours of receiving final files



Success:



2 LinkedIn business posts weekly

Podcast episode fully published when applicable

All assets uploaded on time



3?? Website & Blog Content Management (10%)



Plan 3 months of content together

Track deadlines & follow up with contributors

Light editing only (grammar/clarity—do not change voice)

Upload posts with images & basic SEO



Schedule publishing



Success:



3 blog posts published monthly

No formatting or publishing errors



4?? Book / Journal Project Support (10%)



Weekly accountability check-ins

Research quotes, references & layout ideas

Canva design (black & white)

Prepare files for Amazon (ebook & hardcover)

Design ebook + hardcover covers

Draft & schedule promo posts (before, during & after launch)



Success:



One tangible deliverable every week

(research, layout, design, or promo content)



5?? QuickBooks Setup (5–10%)



Migrate income & expenses from Excel/Word

Set up invoicing

Set up 1099s

Organize expense & receivable tracking

Success (by end of February):

All historical data entered accurately

Invoices & expenses fully functional



6?? Client Onboarding Support (5–10%)



Send assessment codes with instructions (template provided)

Track completion

Consolidate results into Excel for team visibility



Success:

Immediate execution upon request

Accurate tracking

Consistent customer experience



???? Working Style & Expectations



This role requires someone who:

Proactively flags blockers

Speaks up if timelines aren’t realistic

Asks clarifying questions early

Repeats instructions to confirm understanding

Focuses on outcomes, not just tasks

Follows up firmly (including reminders) when deliverables are late

You will be expected to hold contributors accountable and keep projects moving.

? Ideal Candidate



Strong English (written & spoken)

Extremely organized & detail-oriented

Comfortable with Excel trackers & systems

Confident communicating with event planners & partners

Canva + content coordination experience

Podcast or content ops experience is a big plus

QuickBooks experience preferred

title: Remote Takeoff Estimator (Structural)
description:
We are currently looking to add to our growing team. We are a USA-based takeoff & estimating service company. This position is for remote in-house estimators/Quality Control Reps. Please read the job details and respond accordingly to our questions to be considered. Thank you!



We are looking for Immediate Hire:



Position 1: Structural Estimators like wood/Lumber package, steel framing, and metal framing





Job Details-You will be performing takeoffs and some quality control tasks



1. Full-time work available and even over time based on Performance & Quality Of Work-We can offer stable consistent work to the right person (Full Time Preferred)

2. Some training is provided but must have prior experience

3. Must have 5+ Years of experience

4. Must have an engineering or architectural degree or equal estimator experience

5. Must Speak English

6. Must have Planswift Software (No Exception, please don't apply if you don't have this software)

7. Must have good math skills

8. Must be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment

9. Must know how to use Microsoft excel

10. USA takeoff experiences a PLUS but not necessary

11. Must be a team player

12. Must be able to work daytime EST

13. Must be able to work some weekends, depending on workload

14. Must be very responsive

15. Must be reliable and available during your shift.



We have a base starting pay rate per this job post, if you prove your skills we do offer pay raises and bonuses. We also have many management positions to which you can be promoted to.



****To be considered please send the following answered questions****



1. Have you read the job description above thoroughly and can you comply with most requirements?

2. Do you have experience in Lumber Framing and Drywall? This area is particularly busy for us, so any experience would be PLUS. Please elaborate.

3. Tell us about your related experience

4. What is your area of expertise?

5. Why should we hire you?

6. Do you have a home office?

7. How is your internet Speed?

8. How many years of actual takeoff and estimating experience do you have? with US experience?

9. What is your availability and how soon can you start?

title: UI/UX Web Designer
description:
Freelance UI/UX Designer



Contract / Freelance



Location: Remote (preferred overlap with GMT)



About the Role:

We’re looking for a freelance UI/UX Designer to support ongoing digital work, primarily focused

on website design for automotive clients. You’ll be working closely with project managers and

stakeholders, often building on existing design systems while also creating new assets where

needed.



This role suits someone who can balance strong visual design with practical UX thinking —

especially when working within the constraints of CMS platforms and backend systems.



Key Responsibilities:

• Design and iterate on responsive website experiences for automotive brands

• Work confidently in Figma, using and extending existing design systems and components

• Create new UI assets, layouts, and interaction patterns where required

• Translate briefs, wireframes, or rough concepts into polished UI/UX solutions

• Collaborate with project managers to ensure designs are feasible within CMS and backend

limitations

• Refine and improve existing designs based on feedback and performance considerations

• Potentially support design work for internal digital tools or products

Required Skills & Experience

• Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer, ideally in a freelance or agency environment

• Strong proficiency in Figma (components, auto layout, shared libraries, etc.)

• Solid understanding of UX principles, accessibility, and responsive design

• Comfortable working with existing assets and design systems, not just new projects

• Ability to design pragmatically around technical constraints

• Clear communication skills and the ability to work independently



Nice to Have:

• Experience designing automotive websites or working with automotive brands

• Familiarity with common CMS platforms (e.g. WordPress, headless CMS setups, or similar

– ideally Umbraco as that’s what we use a version of)

• Experience collaborating closely with project managers and frontend developers

• Understanding of performance, SEO, or CRO considerations in design



What We Offer:

• Ongoing freelance work with flexible hours

• A mix of client-facing and potential internal product design projects

• Clear briefs, collaborative feedback, and realistic timelines

• Opportunity to shape and evolve design systems over time



How to Apply - Please share:

• A link to your portfolio (especially relevant website or automotive work)

• A short note on your availability and freelance rate

• Any examples where you’ve designed within CMS or technical constraints

title: Accounting & Admin Assistant (US Tax Support)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable Accounting & Admin Assistant to support client communication, document review, and basic tax-related workflows. This role is ideal for someone with a background in accounting or tax, who is comfortable handling client-facing communication and administrative tasks.



This is not a CPA or senior accountant role, but it does require familiarity with US tax documents and processes.



Responsibilities:



Accounting & Tax Support



• Review and verify client-submitted tax documents (W-2s, 1099s, 1098s, deduction statements, etc.)

• Ensure client files are complete, accurate, and properly organized

• Assist clients by answering basic US tax-related questions and guiding them on document requirements

• Manage client intake and tax-season workflows using internal forms and systems

• Navigate tools such as Drake, client portals, and internal systems to support tax preparation

• Support basic tax reconciliation tasks by matching documents and verifying data accuracy

• (Nice to have) Assist with basic bookkeeping tasks such as simple bank reconciliations or QuickBooks review



Administrative & Customer Support



• Handle daily admin tasks including
s, phone calls, and scheduling

• Serve as a first point of contact for clients, providing professional and friendly support

• Assist with portal,
, and basic system troubleshooting

• Maintain organized digital records and complete client documentation

• Provide status updates to help the team stay aligned during tax season



Requirements



• Familiarity with basic accounting and US tax documents

• Background in accounting, bookkeeping, or tax support (formal or practical experience)

• Comfortable with customer service and client communication

• Detail-oriented and organized

• Able to manage multiple tasks during busy periods



Nice to Have:

Important Note



• This role requires some familiarity with US tax and accounting concepts and comfort working with clients.

title: Inbound Call Agent
description:
Position Overview

We are looking for a reliable and articulate Customer Support Representative to handle inbound calls from both existing clients and potential customers. In this role, you’ll address inquiries, guide leads through our systems, and ensure every caller receives a professional and positive experience. The ideal candidate will be tech-savvy, calm under pressure, and adaptable to flexible or rotating shifts.



Key Responsibilities

-Answer inbound calls with a friendly, confident, and professional demeanor

-Follow established scripts while accurately logging caller information in the CRM

-Schedule appointments quickly based on customer needs, prioritizing urgent and emergency requests

-Adjust tone and speaking speed to match the caller’s mood and situation

-Build rapport using knowledge of local areas and postcodes

-Coordinate with internal teams as needed and escalate issues when necessary

-Participate in ongoing training sessions and performance assessments



Required Skills

-Clear, fluent English with a neutral or soft accent

-Excellent listening and communication skills

-Ability to remain calm and effective during high-pressure or sensitive calls

-Strong attention to detail and consistency in following procedures

-Comfortable using CRM systems, call management software, and team communication tools

-Dependable work ethic, punctual attendance, and openness to feedback



Preferred Qualifications

-Previous experience in inbound customer service, dispatch, or call center roles

-Familiarity with lead tracking systems and CRM platforms

-Knowledge of UK or international postcode formats and local area names

-Quick learner who can adapt to new tools and processes

-Experience handling urgent or service-related inquiries



Technical Requirements

-Stable primary internet connection (minimum 25 Mbps recommended)

-Backup internet option (pocket Wi-Fi or secondary provider)

-Backup power source (UPS or generator) to ensure uninterrupted service

-Personal laptop or desktop computer

-High-quality noise-cancelling headset

-Quiet, distraction-free workspace



Why You’ll Love This Role

Join a remote team where your communication and professionalism are highly valued. With structured scripts, continuous training, and no cold calling, your focus will be on delivering excellent service every time. You’ll gain valuable experience in customer relations and service coordination within a supportive, growth-oriented environment.

This is a remote, ongoing role for the right candidate, with regular work available. Please include examples of relevant Revit-based UK residential projects and confirm your availability.

title: Construction Controller (CPA Required)
description:
Position Overview

The Construction Controller is responsible for overseeing all financial, accounting, and cost control functions for construction operations. This role requires a licensed CPA with deep construction accounting expertise to ensure financial accuracy, compliance, strong internal controls, and proactive cash flow management across multiple projects. The Controller partners with executive leadership and operations to drive profitability, mitigate risk, and support strategic decision-making.



Key Responsibilities

Financial Management & Compliance

Lead month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close for construction operations

Prepare, review, and certify accurate financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

Ensure compliance with GAAP, contract requirements, and regulatory standards

Serve as primary point of contact for external auditors, tax advisors, and regulatory agencies



Job Costing & Project Financial Controls

Oversee detailed job cost accounting for all active projects

Monitor budgets, cost-to-complete, earned value, and gross margin performance

Review and validate WIP schedules, revenue recognition, and project forecasts

Partner with Project Managers to identify financial risks, cost overruns, and margin erosion



Cash Flow, Billing & Risk Management

Oversee project billing, pay applications, retainage, and lien compliance

Manage AR, AP, subcontractor payments, and cash flow forecasting

Support executive leadership with rolling cash flow projections and financial risk analysis

Ensure alignment between project execution, billing, and cash collections



Systems, Controls & Process Optimization

Maintain and optimize construction accounting and ERP systems (e.g., Trimble, Sage, Viewpoint, Procore integrations)

Establish and enforce strong internal controls and approval processes

Develop standardized financial, WIP, and project performance dashboards

Lead continuous improvement initiatives to strengthen accuracy, efficiency, and transparency



Leadership & Strategic Partnership

Lead, mentor, and develop accounting and project controls staff

Collaborate closely with Operations, Estimating, and Project Management teams

Support go/no-go decisions, budgeting, and long-term financial planning

Act as a trusted financial advisor to executive leadership



Required Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)

Active CPA license (Required)

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance

7–10+ years of accounting experience with significant construction industry experience

Proven expertise in job cost accounting, WIP reporting, and construction revenue recognition

Strong understanding of construction contracts, change orders, retainage, and compliance

Experience with construction accounting software and ERP systems



Preferred Qualifications

Experience with public sector, municipal, or government-funded construction projects - US-Based Company

Experience in multi-entity or multi-project construction environments

Leadership experience managing accounting or finance teams



Core Competencies

Strong financial leadership and accountability

Excellent analytical and risk assessment skills

Ability to translate financial data into actionable operational insight

High attention to detail with a strong internal control mindset

Clear, confident communicator and collaborative leader



Why This Role Matters

This position is critical to protecting margins, strengthening cash flow, and ensuring financial integrity across all construction operations. The Construction Controller plays a key role in enabling sustainable growth, informed decision-making, and operational excellence.

title: Executive Assistant / Client Success Manager
description:
Executive Assistant / Client Success Manager



Full-Time | Remote | PH Night Shift



About 
ntum:




ntum is a fast-growing social media marketing agency that helps local service-based businesses in Charlotte, North Carolina build predictable demand through strategic content, paid ads, social media management, and systems. We’re building more than marketing campaigns. We’re building long-term partnerships with our clients and a high-trust, high-ownership team behind the scenes.



Our values are simple and non-negotiable:



- We do what we say we’ll do

- We show up with excellence

- We put people first and help them win

- We keep learning and improving

- We think long-term in every decision



If you take pride in being reliable, organized, and proactive, you’ll feel at home here.



About the Role:

We’re hiring an Executive Assistant / Client Success Manager to become a key support partner to the CEO and a steady point of contact for our clients. This role sits at the center of communication, coordination, and systems. You’ll help keep clients informed, projects moving, calendars organized, and operations running smoothly, so leadership can stay focused on growth and strategy.



Success in this role looks like:



- Clients who feel prepared, supported, and confident

- Clean systems and organized documentation

- Smooth onboarding and follow-through

- A CEO who can focus on building the business instead of managing logistics

- If you enjoy creating order, supporting others, and taking ownership behind the scenes, this role was built for you.



Work Details:



Employment Type: Full-Time, Remote

Schedule: Night Shift (9:00 PM – 6:00 AM PH Time)

Clients: Primarily US-based (EST)



Key Responsibilities:



Client Communication & Experience

, and other channels

Client Onboarding & Ongoing Support

Scheduling & Coordination

Systems & Organization

Reporting & Feedback

Executive & Team Support

- Manage the CEO’s inbox and calendar, flagging priorities when needed

- Attend meetings and capture notes and action items

- Support team accountability by reminding tea
mbers of deadlines



Documentation & Admin Support

- Create and update standard operating procedures (SOPs)

- Prepare and organize proposals, contracts, and presentations

- Assist with basic HR support and onboarding documentation



What We’re Looking For:



- Experience as an Executive Assistant, Client Success Manager, Operations Manager, or similar role

- Excellent time and priority management in fast-paced environments

- Comfortable using tools like Notion, Google Workspace, Slack, and CRMs

- Calm, solutions-focused under pressure

- Professional and discreet with sensitive information



How We Support You:

- Structured and clear onboarding for new tea
mbers

- Clear expectations and performance scorecards

- Inclusive, supportive and collaborative team culture

- Regular feedback and growth-oriented check-ins

- Healthy work-life balance within a remote structure

- Direct access to leadership and the opportunity to influence operations



Compensation:
