title: Account Manager
description:
Benefits:



Work From Home

Guaranteed $500 USD per week

Additional available if you perform well

Unlimited potential through residual because you earn as long as your customers stay with Fleetsmarts



What we do as a company:



We give a fuel card away for free to truckers in the US that have discounts on diesel fuel. We have add-on products that make the sale more attractive to the customer. Customers can get weekly credit lines for their fuel card if they use our factoring service, which is asking to a pay-day loan service for businesses, but we provide this service for free. We also have a service to help reduce the down payment on their insurance. We market to new trucking companies that are just starting out and all our products are designed to help them get going faster than they would be able to on their own.



What you do:

You call warm appointments for truckers who have already expressed interest

You explain how we can help them

95% of people say yes

The key is following up until they actually start using our services





Key Responsibilities:

Proactively follow up on abandoned or inactive leads assigned to account managers.

Present and promote fuel card programs, factoring services, and insurance solutions to potential clients.

Assist customers with the activation of fuel cards and ensure a preferred payment method is added.

Offer factoring services and guide customers through the contract signing process to ensure completion and compliance



Qualifications:

Proven experience in sales, customer retention, or outbound calling (required)

Strong communication and negotiation skills

Confident handling high-volume outbound calls

Goal-oriented, persistent, and able to work independently

Organized and comfortable using CRM tools and office software

Positive attitude and ability to build rapport quickly.

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist (In-House Recruiter)
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist

Location: Remote

Compensation: $1800 per month + performance-based bonuses



About the Company

Ikigai Cases is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. The business was founded in 2021 in Washington DC by two brothers. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



What We’re Looking For

We’re hiring a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist who is a true hunter—someone exceptional at cold sourcing senior talent and uncovering high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates from the market. You’ll work hand-in-hand with the Recruiting Manager and the CEO, executing tightly defined searches based on clear job descriptions and ICPs, then independently sourcing, qualifying, and delivering top-tier candidates. This is not a generalist recruiting or HR role. We’re looking for a self-sufficient candidate sourcing professional who can design search strategies, find talent others miss, and consistently surface candidates worth executive time with minimal direction.



About You

-You should be self-motivated and looking to work hard - as you will be expected to work hard, contribute and execute without supervision to help the whole team.

-You are highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities without sacrificing quality.

-You take pride in your work and are proactive, anticipating the needs of the company and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



5 Core Responsibilities

1. EXECUTIVE-LEVEL COLD SOURCING: Independently identify and source high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates using LinkedIn, networks, and non-obvious channels—based on a clearly defined job description and ideal candidate profile.

2. SEARCH STRATEGY & MARKET INTELLIGENCE: Design and execute end-to-end sourcing strategies per role, including identifying where top candidates actually work, how they move roles, and which backgrounds consistently produce A-players.

3. OUTREACH & FIRST-CONTACT QUALIFICATION: Write high-signal cold outreach that converts strong candidates into conversations, then conduct initial screens to validate role fit, caliber, and motivation before handing off to the lead interviewer.

4. PIPELINE OWNERSHIP (SOURCING STAGE): Build and maintain a clean, organized top-of-funnel pipeline of sourced candidates—tracking outreach, responses, and qualified handoffs with speed and precision.

5. SCREENING INTERVIEWS: Run short, high-signal screening interviews for select Manager, Director, or Executive candidates when additional clarity is required—confirming scope, decision-making level, and trajectory before handing off candidates to leadership.



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews: 
/pages/reviews

-You’ll be working at a company that has scaled up extremely quickly - while focusing on the operational side of the business. Now that the operations are stabilized with key roles in place, we are focused on investing in growth.

-You’ll be working with people who have extreme levels of competitive fire in their bellies - people who will run through walls to make sure the company succeeds.

-You’ll be working hand-in-hand with the founders of the company - building the systems and growth strategy together.

-You’ll be working at a company with a robust product development roadmap that includes new colors / products releasing monthly



Required Experience & Skills Experience:

-Minimum of 3 years in talent acquisition, recruiting & headhunting roles, including experience searching for e-commerce talent specifically

-Proven ability to source great candidates, evaluate them, coordinate the interview process with the client, and close searches effectively and independently.

-Excellent English skills & an outgoing personality as you will be required to represent the brand to prospective candidates during screening interviews and in written messages to candidates



Communication & English Proficiency

-Excellent written and verbal English skills.

-Excellent energy & interview presence to engage candidates with the company.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and candidates over



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1,800 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, Monday through Friday. The hours are 8AM to 6PM EST.

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company



To Apply

To apply, please submit the following Recruiting Manager Application [Google Form linked below] to apply for the position.



This application includes written questions in order to ensure we hire an outstanding candidate for this position, so please be advised in advance that it will take time to complete.



We will be reviewing applications and inviting qualified candidates to interview on a rolling basis.






Note: Applications on OnlineJobs.ph, DMs, and messages sent via
 will not be reviewed. Only Google Form submissions will be reviewed and considered for this submission.

mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



What We’re Looking For

We’re hiring a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist who is a true hunter—someone exceptional at cold sourcing senior talent and uncovering high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates from the market. You’ll work hand-in-hand with the Recruiting Manager and the CEO, executing tightly defined searches based on clear job descriptions and ICPs, then independently sourcing, qualifying, and delivering top-tier candidates. This is not a generalist recruiting or HR role. We’re looking for a self-sufficient candidate sourcing professional who can design search strategies, find talent others miss, and consistently surface candidates worth executive time with minimal direction.



About You

-You should be self-motivated and looking to work hard - as you will be expected to work hard, contribute and execute without supervision to help the whole team.

-You are highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities without sacrificing quality.

-You take pride in your work and are proactive, anticipating the needs of the company and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



5 Core Responsibilities

1. EXECUTIVE-LEVEL COLD SOURCING: Independently identify and source high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates using LinkedIn, networks, and non-obvious channels—based on a clearly defined job description and ideal candidate profile.

2. SEARCH STRATEGY & MARKET INTELLIGENCE: Design and execute end-to-end sourcing strategies per role, including identifying where top candidates actually work, how they move roles, and which backgrounds consistently produce A-players.

3. OUTREACH & FIRST-CONTACT QUALIFICATION: Write high-signal cold outreach that converts strong candidates into conversations, then conduct initial screens to validate role fit, caliber, and motivation before handing off to the lead interviewer.

4. PIPELINE OWNERSHIP (SOURCING STAGE): Build and maintain a clean, organized top-of-funnel pipeline of sourced candidates—tracking outreach, responses, and qualified handoffs with speed and precision.

5. SCREENING INTERVIEWS: Run short, high-signal screening interviews for select Manager, Director, or Executive candidates when additional clarity is required—confirming scope, decision-making level, and trajectory before handing off candidates to leadership. 



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews: 

-You’ll be working at a company that has scaled up extremely quickly - while focusing on the operational side of the business. Now that the operations are stabilized with key roles in place, we are focused on investing in growth.

-You’ll be working with people who have extreme levels of competitive fire in their bellies - people who will run through walls to make sure the company succeeds.

-You’ll be working hand-in-hand with the founders of the company - building the systems and growth strategy together.

-You’ll be working at a company with a robust product development roadmap that includes new colors / products releasing monthly



Required Experience & Skills Experience:

-Minimum of 3 years in talent acquisition, recruiting & headhunting roles, including experience searching for e-commerce talent specifically

-Proven ability to source great candidates, evaluate them, coordinate the interview process with the client, and close searches effectively and independently.

-Excellent English skills & an outgoing personality as you will be required to represent the brand to prospective candidates during screening interviews and in written messages to candidates



Communication & English Proficiency

-Excellent written and verbal English skills.

-Excellent energy & interview presence to engage candidates with the company.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and candidates over



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1,800 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, Monday through Friday. The hours are 8AM to 6PM EST.

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company



To Apply

To apply, please submit the following Recruiting Manager Application [Google Form linked below] to apply for the position.



This application includes written questions in order to ensure we hire an outstanding candidate for this position, so please be advised in advance that it will take time to complete.



We will be reviewing applications and inviting qualified candidates to interview on a rolling basis.







Note: Applications on OnlineJobs.ph, DMs, and messages sent via
 will not be reviewed. Only Google Form submissions will be reviewed and considered for this submission.

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for a Customer Service Manager

Location: Remote

About the Company

Ikigai Cases (
) is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. Founded in December 2021, the business has been operated by two brothers from Washington, DC since then. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



We are looking to hire a Customer Service Manager to join our growing remote team.



5 Core Responsibilities

Elite Decision-Making & Judgment: Make consistently correct judgment calls in ambiguous customer situations where policies do not explicitly apply, setting clear precedent that protects the customer experience while maintaining company standards.



Elite Customer Service Execution: Confidently step into any customer ticket—new, escalated, or mid-thread—and resolve it correctly. Serve as the final escalation point for complex, high-risk, or high-value customer issues.



Template & Response System Ownership: Continuously convert real customer interactions into high-quality templates, macros, and decision guides that eliminate repeat mistakes and dramatically increase team efficiency.



Customer Service System Builder: Own and improve the customer service ecosystem end-to-end, including tools, workflows, tagging, reporting, policies, cheat sheets, and escalation paths, turning daily chaos into structured, scalable systems.



Head of Training, Coaching & Performance: Hire, onboard, train, coach, and performance-manage customer service representatives. Develop A-players, correct underperformance early, and maintain a consistently high bar across the team.



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews: 

-You’ll be working at a company that has scaled up extremely quickly - while focusing on the operational side of the business. Now that the operations are stabilized with key roles in place, we are focused on investing in growth.

-You’ll be working with people who have extreme levels of competitive fire in their bellies - people who will run through walls to make sure the company succeeds.

-You’ll be working hand-in-hand with the founders of the company - building the systems and growth strategy together.

-You’ll be working at a company with a robust product development roadmap that includes new colors / products releasing monthly



Required Experience & Skills Experience

-3+ years served as a Customer Service Manager or Lead, managing a team of 6+ customer service representatives handling high-volume
-based support for a U.S.-based e-commerce brand.

-Extensive hands-on ticket experience — not removed from the queue — with a history of personally handling escalations and complex customer cases.

-Long-term ownership of CS documentation, including building and maintaining SOPs, templates, macros, and internal cheat sheets used daily by a CS team.

-Direct responsibility for training CSRs, including onboarding new hires, running ongoing coaching, and reinforcing standards over time.

-Multiple years of Shopify usage, including order review, edits, refunds, replacements, and understanding fulfillment states.

-Daily use of a helpdesk platform such as HelpScout, Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar, in a real production environment.

-Experience operating within a growing e-commerce team, where customer service decisions had real downstream impact on operations, fulfillment, and revenue.

-Must be based outside the United States.



Communication & English Proficiency 

-Strong written and verbal English skills.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and external partners via
.

-Ability to receive and provide constructive feedback.



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1800 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, Monday to Friday, 7AM - 5PM EST

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company



To Apply

Fill out the application form here:

title: DME Respiratory Coordinator
description:
Position Summary



One Source Medical Solutions is seeking an experienced DME Respiratory Coordinator to join our team. In this role, you will ensure seamless coordination and delivery of durable medical equipment related to respiratory care, working closely with patients, clinicians, payers, and internal teams to facilitate high-quality respiratory support services. You’ll play a key role in optimizing patient outcomes while supporting operational and compliance goals.



Key Responsibilities



Coordinate the delivery, set-up, and follow-up of respiratory DME (e.g., oxygen therapy, CPAP/BiPAP devices, nebulizers).



Act as the primary point of contact for patients, physicians, suppliers, and insurance providers regarding respiratory equipment orders, authorizations, and adjustments.



Verify insurance eligibility and benefits, obtain authorizations, and ensure timely submission of documentation.



Manage DME inventory and scheduling to meet patient needs efficiently and accurately.



Provide education and support to patients and caregivers on the use, maintenance, and troubleshooting of respiratory equipment.



Maintain accurate patient records, ensuring all documentation meets regulatory, payer, and quality standards.



Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., billing, clinical support) to resolve issues and communicate updates.



Monitor follow-up care and equipment returns when appropriate.



Qualifications



Minimum of 2 years’ experience in DME coordination, respiratory services, or related healthcare role.



Strong knowledge of respiratory equipment and clinical indications.



Experience with insurance verification, prior authorization, and DME documentation protocols.



Excellent customer service, communication, and organizational skills.



Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail.



Proficiency with electronic medical records (EMR) and scheduling software.



High School Diploma or equivalent required; Associate/Bachelor’s degree in healthcare or related field preferred.



Brightree experience preferred.



How to Apply



Ready to take the next step in your healthcare career? Apply now with your updated resume and cover letter — we look forward to connecting with you!

title: Fantasy / Grimdark Digital Artist Needed for Military Themed Card Game
description:
I’m looking for a skilled digital artist to create illustrations for a military-themed tabletop card game.



The art style should match high-fantasy / grimdark digital painting.

Painterly. Cinematic. Semi-realistic. Dark tone.



Think RPG / tabletop card art. Strong lighting. Dramatic poses. Detailed characters.



What you’ll be doing:

- Create character and military equipment/vehicles/aircraft illustrations for cards 

- Military-inspired themes (elite units, commanders, factions)

- Consistent style across multiple cards

- background art

- No text or titles in the artwork

- Box coverts, banners, website art



Style reference:

- Grimdark fantasy

- RPG / tabletop concept art

- Painterly digital illustration

- Semi-realistic, not anime, not cartoon



Requirements:

- Proven experience in this art style

- Strong portfolio (this matters most)

- Ability to follow art direction closely

- Comfortable with revisions

- Good/fast communication



Nice to have:

- Experience with card games, board games, or tabletop art

- Military or tactical design influence



Project details:

- Paid per illustration (open to discussion)

- Ongoing work if the fit is good

- Commercial use rights required



** PLEASE BE SURE TO PROVIDE YOUR PORTFOLIO AND ONLY RELEVANT ARTWORK DESIGNS IN YOUR RESPONSE AND YOUR RATE PER ILLUSTRATION. **



If your style doesn’t match, I won’t move forward.

If it does, this can turn into long-term work.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
PLEASE READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION BEFORE APPLYING



Financial Analyst – Business Sales and Commercial Real Estate



Position Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Financial Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Financial Analyst, you will play a critical role in providing financial analysis, investment modeling, and strategic insights for our commercial real estate projects. 



Key Responsibilities:

• Conduct detailed financial analysis and due diligence on commercial real estate opportunities, including property underwriting, market research, and financial modeling.

• Prepare information for comprehensive investment proposals, offering memoranda, and presentations for potential investors

• Collaborate with salespersons to provide financial insights and support decision-making

• Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and regulatory changes to provide strategic recommendations

• Analyze and present business performance: revenue, spreads, expenses, balance sheet and returns

• Take initiative and function independently, balanced with strong teaming skills



Qualifications:

• 3+ years of experience in financial analysis, preferably in commercial real estate.

• Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis using Excel and other financial software.

• Strong understanding of real estate finance, investment concepts, and market research.

• Ability to present financial information to a non-financial audience.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

• Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. 

• Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

• Accounting experience within a sales organization and/or a medical company is a plus. 

• Commercial real estate industry experience is a plus.

• Knowledge of Zoho CRM is a plus. 



____________________________________



Financial Analyst Candidate Assessment



Estimated Time: 60–90 minutes

Submission: Excel file + brief written response (maximum 1 page)



This exercise is designed to evaluate your financial modeling skills, analytical judgment, and ability to communicate investment insights clearly and efficiently.



You are evaluating the purchase of a single-tenant healthcare property.



Property Overview:

• Purchase Price: $3,800,000

• Cap Rate: 6.75%

• Lease Term Remaining: 10 years

• Annual Rent Increases: 2.5%

• Lease Type: NNN



Financing:

• Loan-to-Value: 75%

• Interest Rate: 6.00%

• Amortization: 25 years

• Hold Period: 5 years

• Exit Cap Rate: 7.25%

• Selling Costs: 2?liverables



1. Build a Simple Acquisition Model (Excel)



Your model should calculate:

• Net Operating Income

• Annual debt service

• Cash flow

• Cash-on-cash return

• Estimated sale price

• Projected investor profit

Focus on clarity, structure, and correct assumptions rather than excessive complexity.



2. Written Analysis (Brief)



In a few paragraphs, address:

• Would you recommend this investment? Why or why not?

• Identify one major risk and one major strength.

• What is the single metric you believe matters most in this deal?



What We Are Evaluating

• Financial modeling fundamentals

• Accuracy and attention to detail

• Logical investment reasoning

• Ability to simplify financial concepts

• Professional organization



To Apply, please include your resume and the deliverables mentioned above.

title: Prior Authorization/Billing Specialist
description:
Prior Authorization Management

  • Handle a high volume of prior authorization requests for medical services, procedures, and medications with accuracy and timeliness.

  • Verify medical necessity against payer guidelines and clinical criteria, ensuring all required documentation is complete.

  • Demonstrate strong follow?through on pending and denied authorizations, proactively resolving issues to avoid care delays or billing denials.

  • Maintain an organized tracking system for authorization status, approvals, denials, and appeals to support compliance and audit readiness.

  • Collaborate with providers, payers, and patients to secure approvals and communicate outcomes clearly.

  • Apply knowledge of copay assistance programs to support patients in accessing needed therapies and reducing financial barriers



Claims Review & Adjudication

  • Review claims for accuracy, medical necessity, and proper coding (CPT/HCPCS, ICD-10, modifiers, global periods).

  • Identify missing info, duplicates, and audit flags.

  • Apply MSO policies and payor guidelines; issue approvals, denials, or requests for more documentation.

  • Communicate with clinic teams to resolve documentation issues.



Qualifications

  • Required: Prior authorization experience

  • 2+ years in prior authorization, utilization management, medical billing, claims adjudication, or revenue cycle.

  • Strong knowledge of CPT, ICD-10, modifiers, medical necessity, and documentation.

  • Experience in MSO, IPA, payor, or specialty practice preferred.

  • Familiarity with capitation models and financial analytics valued.

  • Detail-oriented, analytical, and strong communicator.

  • EHR/PM experience (NextGen, DrChrono, ModMed, Epic, etc.) preferred.

  • Excel/Google Sheets proficiency (VLOOKUP, pivot tables, formulas) preferred.





For interested applicants, please send your cover letters and resumes to Grace at 
 you.

title: Contracts and Proposals Specialist
description:
The Contracts and Proposals Specialist supports the Business Development team by preparing, reviewing, coordinating, and managing contracts and business proposals related to properties, owners, and real estate services. This role will work closely with internal teams to ensure all contracts and proposals are accurate, compliant, and aligned with company and regulatory standards. The position is fully remote and requires strong attention to detail, organization, and deadline management. 



Responsibilities: 

Contracts Management: 

- Draft, review, and revise contracts such as property management agreements, and service contracts, lease-related addendums, NDAs, and amendments. 

- Ensure contracts comply with company policies, local real estate regulations, and property-specific requirements. 

- Coordinate contract reviews and approvals with Legal and leadership. 

- Track contract terms, renewals, expirations, and key obligations for managed properties. 

- Maintain organized digital contract files and contract trackers. 



Proposals: 

- Collaborate with Business Development Specialist to gather scope of work, pricing, and supporting documentation. 

- Customize proposals for property owners, HOAs, and commercial or residential clients. 

- Ensure proposals meet client requirements and submission deadlines. 



Real Estate and Property Operations Support: 

- Coordinate with internal teams on contract-related billing terms and service scopes. 

- Maintain proposal templates, contract templates, and content libraries specific to property management. 



Cross-Functional Coordination: 

- Serve as the primary point of contact for contract and proposal-related inquiries. 

- Provide regular status updates on contracts and proposals to internal stakeholders. 

- Identify opportunities to improve contract and proposal workflows. 



Compliance and Documentation: 

- Ensure confidentiality and proper handling of owner, tenant, and vendor information. 

- Support audits, due diligence requests, and internal reporting as needed. 

- Perform other related duties as assigned. 



Qualifications and Experience: 

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Legal Studies, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 

- 2-3+ years of experience in contracts administration, proposals management, or a related role within property management, real estate, or construction. 

- Experience supporting residential, commercial, or mixed-use properties is a strong advantage. 

- Familiarity with real estate contracts, vendor agreements, and property management operations. 



Required Skills: 

- Strong knowledge of contracts related to property management and real estate services. 

- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills. 

- Strong written and verbal communication skills. 

- Ability to manage multiple properties, contracts, and deadlines simultaneously. 

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace. 

- Experience with contract management systems, e-signature tools, and project management platforms (e.g., Hubspot, DocuSign, SharePoint, Asana, Monday, AppFolio, Yardi, or similar tools). 

- Self-driven and able to work independently in a remote environment. 

- Strong follow-up, time management, and prioritization skills. 

- Collaborative and responsive when working with distributed teams. 

- Detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset. 



Working conditions:

- Full remote work (work anywhere).

- Work schedule is Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST) including the 30 minutes unpaid meal break.

- Comfortable working with Hubstaff (time tracker)

title: Senior PPC Account Manager
description:
ROLE SUMMARY



The Account Manager (AM) is a client-facing role responsible for supporting day-to-day success across a portfolio of marketing accounts. AMs work closely with internal teams to keep projects moving, ensure the timely delivery of campaigns and assets, and maintain strong client communication. They act as the central point of coordination, translating client needs into actionable internal tasks, and ensuring updates, follow-ups, and reporting are clear and accurate.



While strategic planning is typically owned in collaboration with Analysts, AMs must have a solid understanding of marketing fundamentals and be comfortable discussing performance results and project objectives. Success in this role requires strong communication, task management skills, and a proactive mindset to keep clients informed and engaged.



AMs are expected to use Slack and Asana regularly to manage projects, collaborate with teams, and communicate with clients. This role is ideal for professionals with marketing exposure and a strong client service foundation who are ready to take the lead on execution and client relationship management.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Client Communication & Relationship Management

Act as the day-to-day contact for assigned clients, ensuring timely responses and clear updates.

Lead recurring client calls, prepare agendas, and document action items and outcomes both internally and externally.

Deliver follow-ups, meeting recaps, and task updates to clients and internal teams using Slack,
, and Asana.

Build rapport with clients and understand their preferences, communication style, and working cadence.



Project Coordination & Task Management

Translate client requests into detailed tasks, coordinating with Analysts, Creative, and SEO teams as needed.

Own the flow of projects in Asana—setting due dates, assigning tasks, and following up on progress.

Ensure timelines are met and deliverables meet quality standards before going to the client.

Help keep clients accountable for reviews, feedback, and asset delivery.



Marketing Strategy & Performance Analysis

Understand core marketing metrics and KPIs to speak confidently about campaign trends.

Collaborate with Analysts to prepare insights and recommendations and present them clearly in client-facing updates.

Support campaign planning and optimizations by identifying strategic priorities linked to client goals.

Use tools like TapClicks and GA4 to interpret data and translate results into client-friendly updates.



Account Growth & Retention

Spot growth opportunities through performance review, client feedback, or shifting business needs.

Collaborate with internal leads to scope and pitch upsells or service expansions.

Monitor account health, flag potential churn risks early, and collaborate internally to develop 



Team Collaboration & Internal Best Practices

Work closely with Analysts, SEO, Creative, and leadership to deliver a seamless client experience.

Adhere to SOPs and workflows, maintaining high standards for delivery and communication.

Contribute to process improvement efforts, template development, and mentorship of newer tea
mbers when applicable



Process Improvement & Continuous Learning

Stay current on industry trends, new platform features, and optimization techniques.

Evaluate and test new tools and methodologies to improve campaign performance.

Proactively contribute to improving internal processes, workflow efficiency, and overall team effectiveness.

Share insights and learnings with the broader team to enhance collective knowledge.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



2+ years of experience in a client-facing role, ideally within a marketing agency or digital advertising environment.

Proven success managing accounts, particularly those involving paid media or multi-channel campaigns.

Strong communication skills, including writing client
s and presenting updates in meetings.

Familiarity with Asana (or other PM tools), Slack, and marketing performance dashboards.

Solid understanding of digital marketing channels (e.g., Google Ads, Meta) and common KPIs.

Organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple accounts and timelines simultaneously.

Collaborative mindset and a willingness to ask questions, flag issues, and support team execution.



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



3+ years of experience in an agency or client services role.

Exposure to multi-channel campaign delivery or account management.

Experience working closely with creative teams, analysts, or technical stakeholders.

Familiarity with Google Analytics, CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot), or conversion tracking.



WHY JOIN US?



Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

Unlimited PTO (Responsible PTO – take the time you need, with the expectation that it aligns with client commitments and team goals)

Flexible, remote-first work environment

Professional development opportunities

Collaborative, growth-focused culture

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Position Overview: 



As the Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and efficient functioning of the executive office. Your primary responsibility will be to provide comprehensive administrative support to the CEO, managing their schedule, and coordinating various tasks to enhance productivity. Your ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise sound judgment, and proactively handle administrative duties will contribute to the overall effectiveness of the CEO's office. 



 

Pay Range: $7 per hour with a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 

About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 

Objectives: 

• Manage and organize the CEO's daily schedule, including meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

• Act as a gatekeeper, screening and prioritizing communications to the CEO.

• Coordinate and facilitate communication between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

• Anticipate the CEO's needs and proactively handle tasks to ensure optimal time management.

• Coordinate special projects and initiatives as assigned by the CEO.



 

Competencies: 

• Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with keen attention to detail.

• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in handling sensitive information.

• Proficient in using Microsoft Office and Google Suites.

• Familiarity with scheduling software; experience with additional productivity tools is an advantage.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels.

• Proactive problem solver and resourceful thinker.



 

Equipment Requirements:  

• Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently.

• Must own and actively use an iPhone and/or MacBook or Mac computer for efficient communication and task management.

• High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work.



 

Physical Requirements: 

• Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

 

Benefits: 

• Growth opportunities in a well-established company.

• Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.

• Opportunity for advancement within the company.

• A supportive and collaborative work environment.

• Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time).

• Paid vacation.





How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalcareers



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: Process Improvement & AI Automation Specialist
description:

About the Role

We are seeking a contract Process Improvement & Automation Specialist to help streamline operations through automation, data, and intelligent use of AI-enabled tools. title: Product lister/rescreachs
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing e-commerce store focused on building scalable, high-performing products. Our current best-selling category is pillows within the sleep niche, but we are expanding beyond a single niche. We focus on strong positioning, conversion-driven pages and data-backed decision making.



About the Role

We are not looking for a basic product lister. We are looking for someone who takes ownership of product-level performance. In this role, you are responsible for finding, analyzing and scaling winning products. This includes identifying opportunities both inside and outside our current niche.



You will build complete product pages from A to Z, create high-converting pre-landers that align with ad angles, and develop scalable product templates that are ready to test and scale.



You don’t build pages. You build revenue-generating assets.



What You’ll Do

Identify products with strong scaling potential, niche-independent.

Analyze competitors and turn insights into stronger positioning.

Build full product pages with a clear conversion structure.

Create pre-landers focused on pain points, emotion and ad angles.

Optimize bundles and upsells to increase average order value.

Develop scalable product templates for fast product launches.

Work closely with marketing to test hooks and angles.



How You’ll Be Measured

Conversion rate of product pages.

Average order value growth.

Win rate of tested products.

Speed and quality of new product launches.

Pre-lander performance in combination with ads.



Who You Are

You have proven experience in product research within e-commerce.

You understand how to build product pages and pre-landers that convert.

You think in numbers, testing and optimization.

You work independently and take responsibility for results.

You are comfortable working with performance targets.



What You Get

Direct impact on revenue and scalability.

High ownership and freedom.

A performance-driven environment where results matter.

Growth opportunities toward product strategy or performance marketing.



Important

We only respond to candidates who can provide proven cases or measurable results. This includes conversion rates, AOV improvements, winning products, or clear performance metrics you have achieved.



To confirm you have fully read this post, include the word “Scale” at the bottom of your application.

title: Creative images maker
description:
We are looking for a creative and reliable person who creates high-quality images using Google Gemini.



Your main job is to generate strong marketing images with AI and prepare them for use in ads, websites, and online campaigns. You do not take photos and you do not use stock images. You create everything using AI.



This role is simple to understand, but requires skill, consistency, and good taste.



Your Main Responsibility



You create exactly 5 images per batch using Google Gemini.

Each batch must be clean, visually strong, and ready to use.



You look at what works in our market. You study competitors, ads, landing pages, and trends. You understand what style, composition, lighting, and emotion performs well. Then you recreate similar visuals using Google Gemini and finalize them in Canva if needed.



Every week or month, you will receive new winning creatives from us or from a tea
mber. These winning examples are your starting point. You build new creatives based on what already performs well.



You will also receive access to Excel reports or our Ads Manager, so you can clearly see which images are performing best inside our ad account. This helps you understand what actually works in real campaigns and create smarter next batches.



If a 4-year-old asks what you do, the answer would be:

“I look at good pictures, make similar pictures with Gemini, and send 5 pictures.”



Tools You Must Use



Google Gemini is the main tool for generating images.

ChatGPT is used to help create prompts, ideas, and concepts.

Canva is used for layout, resizing, text, and small improvements.



Understanding how AI works is not optional. You must know how prompting, iteration, consistency, and visual control works.



Market Awareness



You must constantly observe what is happening in our niche.

You copy what already works in the market and translate it into new AI-generated visuals.

This role is focused on performance and conversion, not personal artistic expression.



Quality Expectations



Images must look professional and realistic when needed.

Lighting, framing, and composition must make sense.

Text must be readable when used.

Images must be consistent with brand direction.

Files must be delivered in correct format and resolution.



Payment



You are paid per batch.

1 batch = 5 images.



The number of batches will be discussed during the interview and can change based on workload and company growth.



Growth Opportunities



As the company grows, you may:

Work with additional AI tools

Take more responsibility

Help shape creative direction

Increase workload and earnings



Flexibility and curiosity are important.



Who This Role Is For



You already use Google Gemini confidently.

You understand AI image generation deeply.

You can follow instructions accurately.

You can replicate styles and trends.

You work independently and meet deadlines.

You care about clean output and consistency.

You are comfortable looking at simple performance data in Excel or Ads Manager.



How To Apply



Send a short message about your experience with:

Google Gemini

AI image generation

Canva

Working with data or ads dashboards



At the end of your application, include this secret word so we know you read everything carefully:



Secret word: “SUN TIGER”



Applications without the secret word will not be reviewed.

title: Merchandising Assistant
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking an Ecommerce Merchandising Assistant with hands-on experience managing product content across multiple retailer portals. This role will support our Salsify Product Owner in syndicating and optimizing product data for Wayfair, Walmart, Amazon, and other key partners. Experience with Home Depot, Target, Lowe’s, and Kohl’s is a strong plus. • Proven experience working with multiple major retailers (Wayfair, Walmart, Amazon required; Home Depot, Target, Lowe’s, Kohl’s a plus).

• Experience with Salsify (or similar PIM platforms).

• Strong organizational skills, with a focus on accuracy and detail.

• Ability to juggle multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.



Why Join Us

• Opportunity to work with a broad and diverse ecommerce product portfolio.

• Hands-on experience with leading retailers and product syndication technology.

• Collaborative team environment with growth potential in ecommerce merchandising.

• Play a key role in helping products go live across today’s top online retailers.

title: Professional Grant Researcher/writer/proposal
description:
Job Vacancy Announcement



Job Title: Part-Time / Gig Grant Writer & Researcher

Company: Potomac Nova Inc.

Work Location: Remote / Online

Job Type: Gig or Part-Time

Work Hours: Flexible, up to 20 hours per week

Compensation: Hourly, based on experience and agreed work hours



Job Summary:

Potomac Nova Inc. is a newly established startup business seeking a dependable and experienced Grant Writer & Researcher to support ongoing funding and growth efforts. This role is offered as a gig-based or part-time opportunity with flexible scheduling and the potential for expanded responsibilities as the business grows.



We are seeking a professional who can work independently, follow additional instructions as needed, and collaborate effectively in a startup environment. The ideal candidate is friendly, patient, committed, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing both structured tasks and evolving responsibilities.



The grant writer will receive daily grant opportunities provided by the company and will also have access to the business’s grant and funding community, which offers valuable insights, updates, and informational resources to support successful grant applications.



Key Responsibilities:



Grant Research, Review & Monitoring:

- Review and evaluate daily grant opportunities provided by Potomac Nova Inc.

- Conduct independent grant research when appropriate.

- Monitor grant opportunities for updates, changes, and new requirements.

- Track eligibility, deadlines, funding cycles, and reapplication timelines.



Grant Writing & Proposal Development:

- Write clear, persuasive, and well-organized grant proposals.

- Accurately present business goals, services, and funding needs.

- Align proposals with funder priorities and submission guidelines.

- Follow additional instructions or revisions provided by management.



Application Submission & Deadline Management:

- Prepare and submit complete grant applications by required deadlines.

- Ensure all required forms, attachments, and supporting documents are accurate.

- Maintain a detailed tracking system for submission dates, deadlines, award notifications, declines, and reapplication or renewal dates.



Editing, Review & Quality Control:

- Proofread and edit proposals for accuracy, clarity, and professionalism.

- Revise submissions based on feedback or updated instructions.

- Ensure consistency across all grant materials.



Tracking, Organization & Reporting:

- Maintain an organized grant database or spreadsheet with full grant details.

- Monitor grant status and follow-up requirements.

- Provide regular updates on application progress, outcomes, and next steps.

- Identify opportunities for reapplication or future funding cycles.



Independent Work & Future Tasks:

- Work independently with minimal supervision while meeting deadlines.

- Adapt to additional tasks and responsibilities as the business grows.

- Assist with related administrative or research tasks when needed.

- Support long-term grant planning and funding strategy development.



Qualifications:



Required:

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Proven experience in grant writing and grant research.

- Strong organizational and deadline-management skills.

- Ability to work independently and follow detailed instructions.

- Comfortable managing multiple grants simultaneously.



Experience:

- Minimum 1–5 years of grant writing experience preferred.

- Experience working with startups businesses, or service-based organizations is a plus.



Skills:

- Strong research and analytical abilities.

- Professional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.

- Excellent time management and attention to detail.

- Proficiency with Google Workspace and Microsoft Office.



Personal Qualities We Value:

- Self-motivated and dependable.

- Friendly, patient, and professional.

- Organized and detail-oriented.

- Open to collaboration and sharing ideas.

- Flexible and adaptable to evolving responsibilities.



What We Offer:

- Gig or part-time remote opportunity.

- Flexible scheduling (up to 20 hours per week).

- Hourly compensation based on experience and output.

- Daily grant opportunities provided by the company.

- Access to the business’s grant and funding community.

- Opportunity to grow with a startup and take on expanded responsibilities.



How to Apply:

Please submit:

- Resume highlighting grant writing experience.

- Grant writing samples (sensitive information may be redacted).

- A brief video introduction describing your experience and work style.

- References or testimonials (if available).

About Potomac Nova Inc.:

Potomac Nova Inc. is a newly formed startup focused on business development in the beauty industry, selling on-line products, strategic consulting, and funding support. We value collaboration, patience, integrity, and long-term working relationships.

title: On-Demand Copywriter (Personal Brand & Business Writing)
description:
I’m looking for a copywriter I can work with on an ongoing basis. This role is for someone who can take time upfront to research me and my content, understand my voice and what I do, and then be ready to write copy whenever I need it.



Tasks will include writing things like “who I am / what I do” descriptions, website copy, and other brand-related content. I’m looking for someone reliable, detail-oriented, and able to match my tone consistently.



This is long-term, on-demand work for the right person.



Requirements:

- Strong copywriting and writing skills

title: Customer Experience Virtual Assistant (Phone Based)
description:
Customer Experience Virtual Assistant (Phone-Based, Process-Driven)



Job Overview



Are you someone who takes pride in handling customer interactions the right way—calmly, professionally, and consistently? Do you do well with clear expectations, scripts, and processes, and enjoy improving quickly through feedback? If so, Maid In America Cleaning Services, based in Clarksville, TN, wants to hear from you.



We’re seeking a Customer Experience Virtual Assistant to serve as a frontline point of contact for our customers and a dependable executor of structured processes. Working closely with our sales and customer experience teams, you’ll be responsible for answering inbound calls, handling customer requests, following defined scripts, and routing issues accurately.



This role is process-driven and phone-heavy, especially during training. The work can be fast-paced at times, but it is highly structured. Your ability to stay calm, follow instructions precisely, and take coaching seriously will have a direct impact on customer satisfaction and team efficiency.



What You’ll Do



- Answer & Handle Inbound Customer Calls: Be the first point of contact for customers and new inquiries, answering calls promptly, professionally, and calmly while following provided phone scripts.

- Follow Scripts & Decision Trees: Handle common customer needs—such as scheduling questions, reschedules, basic service inquiries, and initial issue intake—by following clear scripts and escalation rules exactly.

- Route Requests Accurately: Determine when a request can be handled directly and when it should be escalated to the appropriate tea
mber, ensuring clean handoffs and no dropped balls.

- Create a Positive Customer Experience: Make customers feel heard, cared for, and confident that their request is being handled, even when issues or complaints arise.

- Document Interactions & Updates: Log accurate notes and updates in our systems so the internal team always has clear context and next steps.

- Support Structured Administrative Workflows: Execute defined backend processes (task tracking, updates, file movement, and follow-through) by following SOPs and checklists without skipping steps.

- Receive Coaching & Improve Quickly: Actively apply feedback on calls, scripts, and workflows, improving speed, accuracy, and confidence over time.



Who We’re Looking For



- Process-Driven & Detail-Oriented: You’re comfortable following scripts, checklists, and SOPs exactly, and you don’t skip steps or “freestyle” your work.

- Calm & Professional on the Phone: You communicate clearly and confidently, stay composed with customers, and can handle questions or mild frustration without getting flustered.

- Highly Coachable: You take feedback seriously, apply it quickly, and improve fast—especially when it comes to phone scripts and customer handling.

- Reliable & Consistent: You show up on time, follow through on tasks, and can be counted on to do things the right way every time.

- Comfortable with Structure: You prefer clear expectations, defined processes, and knowing exactly what “good” looks like in your role.

- Tech-Comfortable: You’re comfortable working inside tools like Slack, shared documents, and task systems—or you can learn them quickly with instructions.

- Strong Communicator: Whether by phone, chat, or written notes, you communicate clearly, professionally, and respectfully.



Our Core Values



- Walk by Faith

- Maximize Opportunity

- Give Freely

- Train Daily

- Do What You Say



If you share these values, we want you on our team to help drive our company forward.



Important Note: Screening Step



SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY:

Complete our personality test to see if there’s a mutual fit:


/p/fzxN5FC9302s 

Give honest answers; there are no right or wrong results.



Submit your application with the subject line beginning with the core value we’ve listed that you most resonate with.



IMPORTANT: When applying, please use AT LEAST 5 Apply Points



Skills & Requirements

- Fluent English: Strong spoken and written English is required. This is a phone-based role, and customers must be able to understand you clearly and comfortably.

- Customer Service Experience: Prior experience handling customer inquiries or support requests over the phone is required.

- Process & Administrative Competence: You’re comfortable following multi-step processes, documenting information accurately, and keeping systems up to date.

- Attention to Detail: You consistently capture the right information, follow instructions precisely, and avoid careless errors.

- Coachability: You’re open to feedback, willing to be corrected, and able to apply coaching quickly—especially when learning phone scripts and customer-handling expectations.

- Technical Readiness:

  - Reliable computer with backup power options

  - Quality headset and microphone

  - Quiet workspace suitable for phone calls

- Ability to Work Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM CST.

- Reliable Internet & Backup Options: Stable internet connection with a backup plan to ensure consistent availability and responsiveness.



Why Join Maid In America Cleaning Services?



- Impactful Role: Your quick execution and initiative will directly affect customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

- Growth-Oriented Culture: We embrace new ideas, reward proactive thinking, and train daily for continual improvement.

- Supportive Team: Collaborate with a group that values each other’s contributions and thrives on a feedback-rich environment.



If you’re passionate about productivity, eager to work in a fast-paced setting, and confident in your ability to deliver high-quality results quickly, apply now and become an integral part of the Maid In America family!



Apply Today: Submit your application per the instructions above. We look forward to learning more about you!

title: Meta Ads Creative Manager (US EST Hours)
description:
Hunter Digital Marketing is seeking a Meta Ads Creative Manager to own the hands-on creation and optimization of high-performing ad creative for Meta platforms. This role is execution-driven and highly tactical, focused on generating sales through paid social using a combination of client-provided assets, AI-generated creative, and performance insights.



This is a junior-to-mid-level role (3+ years experience) designed for a creative who understands how design, copy, and motion directly impact ad performance. The role works closely with Paid Media Managers and reports into senior creative leadership.



Must work U.S. EST Hours.

---



Key Responsibilities



* Create high-performing Meta ad images and videos using client-provided assets, including photography, video clips, UGC, and brand guidelines.

* Use AI creative tools (including Nano Banana, VEO 3 and similar platforms) to generate images and videos for clients with limited or no usable assets.

* Design and implement strong text overlays for static and video ads, including hooks, value propositions, and CTAs that are often not provided in the brief.

* Write or refine ad copy and headlines aligned to performance goals, audience intent, and platform best practices.

* Adapt creative for multiple formats and placements (Feed, Reels, Stories), ensuring technical accuracy and visual clarity.

* Conduct competitor and market creative research, analyzing winning and losing ad creatives to inform new concepts and iterations.

* Collaborate closely with Paid Media Managers to support testing plans, creative refreshes, and performance-driven iterations.

* Maintain a high level of attention to detail, ensuring all creative consistently follows brand guidelines, tone, and visual standards.



---



Required Qualifications



* 3+ years of experience creating performance-driven ad creative for Meta 
 and Instagram).

* Strong hands-on experience with Canva, including advanced layout, animation, and video editing features.

* Proven ability to use AI tools to generate images and videos that are commercially viable and conversion-focused.

* Demonstrated understanding of what drives sales through Meta Ads, including hooks, offers, formats, and creative angles.

* Experience working with a variety of U.S.-based consumer brands, such as apparel, furniture, home goods, food, or similar categories.

* Ability to independently generate creative ideas and execute them quickly without heavy direction.

* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple creative requests in a fast-paced environment.



---



What This Role Is Not



* This is not a brand-level or conceptual creative role.

* This is not a pure design or production role detached from performance outcomes.



Success in this role is measured by speed, quality, and performance impact of creative assets in live Meta campaigns.

description:

CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

title: Systems Coordinator
description:
Position Overview:  



The Systems Coordinator is responsible for creating, managing, and troubleshooting automation workflows in GoHighLevel (GHL) to support efficient operations across the company. This role requires at least one year of hands-on experience in GHL or a similar automation platform, along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. In addition to system automation, this person will assist the Admin Operations Team with various ad hoc tasks and continuously seek opportunities to optimize workflows, eliminate inefficiencies, and enhance team productivity. 



 



Pay Range: $8 per hourwith a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 



About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems, LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 



Objectives: 



Build, maintain, and troubleshoot automation workflows in GoHighLevel to support streamlined operations. 



Monitor performance of active automations to ensure accuracy, functionality, and timely resolution of system issues. 



Work closely with the Operations Manager to understand workflow needs and translate them into effective and efficient automations, while coordinating with Admin Operations and other departments as needed. 



Identify inefficiencies in current processes and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 



Assist the Admin Operations Team with various administrative and operational tasks, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. 



Troubleshoot and resolve Admin Operations Help Tickets with a customer-service–focused approach. 



Manage and update pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, and integrations as needed. 



Ensure all GHL data, workflows, and configurations are maintained accurately and consistently. 



 



Competencies: 



Strong understanding of automation logic, workflows, and pipeline management. 



High attention to detail to ensure accurate configuration and troubleshooting of automation sequences. 



Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify system gaps and propose solutions. 



Strong written and verbal communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. 



Proficiency in GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms (HubSpot, Zapier, Make, Zoho, ActiveCampaign, etc.). 



Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. 



Proactive mindset with a drive for continuous improvement. 



Customer service orientation when supporting internal stakeholders. 



 



Equipment Requirements: 



Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently. 



High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work. 



 



Education and Experience: 



At least one year of hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms. 



Experience in operations, administrative support, or systems management is a plus. 



Familiarity with CRM logic, automation mapping, or workflow design is strongly preferred. 



 



Physical Requirements: 



Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. 



 



Benefits: 



Growth opportunities in a well-established company. 



Ongoing training and professional development opportunities. 



Opportunity for advancement within the company. 



A supportive and collaborative work environment. 



Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time). 



Paid vacation. 



 



How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalform 



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: Paid Media Account Analyst
description:
ROLE SUMMARY

The Paid Media Account Analyst is a skilled digital marketing professional with 2+ years of hands-on paid ads experience. This role centers on tactical implementation, managing and optimizing multi-channel campaigns across platforms like Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, and programmatic. Account Analysts are expected to take full ownership of campaign execution and performance, confidently managing the day-to-day health of their accounts with minimal oversight. While they collaborate with Senior Account Analysts and Account Managers to shape broader strategy, they are accountable for translating those plans into results. They also play a key role in supporting junior analysts by offering mentorship, feedback, and tactical guidance.



Ideal candidates should be comfortable analyzing performance data, identifying optimization opportunities, and executing media strategies with precision. They should have a solid understanding of cross-channel and full-funnel marketing, enabling them to connect tactical execution with broader client goals. Effective collaboration with account managers and other analysts is essential, as is the ability to clearly communicate results, insights, and tactical recommendations to internal teams.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Campaign Management & Optimization

Build, manage, and optimize paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, Programmatic) independently and with the guidance of senior tea
mbers.

Conduct regular performance analysis, making adjustments to budgets, bids, and targeting to meet KPIs.

Ensure campaigns consistently align with client objectives and strategic guidelines.

Leverage cross-channel insights to optimize the customer journey and maximize ROAS.



Strategic Support & Insight Generation

Execute tactical plans based on strategic guidance from senior analysts and strategists.

Analyze performance data to identify short-term optimization opportunities and tactical improvements.

Provide platform-specific recommendations to enhance campaign performance within established strategic frameworks.



Quality Assurance & Accuracy

Conduct thorough quality assurance checks on campaigns, ensuring correct implementation of tracking and budgets.

Maintain high accuracy and attention to detail across all deliverables.

Correct and proactively address any issues before client delivery.



Team Collaboration & Mentorship

Support junior analysts with tactical execution and platform best practices.

Contribute to onboarding and training initiatives, sharing tactical knowledge regularly.

Foster a collaborative, execution-focused team environment that emphasizes precision and efficiency.



Cross-Functional Communication

Work closely with Account Managers and cross-functional teams to execute campaign tactics effectively.

Clearly communicate performance insights, tactical updates, and optimization recommendations to internal stakeholders.

Participate in client calls when necessary to provide tactical support and platform insights.



Process Improvement & Continuous Learning

Stay current on industry trends, new platform features, and optimization techniques.

Evaluate and test new tools and methodologies to improve campaign performance.

Share insights and learnings with the broader team to enhance collective knowledge.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

2+ years of hands-on experience managing multi-platform paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, programmatic).

Strong grasp of campaign optimization, budget management, and platform-specific best practices.

Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting complex data sets.

Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Proficiency with communication and project management tools (Asana and Slack).



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

3+ years of hands-on experience managing multi-platform paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, programmatic).

Experience managing mid-level accounts or diverse client portfolios across multiple industries.

Proven track record of supporting junior analysts and contributing to team growth.

Certifications such as Google Ads and Meta Blueprint.

Familiarity with niche and growing ad platforms (e.g., Reddit, TikTok, Criteo) or advanced programmatic tools.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:

This position goes beyond traditional administrative support and plays a critical role in project coordination, operational follow-through, and executive leverage. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in structured chaos, can manage priorities across multiple initiatives, and ensures that important work moves forward without friction or bottlenecks.

Executive & Strategic Support

mbers and external partners to unblock work

Sales & Growth Support

Virtual Meeting & Documentation Support

Confidentiality & Trust

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

, Hubspot, etc.)

title: Utilization Review Coordinator (Healthcare Billing)
description:
We are seeking a Utilization Review (UR) Coordinator to support our healthcare billing and utilization review team. This role is focused on assisting UR Specialists with insurance authorizations, denial management, and documentation to ensure patients receive timely approvals for care.



The ideal candidate has experience in healthcare billing, utilization review, or insurance processes, and is highly detail-oriented with excellent organizational and communication skills.



Key Responsibilities



Assist UR Specialists in securing insurance authorizations for behavioral health patients at all levels of care.

Conduct EMR audits and reconcile data with Salesforce to ensure accurate records.

Schedule and coordinate peer reviews with providers and insurance carriers.

Request, track, and upload denial letters into Salesforce.

Manage AOR (Assignment of Rights) reports in collaboration with UR Leadership.

Use multiple systems including KIPU, Salesforce, EMRs, SharePoint, and Microsoft Office Suite.

Research patient cases and collaborate with insurance carriers to support authorization requests.

Document and annotate phone calls with facilities and carriers to maintain compliance.

Work closely with the UR team to resolve authorization and denial issues.

Continuously build knowledge of behavioral health terminology and insurance guidelines.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred (Healthcare Administration, Psychology, Nursing, or related field a plus).

Experience in utilization review, medical billing, or insurance processes required.

Familiarity with EMRs (KIPU or similar) and Salesforce preferred.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and manage deadlines.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

High attention to detail and accuracy.

Comfortable handling sensitive patient information with confidentiality.



To apply, please fill out the form below:

title: Remote SDR (Amplemarket Specialist) | B2B AI Compliance SaaS
description:
The Mission at TIKOS



TIKOS® is a research-led, UK based start-up focused on Trustworthy AI. The Company is developing technology to test and monitor AI systems in high-stakes regulated environments, such as Financial Services, Defence, and Healthcare.





The Opportunity



The global AI Assurance market will be worth $235B by 2030. TIKOS® has developed patent-pending technology that enables organisations to comply with new laws, mandating that their AI systems are safe, secure and robust. Having established a technological edge, we are now expanding our customer development activities to secure more Proof-of-Concept (PoC) project with early customers.





Your Role 



We are not looking for a script-reader. We need a strategic prospector who can navigate regulatory triggers (like the EU AI Act) and a technical compliance landscape to book discovery calls with C-suite risk, security and data leaders.





Your Toolkit



Amplemarket (Essential): You must be a power user with at least 2 years experience. You will manage our AI-driven sequences, lead signals, and omnichannel outreach.

LinkedIn Sales Navigator (Essential): You know how to move past the noise to engage with CISOs, Heads of Risk, CDOs, Heads of AI.





What You Will Do



Set up and manage high-intent Amplemarket sequences targeting personas/lists in regulated sectors, including LinkedIn/Sales Navigator/
 messaging and (founder's) calendar management. There is no cold call or telephone requirement.

Own the top of the funnel by booking qualified discovery calls and managing partner introductions.

Feedback to the founders to iterate campaigns.





The Deal



Starting at 50,000 PHP per month base.

Significant uncapped bonuses for qualified meetings held.

100% remote, with daily stand-ups, weekly review/planning sessions, part UK hours cross-over. All tools and marketing assets provided (you will be expected to provide local hardware/internet).

Position is offered on a remote sub-contractor basis.





Requirements



Proven Track Record. 3+ years of outbound SDR experience in B2B SaaS.

Industry/Territory experience. You must have previous demonstrable success in UK or European markets in at least one of these B2B sectors: Cyber/IT security, Compliance, AI Tooling/infrastructure, Dev Tools. Experience developing opportunities in regulated sectors a distinct advantage (e.g. Financial Services, Defence, Healthcare).

Tool Mastery. Advanced proficiency in Amplemarket and LinkedIn/Linkedin Sales Navigator.

English Fluency. Professional-level written and verbal communication is non-negotiable for our target sectors.
