title: Dispute Manager
description:
Dispute Manager for Ecom Fashion Store



Hey there!

We’re looking for a Dispute Manager to join our Ecom Fashion Dropshipping Store.

We’re a fast-growing e-commerce company operating in the Usa.

This is a key backend position — you’ll be fully responsible for handling, managing, and winning disputes, while also preventing them from happening again.

We’re building a long-term team of A-players who want to grow with us — not just for a few weeks, but for the long run.



What We’re Looking For



Minimum 1 year of experience successfully handling disputes in e-commerce or fashion dropshipping.

Proven experience winning disputes and building strong evidence-based cases.

Familiar with dispute reasons such as wrong sizing, long shipping times, poor quality, and miscommunication.

Ability to collect, structure, and submit strong evidence (e.g., tracking info, customer communication, product photos).

Experienced in working with payment platforms (PayPal, Stripe, Shopify Payments, etc.).

Strong communication skills for coordinating with:



The Order Issue Manager

The Customer Support team

The Supplier

Fluent in English for clear documentation and communication.

Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented — you take ownership of every case.

Availability to work in the [insert timezone] timezone.



Your Main Tasks



Manage all incoming disputes from payment processors.

Investigate each dispute carefully and collect relevant evidence.

Build detailed dispute cases with screenshots, tracking, communication logs, and delivery proof.

Submit cases on time and follow up until each one is resolved.

Work directly with Customer Support and Order Issue Management to fix recurring causes.

Communicate with suppliers to verify shipment and product quality details.

Track dispute statistics and keep an internal record of all cases and results.

Implement prevention strategies to reduce future disputes.



Compensation & Bonuses



Base pay depending on experience.

Bonus structure for each won dispute — paid per successful case.

Weekly or bi-weekly payouts (depending on agreement).



What We Offer



Long-term position (we’re looking for someone to stay 6+ months minimum).

A structured environment with clear SOPs and templates for dispute handling.

Communication and task management via Slack.

Collaboration with a strong, professional team.

Growth opportunities as we expand into multiple stores and markets.



What to Expect After You Apply



If we think you’re a fit, we’ll send you a short video explaining exactly how we work, what your daily tasks will look like, and what we expect from you.

After watching the video, you can respond with your thoughts — and if it feels like a good match, we’ll schedule a call to discuss the next steps.



Important



Only apply if:

You’ve read this entire post carefully.

You meet all the requirements listed above.

You’re experienced with dispute handling in e-commerce (preferably fashion).

You’re serious about joining a long-term team that values responsibility and accuracy.

If that’s you — we can’t wait to meet you.

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Logistics Coordinator

Type: Remote

FLSA: Exempt

Reports to: Director of Logistics





SUMMARY:

GreenTree Freight, sister company of Creative Packaging, is a dynamic and growing freight transportation company committed to delivering reliable and efficient logistics solutions. The Logistics Coordinator will coordinate the movement of freight, ensuring timely deliveries to warehouses and freezers, and maintaining up-to-date data on company platforms.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Review and respond to
s from Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) regarding orders and deliveries for the assigned sites.

• Receive LAP (Load Appointment Plan) releases and update the corresponding spreadsheet tab.

• Track and adapt to constant schedule changes from the production team.

• Communicate updates promptly to stakeholders.

• Handle code requests from the sales team for potential new customers.

• Maintain clear communication with drivers to ensure they understand their schedules.

• Notify drivers promptly of any schedule changes.

• Communicate with freezer partners to coordinate storage and deliveries.

• Analyze delivery routes to ensure efficiency and compliance with driver hour regulations.

• Accurately enter and maintain logistics data in the Alvis system.

• Submit requests for quotes through Emerge to support pricing and logistics planning.



REQUIREMENTS:



• Proven experience as a Logistics Coordinator.

• Proficient in Microsoft Office programs.

• Excellent organizational and coordination abilities.

• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

• Strong problem-solving skills.

• Must be able to work remotely with little to no supervision.

• Logistics experience in America (Preferred)

• Ability to multitask and effectively manage time.



EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

• High School Diploma or G.E.D. equivalent required.

• Two to three years of office related experience preferred; an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform required functions of the job.

• Ability to work independently and as a team to meet goals, objectives, and deadlines.



The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. The duties listed above are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position

title: AI-Powered Short Form Video Editor
description:
We are a fast-paced DTC brand in the personal care space. We are building a high-volume creative engine and need a Short-Form Performance Video Editor who is obsessed with the intersection of storytelling and generative technology.

This isn't just an "editing" job. You are the director of the entire production. You will be responsible for generating the images, transforming them into AI video assets, and then stitching those assets together into high-performing ads or organic posts that tell stories about relatable (and sometimes awkward) human problems. You understand that "Raw & Candid" beats "Polished & Corporate" every time.

You understand that the first 3 seconds of an ad are everything. 

You know how to take raw UGC Content and elevate it into high-converting pieces. 

You know how to implement AI tools, video and image generation of custom b-roll that matches our brand aesthetic perfectly, and more.

You know how to create consistent AI animation characters and AI UGC. 

You can easily edit in both English and Spanish (preferably)

If you are already experimenting with the latest AI video models to speed up your workflow and improve ad performance, we want to talk to you.

The Details:

Location: Remote (Preference for candidates in LATAM).

Hours: Full Time

Payment: Pay-Per-Asset (Output-Based) We pay for performance and volume. Our structure is designed to reward efficiency; the faster and more proficient you are with your AI workflow, the more you earn.

Tasks you will be responsible for:

Ad Creation: Taking winning scripts and raw footage to create high-converting video ads.

Full AI Asset Generation: Using tools like Kling, Veo3, and Higgsfield to create realistic "
nts of realization" and AI UGC that feels authentic.

AI Animation & Stylization: Creating unique AI-animated characters or stylized visuals that go beyond standard footage to explain our products.

Hook Iteration: Rapidly creating 5–10 different "hooks" for a single ad to test performance.

Sound Design: Ensuring every ad has "scroll-stopping" audio and pacing.

High-Volume Iteration: Rapidly spinning up 10+ different AI-generated hooks for a single script to test different "angles" of body odor/hygiene pain points.

Prompt Creation & Documentation: Deep understanding of how to structure prompts for image and video models. Ability to create, follow, and contribute to internal SOPs by documenting successful prompts and workflows to ensure creative consistency.



Requirements

This is NOT a position for:

Traditional editors who are resistant to using AI.

People who only know how to do "vlog-style" editing.

Editors who don't understand direct-response marketing (CTAs, hooks, and retention).

For this role, we need someone with:

AI Proficiency: You must be highly proficient using Veo3, Nano Banana Pro, Higgsfield AI, Elevenlabs, Kling and other tools to generate video and image assets.

Performance Experience: specific to DTC brands.

Visual Taste: The ability to make AI-generated content look seamless, high-end and consistent, not "uncanny" or "cheap."

Language: Native level of English and preferably Spanish. 

Speed: You are excited by the challenge of a high-output environment

What We Can Offer You

100% Remote: Work from anywhere.

Steady flow of work and continuous feedback

Competitive pay 

Creative Freedom: We want you to experiment. If a new AI tool comes out, we want you to be the first to test it.

To be considered, you must include:

Your Portfolio: Show us your best performance ads.

AI Samples: Show us examples of b-roll or videos you’ve generated using AI.

Trial: There will be a short, paid trial task to test your understanding of story telling, your eye for high performing content, AI generation and editing speed.



THIS IS THE LEVEL OF EDITING, STORYTELLING AND ENGAGING CONTENT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:









If this sounds like you, APPLY HERE:

title: URGENT!  >>Website Project Manager – USA ET, ++Health Benefits ++BONUS ++PAID Holidays & Vacation ++Family Leave
description:
Project Manager - Performance SEO

About the Role

JSA Interactive is looking for a results-driven Performance SEO Manager to own and scale organic growth across our portfolio of websites. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who blends deep SEO expertise with strong project ownership and a commercial mindset.



You will be responsible for turning SEO strategy into measurable performance — traffic growth, lead generation, conversion improvement, and revenue impact. This role is not about ticking boxes or managing tasks; it’s about driving outcomes, prioritising what moves the needle, and leading cross-functional teams to execution.



Core Accountability:

- Organic traffic growth, lead volume, and conversion performance

- SEO strategy development and execution across multiple websites

- Prioritisation of SEO initiatives based on ROI and business impact

- Delivery quality, timelines, and performance reporting

- Continuous optimisation in response to algorithm changes and data insights



Key Responsibilities:

- SEO Strategy & Performance

- Develop and execute performance-focused SEO strategies aligned with business goals.

- Own keyword strategy, search intent mapping, and content prioritisation.

- Translate SEO opportunities into clear, actionable roadmaps with measurable KPIs.

- Monitor rankings, traffic, conversions, and revenue attribution, and adjust strategy accordingly.



Technical SEO & Website Performance:

- Oversee technical SEO health including site speed, indexing, crawlability, and on-page structure.

- Work closely with developers and designers to ensure SEO best practices are implemented at scale.

- Guide website launches, redesigns, and migrations with SEO-first execution.



On-Page, Off-Page & Content Optimisation:

- Drive on-page optimisation across content, metadata, internal linking, and UX signals.

- Lead and oversee off-page SEO efforts including backlink strategy and link acquisition.

- Collaborate with content teams to create and optimise high-quality, conversion-focused SEO content.



Project Leadership & Execution:

- Lead cross-functional teams (SEO, content, design, development) to deliver SEO initiatives on time and at high quality.

- Own planning, prioritisation, and quality assurance using tools like Asana and Google Sheets.

- Identify risks, remove blockers, and adapt plans as needed to protect performance outcomes.



Analysis, Reporting & Insights:

- Track and analyse SEO performance using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and Ahrefs.

- Produce clear, decision-driven reporting that links SEO activity to business results.



Use data to identify opportunities, diagnose issues, and guide strategic decisions.



Competitive & Market Intelligence:

- Conduct ongoing competitor analysis to identify gaps, threats, and growth opportunities.

- Stay ahead of algorithm updates, industry trends, and best practices — and proactively adjust strategy.



Local SEO (Where Applicable)

- Manage and optimise local SEO strategies to improve geographic visibility and lead generation.



What Success Looks Like:

- Consistent growth in organic traffic, qualified leads, and conversions

- SEO initiatives clearly tied to revenue and business impact

- Strong collaboration and execution across teams

- Clear prioritisation — focusing on what drives results, not busywork

- Proactive optimisation in response to performance data and algorithm changes



Required Skills & Experience:

- Proven experience leading performance-driven SEO campaigns

- Strong technical SEO knowledge (on-page, off-page, and site architecture)

- Experience managing SEO projects end-to-end with real accountability

- Solid understanding of website design and development from an SEO perspective

- Confident decision-maker who can prioritise, push back, and lead

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Tools & Platforms:

- Asana (or similar project management tools)

- Google Analytics & Google Search Console

- Ahrefs (or equivalent SEO tools)

- Google Sheets & Google Docs



Ideal Candidate Profile:

- Obsessed with results, not vanity metrics

- Comfortable owning performance and being accountable for outcomes

- Strategic, but not afraid to get hands-on

- Confident leading cross-functional teams

- Data-driven, commercially minded, and proactive



What We Offer:

- Fully remote work environment

- Paid training and onboarding

- Monthly performance bonuses

- Paid vacation and paid holidays

- Opportunity for raises or bonuses after 60 days based on performance

- Supportive, collaborative global team culture



Work Hours:

- 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM Manila time

- Time monitoring app required



Why Join Us:

- Long-term role with growth and stability

- Opportunity to work on diverse client websites across industries

- Performance-driven culture that rewards reliability and results

- Collaborative, fast-paced environment with room to grow



To apply, please click on the following link:

title: Software Developer
description:
Perfect — you want the role to cover not just the construction project management platform, but also the back-office modules (estimating, bookkeeping, and company dashboards with user management). I’ll update the job description to reflect that scope clearly.



?



Full-Stack Software Engineer – Construction Project Management & Back-Office SaaS



About Us


 is a startup building next-generation tools for the construction industry. Our goal is to create a unified platform that manages every aspect of a construction business—project execution, estimating, bookkeeping, and company-wide collaboration.



We’re looking for a highly skilled Full-Stack Software Engineer who can design, build, and launch a robust SaaS platform that serves as both a construction project management tool and a back-office business solution. This role involves full ownership of product development—front-end, back-end, and integrations.



?



Responsibilities

 • Core Product Development: Build a complete SaaS solution that covers both project management (field-side) and back-office operations (estimating, accounting, reporting).

 • Architecture & Design: Define scalable architecture for multi-module software, including construction workflows, finance modules, and company dashboards.

 • Front-End Development: Create an intuitive UI/UX for:

 • Project dashboards

 • Scheduling (Gantt charts, timelines, milestones)

 • Estimating and cost proposals

 • Invoicing and bookkeeping tools

 • Company dashboard with multi-user roles

 • Back-End Development: Develop APIs, secure authentication, role-based access, and data systems to power:

 • Estimating workflows (bid proposals, cost libraries, markup, profit margins)

 • Bookkeeping (invoices, payments, expense tracking, reports)

 • Document management and versioning

 • Team communication and notifications

 • Company Dashboard & User Management: Build a central admin panel where company leaders can:

 • Add and manage multiple users (admins, project managers, accountants, field staff)

 • Control permissions by role

 • Generate custom reports and analytics

 • Integrations: Enable integrations with third-party systems (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero, Procore, or payment gateways).

 • Security & Compliance: Ensure financial and project data is handled securely, with compliance to relevant standards.

 • Scalability: Ensure the platform can support multiple companies, projects, and financial records at once.



?



Qualifications



Technical Skills

 • Proficiency in front-end frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue).

 • Strong back-end experience (Node.js, Python/Django, Ruby on Rails, or similar).

 • Knowledge of databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).

 • Experience building financial/estimating systems (invoicing, cost tracking, payment flows).

 • Strong understanding of APIs (REST/GraphQL).

 • Cloud deployment expertise (AWS, GCP, Azure).

 • Familiarity with real-time systems (WebSockets, Firebase).

 • Authentication & permissions (OAuth, JWT, SSO, RBAC).

 • DevOps (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes).



Soft Skills

 • Ability to design intuitive workflows for both construction managers and office staff.

 • Strong analytical skills for building accurate estimating & bookkeeping modules.

 • Entrepreneurial mindset and self-driven builder.

 • Excellent communication skills for collaborating with founders, designers, and early users.



?



Preferred Background

 • 3–7 years of experience in full-stack SaaS development.

 • Prior experience building multi-module business applications (ERP, accounting, or project management).

 • Exposure to construction tech or fintech platforms.



?



Why Join 
?

 • Opportunity to design and launch a platform that covers both field and back-office construction workflows.

 • Direct ownership of product development decisions.

 • Work on a startup solving real-world problems in construction and business management.

 • Competitive compensation + equity opportunities.



How to Apply



Send your resume, GitHub/portfolio links, and a short note about why you’re excited to work with us.

title: DIGITAL MARKETING EXECUTION ASSISTANT (NO TRAINING PROVIDED)

I am not looking for someone who needs to be taught marketing.



I need someone who can EXECUTE.

You will:

• Create high-converting short-form content (hooks, captions, CTAs)

• Repurpose long-form content into viral short clips

• Schedule content across platforms

• Write
 & SMS marketing copy using provided frameworks

• Assist in Meta Ads Manager (upload creatives, write ad copy, monitor performance)

• Track metrics and report weekly

• Follow marketing frameworks exactly



This is a performance based role.

• Not a content reposting job

GoHighLevel experience is a plus but not required.

• Must be proactive

• Must think like a marketer, not an assistant



Compensation



$5–$7/hour to start

Increases based on performance and results

Long-term growth opportunity



How to Apply (Follow Exactly)



At the top of your application write: EXECUTION MODE

 ad primary text for a webinar.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative VA - Remote 

*Keep Drivers Safe and Compliant | Prevent Problems Before They Happen*



Are you someone who finds deep satisfaction in knowing that your behind-the-scenes work keeps people safe and operations compliant? We're looking for a detail-oriented Administrative VA who understands that every training reminder, every documentation follow-up, every compliance check - these aren't just tasks, they're how we protect our drivers and maintain operational integrity.



This role is about being the safety net that catches things before they become problems. You'll be the person who notices when a driver's medical certification is about to expire, who ensures a
 documentation is ready for FedEx within 24 hours, who keeps everyone on the right side of compliance. 



 Your Core Responsibilities:

- Monitor driver safety training and certification requirements through Lienhaul Central

- Send proactive, friendly reminders to drivers before compliance deadlines

- Follow up persistently (but kindly) with drivers who fall behind on training

- Manage complete a
 documentation - driver statements, video retrieval, reports

- Coordinate with Lienhaul Central to ensure proper documentation procedures

- Prepare accurate FedEx i
 reports within required timeframes

- Extract and verify payroll data from MyGroundForce to ensure drivers are paid correctly

- Handle
 communication with FedEx terminals professionally and efficiently

- Create clear, useful Standard Operating Procedures for operational processes

- Maintain organized leave calendars so coverage planning is seamless

- Coordinate vehicle maintenance scheduling to prevent breakdowns

- Keep comprehensive records that support operational decisions



 We're Looking for Someone Who:

- Has proven administrative experience in operations or logistics environments

- Communicates clearly and professionally in fluent English

- Takes genuine pride in keeping systems organized and compliant

- Follows up proactively rather than waiting for problems to surface

- Maintains professional, respectful relationships with drivers

- Stays calm and thorough when handling time-sensitive documentation

- Navigates multiple systems with ease and learns quickly

- Can work US Pacific Time business hours

- Values accuracy and compliance as much as efficiency



Bonus Points For: 

- Background in transportation, logistics, or fleet operations

- Understanding of DOT compliance and driver qualification requirements

- Experience with payroll data preparation or verification

- Process documentation and SOP creation skills

- Basic dispatching knowledge (for backup support)

 

Why This Role Matters:

When you send that training reminder, you might prevent a driver from being sidelined. When you ensure documentation is complete, you protect the company from compliance issues. When you verify payroll accuracy, you ensure drivers get what they've earned. Your work has real impact on real people every single day.



 Why You'll Love Working Here:

- Be the organized backbone that enables operational success

- Work with leadership who values prevention over reaction

- Stable remote position with clear expectations and support

- Opportunity to build better systems and improve processes

- See direct results of your proactive approach



Ready to be the administrative professional who keeps operations safe, compliant, and running smoothly? 



Apply now and help us build operational excellence from the ground up.

title: Customer Experience Agent (Senior)
description:
About NordStick

NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home-based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high-quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast-growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand—it's a long-term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.

The Role

We are hiring a Senior Customer Service Agent to lead and execute customer support efforts at NordStick. This position is based in the Philippines, with fully remote work and flexible hours to accommodate time zone differences (aligned with US Eastern Time for collaboration).

This is not an entry-level support role. You are not here to just answer tickets. You are here to own customer satisfaction, reduce friction in the support process, and ensure our service scales with growth.

You will operate across customer service, ecommerce systems, data analysis, and cross-functional coordination. You will handle escalations, mentor juniors, and drive improvements. You will be trusted with real responsibility.

If you wait for issues to escalate, this role will be painful. If you spot trends early and implement fixes proactively, you will thrive.

This is a full-time role focused primarily on customer service, with involvement in data-driven insights and partner coordination to enhance the overall customer experience.

Core Responsibilities



Customer Service Leadership and Execution

Lead handling of complex customer inquiries via Rich Panel and other platforms, resolving issues related to orders, shipping, products, returns, and feedback.

Mentor junior agents, provide training on best practices, and ensure consistent high-quality responses.

Analyze customer interactions to identify patterns, pain points, and opportunities for product or process improvements.

Escalate critical issues to leadership and follow through on resolutions.



Ecommerce and Systems Support

Optimize customer journeys on Shopify, including troubleshooting integrations and QA for support-related features.

Support setup, QA, and usage of tools like Rich Panel for CS, Klaviyo for post-purchase communications, and other DTC tools.

Leverage AI tools for automating responses, sentiment analysis, and efficient ticket routing.

Flag and resolve system issues that impact customer experience before they become widespread problems.



Data Analysis and Reporting

Maintain and update Google Sheets for tracking CS metrics, such as response times, resolution rates, NPS, and customer feedback trends.

Use data insights to generate reports and recommend strategies for reducing support volume through proactive measures (e.g., FAQ updates, self-service tools).

Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to align CS data with broader business goals.



Relationship and Process Management

Manage relationships with vendors and partners involved in fulfillment, shipping, or support escalations.

Develop and document workflows for efficient CS operations, including escalation protocols and knowledge bases.

Act as a central point for CS coordination, preparing summaries for team check-ins and ensuring clear communication.

Drive initiatives to improve customer retention through personalized follow-ups and loyalty programs.





What Success Looks Like

Within 30 Days



CS operations run smoothly with reduced response times and no preventable escalations.

Systems and tools are optimized for efficiency.

Initial data reports highlight key trends, and basic improvements are implemented.



Within 90 Days



CS feels proactive and data-driven, with measurable improvements in satisfaction metrics.

Team communication is tight, and processes are streamlined.

Leadership can focus on growth strategy, not day-to-day CS cleanup.



Requirements

You should not apply unless most of the following are true:



You have led or senior-level experience in customer service for DTC ecommerce companies.

You are extremely organized, detail-oriented, and empathetic with customers.

You are proactive, comfortable handling escalations, and making judgment calls.

You communicate clearly, directly, and professionally.

You have hands-on experience with Shopify, Rich Panel, Klaviyo, and Google Sheets.

You are skilled in data analysis, using AI tools for CS optimization, and managing vendor relationships.

You understand DTC ecommerce deeply, including how CS integrates with marketing, operations, and customer journeys.

You can commit full-time, working 40 hours per week, based in the Philippines (with flexibility for US time zone overlap).



If you're passionate about fitness, customer success, and elevating service in a dynamic DTC environment, apply today! Send your resume and a cover letter explaining your relevant CS experience to

Post daily Reels and static content across social media platforms

title: Motion Designer VA
description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a Motion Designer Virtual Assistant to assist creative production teams with non-billable design tasks related to events, venues, and digital installations. The primary focus will be creating short animations, motion assets, and visual content to enhance live events, LED displays, and venue presentations. You will work closely with internal designers and managers, contributing motion graphics that adhere to established creative standards and project briefs.



Key Responsibilities

-Design and animate short motion graphics for LED walls, event visuals, and presentations

-Support internal design teams with non-billable creative production work

-Animate existing design assets for live event settings

-Assist with visual mockups, concept animations, and design explorations

-Revise designs based on internal feedback and project specifications

-Organize and manage motion files, versions, and exports

-Collaborate with designers and project teams during overlapping work hours



Required Skills

-Proven experience as a Motion Designer or Motion Graphics Artist

-Strong proficiency in Adobe After Effects

-Experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop

-Solid understanding of animation principles, timing, and visual storytelling

-Ability to adhere to brand guidelines and creative direction

-Reliable internet connection and capacity to work remotely



Preferred Skills

-Experience with Adobe Premiere Pro

-Familiarity with Cinema 4D

-Background in supporting event, experiential, or live production design

-Collaborative mindset, able to work with multiple stakeholders

-Familiarity with Microsoft 365 tools (Outlook, Teams, basic file management)

-Why Join Us



This position offers a chance to contribute to large-scale creative productions, gain valuable experience in event-driven motion design, and collaborate with seasoned creative teams in a structured and supportive environment.

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Bookkeeper

About Medpak Solutions

Medpak Solutions is a Florida-based cosmetic manufacturer supporting fast-growing beauty and personal care brands. We operate in a manufacturing environment with variable costs, multi-SKU production, and project-based workflows. We’re looking for a detail-driven Bookkeeper who can keep our numbers clean, current, and audit-ready as we scale.

?

What You’ll Be Responsible For

You’ll own the day-to-day bookkeeping and support higher-level accounting and tax workflows, with a strong focus on accuracy and manufacturing operations.

• Manage day-to-day bookkeeping using QuickBooks

• Record and reconcile AP, AR, bank accounts, and credit cards

• Maintain clean general ledger and monthly close support

• Track manufacturing-related expenses including COGS, raw materials, labor, and overhead

• Support company tax work. Sales tax, filings, reporting, and coordination with external accountants

• Assist with financial reporting. Monthly summaries, variance checks, and documentation

• Maintain organized financial records for audits and compliance

• Work closely with operations and leadership to clarify cost allocation and discrepancies

?

What We’re Looking For

• Strong QuickBooks experience. This is non-negotiable

• Experience handling company tax work or supporting tax preparation

• Manufacturing or production environment experience is a strong plus

• High attention to detail and strong reconciliation skills

• Comfortable working with variable costs and non-linear workflows

• Reliable, organized, and able to work independently

• Clear communicator who can flag issues early and explain numbers simply

?

Nice to Have

• Experience with inventory tracking or COGS analysis

• Familiarity with U.S. accounting practices

• Experience supporting growing or operationally complex businesses

?

Role Details

• Role. Bookkeeper

• Type. Full Time

• Location. Remote

• Tools. Notion QuickBooks, Excel, internal systems

title: Pay increased: AI Video Editor and Content Designer for London Based Company
description:
To apply, fill out this form: 



What is the company?



We partner with influencers to build products with them. We are a London-based startup that is redefining how creators build real tech companies. Our team handles the tech, product, and growth, while influencers bring the audience and creative spark.



Every project is built like a startup: fast-moving, ambitious, and impact-focused.



We work with YouTubers who have millions of subscribers, launching apps, physical products, and brands together. You'll be creating content that reaches massive audiences from day one.



What will you be doing?



You will be our first core social-media creative hire, working directly with founders who have built viral media brands and creator-driven products with billions of views behind them.



You will manage video content across multiple creator-led social media accounts, turning a constant stream of ideas into polished, platform-native content. You'll combine traditional editing with AI tools to produce more content, faster, without sacrificing quality.



Responsibilities include:



- Editing short-form and long-form video content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and YouTube using Adobe Premiere Pro

-Using AI video generation tools (Higgsfield, Sora, Runway) to create cinematic motion, transitions, and visual effects that would otherwise require expensive production setups

- Generating AI imagery and assets using Midjourney, Freepik AI, and similar tools to enhance video content

- Using AI assistants (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) to brainstorm ideas, write scripts, generate captions, and speed up your creative workflow

- Managing content pipelines across multiple social accounts simultaneously, keeping everything organised and on schedule

- Creating scroll-stopping thumbnails that drive clicks

- Adapting quickly to creative briefs, executing ideas same-day when needed

- Staying ahead of platform trends, algorithm changes, and viral formats

- Collaborating with creators and founders to translate their vision into content that performs

- Repurposing long-form content into bite-sized clips optimised for each platform



About you



You are fast, creative, and obsessed with what performs on social media. You don't just edit videos, you understand why some content blows up and others don't. You're excited by AI tools and see them as creative superpowers, not shortcuts.



You should be:



- Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro (After Effects is a plus)

- Experienced with AI creative tools: Midjourney, Sora, Higgsfield, Freepik AI, Runway, or similar platforms

- Comfortable using AI assistants (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) to accelerate your workflow

- Someone who has created content that has actually performed, whether for yourself, clients, or brands. Show us the numbers.

- Able to manage multiple projects and accounts without dropping balls

- A quick executor who can turn around content same-day when the 
nt calls for it

- Plugged into social media culture, trends, and what's working right now

- Organised and disciplined, delivering on time and communicating clearly

- Question for the form: What AI tool has most changed how you create content, and how do you use it?

- Curious about new tools and always experimenting with better ways to create



What you'll get



- The chance to create content seen by millions across multiple creator brands

- Direct access to founders who have built viral products and media brands

- A front-row seat to the creator economy, working with top YouTubers and influencers

- Fast-growing startup with real potential for long-term career growth

- Exposure to multiple products and brands across different industries

- A creative, no-bureaucracy environment where good ideas win



Payment and Terms



- Base: $1,000 USD per month (plus performance-based bonuses when deadlines are hit)

- Hours: 40 hours per week (exclusive of breaks)

- Weekends: Off

- Holidays: Paid (dates flexible)



How to apply



We will respond to successful applicants within 7 days of submitting with next steps.



To apply, fill out this form:

title: Real Estate Operations & Media Support Assistant (Remote)
description:
Overview



We are hiring a reliable, detail-oriented Real Estate Operations and Media Support Assistant to help support the daily backend of a growing real estate media business. This role will begin with morning coverage focused on quality control, media delivery, and organization, with the opportunity to grow into additional responsibilities as the business expands.



This position is ideal for someone who is organized, communicative, creative, and genuinely enjoys helping a business run smoothly. Prior experience is helpful but not required. Character, mindset, and willingness to learn are the most important factors.



Role Responsibilities



This role is responsible for quality control of real estate photo and media deliverables, accurate and timely delivery of completed media to clients, and maintaining organized files, folders, and naming conventions. The assistant will follow established processes while paying close attention to detail and will communicate clearly when information is missing, errors are found, or improvements can be made. Morning operations support is critical to ensure all deliverables are completed by deadline, and additional operational tasks may be assigned as business needs evolve.



Depending on skill set and interest, responsibilities may expand to include social media support using pre-created templates, Instagram outreach through established systems, Canva-based design work, basic Photoshop or Lightroom photo editing, record-keeping, report building, and light platform or CRM work such as HDPhotoHub. This role does not involve cold calling, and all messaging or outreach follows pre-written templates.



Schedule and Availability



Morning availability is required. Typical working hours fall between 7AM and 11AM Central or 8AM and 11AM Eastern. The role will start at 10 to 20 hours per week, Monday through Friday, with the opportunity to increase hours or grow toward full-time for the right candidate.



Compensation



Compensation ranges from $4 to $8 USD per hour, depending on experience and performance. Entry-level candidates typically start in the $4 to $5 per hour range, while higher rates are available for experienced or high-performing candidates.



Ideal Candidate



The ideal candidate is highly detail-oriented, organized, communicative, and responsive. They remain calm under pressure, respect deadlines, and take pride in their work. They are friendly, professional, and comfortable interacting with both clients and tea
mbers. They are reliable, accountable, and consistent, and they are open to learning, growing, and giving feedback to help improve systems and workflows. This role involves direct communication with the business owner, so personality fit, openness, and alignment are important.



Preferred Experience



Experience in real estate workflows or media delivery is a plus but not required. Familiarity with HDPhotoHub or similar platforms, Photoshop or Lightroom experience, Canva or basic graphic design skills, social media familiarity, and previous virtual assistant or operations experience are all beneficial but not mandatory.



Why This Role



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow alongside a business, learn valuable real-world skills, and play a meaningful role in daily operations. The right person will not simply complete tasks, but will help improve systems, processes, and outcomes over time.

title: Real Estate Cold Calling VA – Lead Generation & Appointment Setting
description:

• Handle objections professionally and build rapport with prospects

• Work with lead lists from PropStream, Batch Leads, and other sources

• Confident, persuasive, and persistent personality

• Experience with CRM systems (Boldtrail preferred)

title: Senior Web Developer, WordPress Rebuild and Migration Specialist
description:
Company Overview

A membership based nonprofit in the agriculture sector is rebuilding multiple web properties currently trapped in a restrictive, legacy WordPress environment managed on Pantheon. The organization seeks to modernize its infrastructure, improve content publishing speed, gain full ownership of its systems, and launch several new websites over the next 18 to 24 months.



Role Overview

This role is ideal for a senior, solutions oriented WordPress developer who excels at untangling complex legacy systems, architecting clean and scalable environments, and building reliable digital foundations for non technical teams. You will serve as the technical owner of the nonprofit’s web ecosystem, guiding its modernization and long term stability.



You will spend the first phase auditing the current systems, planning the migration, and improving early stage microsites. Over time, the role expands into full site rebuilds, new site launches, infrastructure ownership, and ongoing support.



Core Skills and Experience Required

1. Deep WordPress Development Expertise

Ability to architect modern, scalable WordPress builds from scratch.

Strong PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills.

Expertise with modern WordPress block based editing and custom theme development.

Ability to build reusable components that empower non technical users.



2. Migration and Legacy System Extraction

Experience extracting sites from heavily customized or vendor controlled hosting environments.

Ability to reverse engineer and document legacy code, themes, and plugins.

Comfort rebuilding clean versions of complex sites with appropriate redirects and SEO preservation.



3. Hosting Architecture and Infrastructure Setup

Strong understanding of hosting platforms, staging and production workflows, and version control.

Experience setting up new WordPress hosting environments outside Pantheon.

Ability to design secure, maintainable, vendor agnostic long term infrastructure.



4. Performance, Stability, and CMS Reliability

Skilled at optimizing site speed, responsiveness, and reliability.

Ability to build back end structures that prevent layout breakage and editing instability.

Strong troubleshooting and debugging capabilities.



5. UX, Layout, and Visual Implementation

Ability to translate Figma or mockups into polished, responsive pages.

Collaboration with in house designers to refine layout and structure.

Light design literacy preferred.



6. Analytics, SEO, and Technical Health

Experience integrating GA4 properly across large sites.

Ability to implement SEO friendly architecture and on site structure.

Understanding of schema, page speed, and technical SEO fundamentals.



7. Long Term Ownership and Cross Functional Communication

Ability to communicate clearly with non technical colleagues.

Experience managing multiple concurrent projects and timelines.

High reliability, proactive problem solving, and ability to build trust quickly.



What You Will Lead (Project Overview)

The work will follow a phased roadmap rather than a single project. High level responsibilities include:



Phase 1: Audit and Planning

Deep audit of the Pantheon based legacy environment.

Documentation of structures, dependencies, plugins, and risks.

Recommendations on hosting, architecture, and migration pathways.

Early stabilization and cleanup of current microsite builds.



Phase 2: Infrastructure Build Out

Set up a new hosting ecosystem for the nonprofit side.

Establish staging, production, version control, and clean workflows.

Ensure security, speed, and long term maintainability.



Phase 3: Microsite Launches

Build and support several small to medium sized sites for subject matter experts.

Improve and refine existing in flight builds (WGH2A, Producepedia).

Create repeatable systems for future site launches.



Phase 4: Full Rebuild of the Main Organizational Site

Architect and rebuild the primary WGA site from scratch.

Improve navigation, SEO structure, page speed, UX, and analytics.

Clean up years of legacy issues including dead pages, 404s, and structure problems.

Ensure an intuitive CMS experience for the internal team.



Phase 5: Long Term Support and Ownership

Serve as the dedicated technical partner to the marketing team.

Implement new pages, features, and updates as needed.

Maintain, optimize, and future proof the entire environment.

Provide training and documentation to internal users.

title: Google Ads Specialist (Remote/WFH)
description:
About RD Digital

RD Digital is a New Zealand–based digital marketing agency specialising in performance-driven paid media, SEO, analytics, and conversion tracking. We partner with businesses across New Zealand, delivering measurable growth through data-led digital strategies.

As a remote-first agency, we focus on outcomes, accountability, and continuous optimisation rather than rigid office structures. This role is designed for someone who is comfortable operating independently while collaborating closely with leadership.



Role Overview

We are seeking a Google Ads Specialist to manage the day-to-day optimisation and health of multiple Google Ads accounts. This role is operational and analytical in nature, with a strong emphasis on proactive optimisation, performance monitoring, tracking validation, and clear reporting.

You will report directly to the Director and play a critical role in ensuring campaign efficiency, tracking accuracy, and actionable insights across accounts.

This position will start as a contractor (WFH). Subject to performance, reliability, and business alignment, there is a clear pathway to transition into a full-time salaried role.



Key Responsibilities

Google Ads Management & Optimisation

* Perform daily and weekly health checks across Search, Performance Max, Display, and Brand campaigns

* Optimise bids, budgets, keywords, search terms, audiences, and assets

* Identify inefficiencies, wastage, and scaling opportunities

* Implement ongoing testing frameworks (ad copy, assets, structures)



Tracking & Implementation

* Review and validate conversion tracking across GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Google Ads

* Identify tracking gaps, discrepancies, or misfires

* Implement fixes directly where possible or coordinate with developers when required

* Ensure conversion actions align with business objectives



Reporting & Insights

* Prepare clear, structured performance reports (weekly and monthly)

* Translate data into actionable insights and optimisation recommendations

* Highlight risks, opportunities, and performance trends to the Director

* Support Looker Studio or spreadsheet-based reporting where required





Stakeholder Collaboration

* Work closely with the Director on strategy execution and optimisation priorities

* Provide feedback on account performance and next steps

* Maintain high standards of documentation and account hygiene





Required Skills & Experience

* 2+ years of proven hands-on experience managing Google Ads accounts (Search & Performance Max essential); Google Ads certification is a bonus.

* Strong understanding of GA4, Google Tag Manager, and conversion tracking

* Ability to diagnose and fix tracking issues independently

* Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail

* Comfortable working autonomously in a remote environment

* Clear written communication and reporting skills

* Experience working with international accounts is an advantage





Engagement & Growth Pathway

* Initial engagement: Contractor (remote, WFH)

* Reporting line: Directly to the Director

* Growth opportunity: Transition to full-time salaried role based on performance and consistency

Location note: RD Digital is a New Zealand–based agency with no physical office in the Philippines; this is a fully remote role



Why Join RD Digital?

* Direct exposure to leadership and decision-making

* Clear performance expectations and growth pathway

* Focus on quality, outcomes, and real optimisation (not vanity metrics)

* Long-term collaboration mindset rather than short-term task outsourcing

title: Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (Hospitality) — Book Manchester Trade Wine Tasting RSVPs
description:
Overview

We’re a UK wine importer focused on small-batch, grower-made Languedoc wines. We run central Manchester trade tastings and need a strong cold caller to reach the wine decision maker, qualify by wine list refresh timing, and book qualified RSVPs into specific tasting slots. Professional, clear, jargon-light communication is essential.



What you’ll do (core responsibilities)

 • Cold call restaurants, wine bars and independent venues (Manchester focus; lead list provided).

 • Get past gatekeepers and speak to the person responsible for the wine list.

 • Qualify prospects using our checklist:

 • Next wine list refresh window (month/week)

 • Venue style fit (natural / mixed / classic)

 • BTG price band + bottle price band

 • Confirm decision maker attendance (or direct list influencer)

 • Book RSVPs into fixed tasting slots (Wave 1 / Wave 2) via our calendar link.

 • Capture and log full contact details (name, role,
, mobile) and all required notes in our sheet/form.

 • Send confirmation + reminders (templates provided) to reduce no-shows.



Outputs we require (non-negotiable)

A booking only counts if it is a qualified RSVP with:

 • Named attendee(s) + role(s)

 •
 + mobile

 • Confirmed slot (Wave 1 / Wave 2)

 • Logged wine list refresh window

 • Logged BTG/bottle price bands

 • Clean CRM/log completion (all mandatory fields)



Experience required

 • Proven cold calling/appointment setting experience, ideally in hospitality (restaurants/bars) or similar B2B.

 • Confident handling gatekeepers and objections.

 • Strong spoken English + professional phone manner.

 • Excellent note-taking and CRM hygiene.



Hours & calling window

 • Start: 10–20 hours/week (can scale).

 • Calling window: UK business hours, 11:00–17:00 UK time.



Payment & incentives (performance-based)

We pay for outcomes (attendance + orders), not dials.



Option A - Hourly + attended RSVP bounty 

 • Hourly: $5–$10/hr 

 •     Attended qualified RSVP bounty: $10 per attended RSVP



What counts as a “qualified RSVP” (mandatory to be paid):

To be paid, ALL must be captured and the attendee must show:

 1. Attendee is the wine list decision maker (or direct list influencer)

 2.
 + mobile captured

 3. Confirmed slot (Wave 1 / Wave 2)

 4. Next list refresh window logged (month/week)

 5. BTG + bottle price bands logged

 6. Venue + location area logged

 7. Confirmation + reminders sent (templates provided)



No payout for unqualified bookings, incomplete logs, or no-shows.



Shortlisted candidates will complete a 2 hour test with a small lead list. 

We will assess: phone approach, objection handling, booking quality, and data capture accuracy.

title: Flight Operations Assistant & Client Concierge
description:
We are a private aviation company. We arrange private jet charters and manage jet card memberships for high-net-worth clients who expect white-glove service every single time.



We're hiring a Flight Operations Assistant & Client Concierge to join our small, tight-knit team.



WHAT THE ROLE LOOKS LIKE:



This is not a typical 9-to-5. Private aviation runs on the client's schedule, not ours. We need coverage during US business hours, and when things get hectic — which they will — we operate on a global clock. That means late nights, early mornings, and weekend availability when flights are moving. It's not always easy, but it's the nature of the business and we're upfront about it.



When request volume is high, you'll be slammed — coordinating flights, fielding client requests at odd hours, and juggling multiple moving pieces across time zones. When things slow down, we don't coast. Quieter periods are when we focus on operational perfection: tightening SOPs, re-engaging past clients, building out systems, and making sure we're sharper for the next wave.



You need to be someone who thrives in that rhythm. We work as a family here. Everyone is a hustler. We get things done and we take ownership.



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



- Support flight operations: coordinate with aircraft operators, manage trip logistics, handle itinerary changes, and ensure every detail is locked down before wheels up

- Serve as a concierge-level point of contact for our clients — ground transportation, hotel bookings, catering requests, special arrangements, and anything else that makes their experience seamless

- Communicate proactively with clients and operators via
, WhatsApp, and phone

- Maintain and update records in our CRM (HubSpot) and trip management systems

- Assist with quoting, invoicing follow-ups, and post-trip reporting

- During slower periods: lead client re-engagement outreach, build and refine operational checklists and SOPs, and improve internal systems and workflows

- Jump in wherever needed — we're a small team and everyone wears multiple hats



WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:



- Proven experience in travel concierge, luxury hospitality, VIP client services, or private aviation support

- You have a network and knowledge of high-end travel logistics — hotels, ground transport, restaurants, experiences

- Available to work US time zones and flexible enough to extend hours when operations demand it

- Process-oriented: you build checklists, you follow up without being asked, you don't let things fall through the cracks

- Excellent written and spoken English — you'll be communicating directly with clients and operators

- Tech-savvy: comfortable with CRMs, spreadsheets, messaging platforms, and learning new tools quickly

- Self-starter who takes initiative — if you see something that needs doing, you do it



NICE TO HAVE:



- Experience with HubSpot, Avinode, or aviation industry tools

- Background in private aviation, charter operations, or FBO services

- Experience managing high-net-worth or celebrity clientele



This is a full-time role with variable intensity. When it's go-time, we need you all in. When it's quiet, we trust you to stay productive, sharp, and focused on making the operation better.



If you're someone who takes pride in delivering exceptional service and wants to be part of a growing aviation company where your work actually matters — we want to hear from you.

title: Short Form Content Video Editor
description:
The Role

We are looking for a creative, high-energy Video Editor to transform our high-quality raw footage into viral-ready short-form content (TikTok, Reels, Shorts).



The good news: You don’t need to worry about the "what." We provide the 4K raw footage and the polished scripts. Your job is to focus entirely on the "how"—making the edit so engaging that viewers can’t look away.



Key Responsibilities

Narrative Pacing: Edit raw footage according to provided scripts while maintaining a fast, engaging flow.



Visual Hooks: Implement dynamic captions, B-roll, overlays, and transitions that stop the scroll within the first 3 seconds.



Sound Design: Use trending audio, SFX (whooshes, pops, hits), and level voiceovers for a cinematic feel.



Brand Alignment: Maintain a consistent visual style across all platforms.

title: Visual redesign of website
description:
As part of launching new services, we need to redesign our current website with a refreshed visual identity and a more modern, professional look and feel.



Our existing site is outdated, and we plan to rebuild it entirely. We are therefore looking for someone to review and redesign the site. The existing text content should largely be retained, but the site must be structured so that my business partner and I can easily update the text ourselves after deployment, without external support.



The website is hosted on one.com and built using their native tools. No advanced functionality is required (e.g., webshop, system integrations, or databases).



We expect you to propose several design concepts or mockups to showcase different directions. Based on these, we will select the version to implement.



SEO is not part of this assignment.



Expected hours per week is 10-15 with a total hours for the full task is 40 over 2-3 weeks.

title: Virtual Assistant Role
description:
Go High Level and Paid Ads Specialist



We are looking for an experienced Virtual Assistant to support the growth of KingBodies across marketing, automation, and lead generation.



This role is not entry level. We are looking for someone who has strong, hands-on experience with Go High Level (GHL) and understands how to manage and optimise marketing systems inside a growing online business.



Required Experience



The ideal candidate must have:



• Extensive experience using Go High Level (GHL)

• Experience building and managing funnels, automations, workflows, and pipelines

• Strong understanding of lead management and CRM organisation

• Experience managing and optimising paid ads (Meta and ideally Google)

• Ability to test creatives, monitor performance, and interpret ad data

• Confidence checking key metrics such as CTR, CPC, CPL, and conversion rates

• Experience reporting performance clearly and making recommendations based on data



Responsibilities



• Managing and maintaining GHL workflows and automations

• Setting up and optimising funnels and lead capture systems

• Supporting ad campaigns through creative testing and performance tracking

• Monitoring campaign results and identifying opportunities to improve performance

• Working alongside the KingBodies team to improve lead flow and conversions



Ideal Candidate



• Has several years of experience working with GHL in depth

• Understands online coaching or service-based businesses

• Is proactive, organised, and data-driven

• Can work independently and make informed decisions

• Communicates clearly and works well within a fast-moving team



This role is for someone who understands that marketing is both creative and analytical, and who wants to be part of a business focused on long-term growth and impact.

title: Google Media Ads Buyer (Remote & flexible)
description:
GTE is a fast-growing global eCommerce company where smart ideas turn into real impact.

We build and scale online brands across international markets, and we empower our tea
mbers to take ownership, grow quickly, and shape the future of our business alongside us.





Why This Role Exists

This role plays a meaningful part in the growth of the company .



As a Google Ads Media Buyer, you’ll directly contribute to improving the performance of our Google Ads channel which drives around 90% of our total revenue, while developing your skills in a performance-driven environment. You’ll help elevate our campaign structure, strategy, and overall account performance, ensuring our ad spend translates into scalable and profitable growth.



This is a role for someone who wants to build, improve, and grow, not just maintain the status quo.





What You’ll Own & Build

In this role, you’ll be trusted with real responsibility from day one. Your success will be measured in your first 90 days based on the following metrics:

- Developing and implementing a new or improved Google Ads strategy

- Restructuring and optimizing Google Shopping campaigns for better scalability and efficiency

- Driving measurable performance improvements that result in a 20%+ increase in revenue from Google Ads

- Using data insights to continuously refine bidding, structure, and feed performance





What We’re Looking For

We’re excited to work with someone who:

- Has at least 3 years of hands-on experience in performance marketing or media buying

- Has direct experience with Google Shopping campaigns for large eCommerce catalogs (10,000+ products)



- Has experience handling high-budget campaigns ($300K+/month)

- Is highly proficient in Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, Google Analytics

- Ideally has experience with Google CSS Labelizer

- Thinks analytically and makes decisions based on data, not guesswork

- Enjoys testing, optimizing, and finding performance opportunities others might miss

- Is comfortable taking ownership of results and being accountable for revenue impact





Ready to Grow With Us?

If you’re looking for a role where your work matters, your growth is supported, and your impact is visible — we’d love to hear from you.

title: US Healthcare (Clinic Staff and Physician) Recruiter
description:
Overview

We are seeking a part time Healthcare Recruiter to support our growing team. In this role, you will oversee the end-to-end recruitment process for U.S.-based healthcare professionals, ensuring that top talent is sourced, screened, and placed with leading healthcare organizations nationwide. This remote opportunity is ideal for someone passionate about healthcare staffing and highly skilled in sourcing clinicians, allied health professionals, and clinic support staff.

Please read until the bottom for instructions to move forward.



Key Responsibilities

Full cycle recruitment: Manage sourcing, screening, interviewing, and placement of U.S. clinicians and clinic staff, including physicians, nurse practitioners, registered nurses, medical assistants, front desk staff, and other allied health professionals.

Candidate sourcing: Utilize job boards, social media, referrals, and creative sourcing strategies to identify qualified talent.

Screening & evaluation: Conduct initial interviews and assessments to verify qualifications, experience, and cultural fit.

Interview coordination: Schedule client interviews, gather feedback, and assist with offer negotiations.

Compliance: Ensure adherence to U.S. healthcare hiring standards, licensing, and credentialing requirements.



Qualifications

Demonstrated experience in U.S. healthcare recruitment (clinicians and clinic staff).

Knowledge of U.S. healthcare roles, licensing, and credentialing processes.

Strong communication and relationship building skills.

Ability to manage multiple requisitions independently.

Excellent sourcing skills

Excellent organizational and time management abilities.



What We Offer

Part-time schedule (20 hours/week) - Mon - Fri 8am to 12pm CST

100% remote work environment

Competitive hourly rate $6/hour

Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in healthcare staffing

Supportive and collaborative team culture



If you’d like to be considered, please complete the application form here:

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
We’re Hiring at BOUNDLESS COLLECTIVE!



Who We Are

Boundless Collective is a dynamic, experienced outsourcing powerhouse specializing in delivering creative, admin-backed solutions across industries. We’re not just assistants, we’re innovators, growth enablers, and trusted partners in our clients’ success.



Why You’ll Love It Here

- A high-energy team culture that blends professionalism with camaraderie, where collaboration and creativity are daily drivers.

- Fun-focused atmosphere: from team outings and social events to celebrating milestones big and small, work here feels like more than just work.

- Meaningful recognition: enjoy structured bonuses and reward programs that celebrate your contributions and let you know they’re appreciated.

- Growth-first mindset: as part of our team, you’ll innovate, share ideas, and help shape the future of client solutions every single day.



We’re expanding, and we’re looking for talented individuals to be part of our dynamic team! If you're looking for a fulfilling, impactful role, read on to see how you can contribute and grow with us!



We are hiring for the following positions:



Executive Assistant to the CEO



What We Offer:

Position: Full-time

Work Setup: Permanent remote – work from anywhere in the world!

Shift: 7 AM - 4 PM (MNL time) – Start your day with energy!

Equipment: Self-provided – Bring your tech, and we’ll bring the opportunity!

Salary: up to PHP 30,000 depending on experience. + bonuses



Apply via this link: 
/
RESPONSIBILITIES:



1. Executive Support & Inbox Management

- Manage and prioritise the client’s
 inbox, including drafting and sending responses

- Ask clarifying questions on behalf of the executive when required

- Ensure important communications are followed up and actioned



2. Marketing Support

- Write, schedule, and design monthly social media posts to promote upcoming events

- Create engaging event marketing assets using Canva (or similar tools)

- Design and format newsletters for distribution to members and non-members

- Prepare and publish follow-up posts after events (highlights, key takeaways, reminders, next steps)



3. Calendar & Scheduling

- Manage calendar scheduling and meeting bookings

- Coordinate appointments, calls, and commitments efficiently



4. Systems & Task Management

- Set up and manage task workflows using Trello

- Maintain and oversee the Trello board to ensure tasks are tracked and completed

- Drive accountability by following up on outstanding actions



5. Content & Document Support

- Set up and manage documents and materials using Canva

- Prepare and send letters and communications, including:

- Initial (pre-engagement)
s

- Follow-up and post-engagement communications



6. Operational Coordination

- Act as the “hub” to ensure everything is getting done

- Streamline processes and suggest improvements where needed

- Support day-to-day operational needs to keep things running efficiently





QUALIFICATIONS:

- 2–3 years’ experience in an Executive Assistant, Managing EA, Senior Admin, or similar support role

- Proven capability managing executive inboxes, drafting professional
 responses, and handling confidential information

- Strong calendar management and scheduling experience

- High attention to detail with excellent organisational and time management skills

- Experience using task/project tools such as Trello (or similar), with the ability to keep workflows moving and tasks completed

- Experience using Canva (or similar) to create and manage client-facing documents and materials

- Proactive, resourceful, and confident working independently while keeping stakeholders updated



At Boundless Collective, we take pride in fostering a culture of confidence, reliability, and a relentless commitment to excellence. If you are ready to support a dynamic executive team and grow in a supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Ready to make an impact and elevate your career? Apply via link below and let's create something extraordinary together!



APPLY HERE: 
/

title: CORE CRM Software Specialist (Timekeeping & Billing)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking an experienced CORE CRM Specialist to own and manage the firm’s use of the CORE platform, with an initial focus on timekeeping and billing. This role is critical to ensuring accurate time tracking, clean billing workflows, and reliable reporting across the business.



Beyond day-to-day execution, the ideal candidate will bring deep CORE experience and act as a strategic partner—helping the firm expand its use of CORE’s features, improve internal workflows, and increase operational visibility and efficiency.



This role is well-suited for someone who is highly detail-oriented, process-driven, and enjoys optimizing systems.



Key Responsibilities: 



CORE CRM Ownership (Primary Focus): 

* Serve as the primary owner and subject-matter expert for the CORE CRM system

* Manage and maintain accurate time tracking across projects and tea
mbers

* Oversee billing and invoicing workflows within CORE

* Ensure consistency, accuracy, and timeliness of time entries and billing data

* Troubleshoot issues related to CORE usage and workflows

* Maintain data integrity and system hygiene



Reporting & Insights:

* Generate and maintain reports related to:

1. Time utilization

2. Billing and revenue

3. Project performance

* Provide leadership with clear, reliable operational data

* Help identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement



Process Improvement & System Expansion: 

* Evaluate current CORE usage and recommend enhancements

* Help implement additional CORE functionality as appropriate

* Document best practices and internal workflows related to CORE

* Train or support tea
mbers on proper CORE usage

* Act as a bridge between operations, leadership, and finance-related processes



Cross-Functional Support: 

* Collaborate with the Admin Assistant, Director, and CEO as needed

* Support project teams in accurate time and data entry

* Assist with onboarding new users into CORE





Ideal Candidate Profile:

* Highly analytical, detail-oriented, and process-driven

* Comfortable owning and improving a core business system

* Clear, professional communicator

* Proactive and solution-oriented

* Trustworthy and comfortable handling financial and operational data

* DISC Blue profile tendencies are a strong plus (structured, precise, methodical)



Required / Strongly Preferred Experience: 

* Significant hands-on experience with CORE CRM (strongly preferred)

1. Timekeeping

2. Billing and invoicing

 3. Reporting

* Experience supporting professional services firms (architecture, engineering, design, consulting) is a strong plus

* Ability to both execute and advise on system improvements



Tools & Skills:

* CORE CRM (advanced proficiency)

* Reporting and data analysis

* Process documentation and optimization

* Strong overall technical aptitude

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."
