title: Remote Electrical Takeoff / Estimator Assistant (PlanHub)
description:
About Us:

We’re a US-based electrical contractor. We bid commercial/residential projects and want a remote assistant to help us complete takeoffs (and optionally estimates) directly inside PlanHub.



What You’ll Do (in PlanHub):



Review electrical drawings (lighting, power, legends, schedules, one-lines when included)



Build accurate PlanHub Takeoffs (counts + measurements) on PDF plan sets



(Optional / preferred) Convert takeoffs into an Estimate in PlanHub Estimation and export to Excel for review



Create a short “Questions/RFIs” list (missing info, scope gaps, unclear notes)



Share a view-only takeoff/estimate link for QC



Required Deliverables (each project):



Completed PlanHub Takeoff (cleanly named layers/categories)



Marked-up takeoff/measurement documentation (or downloaded takeoff report if applicable)



If using Estimation: exported Excel estimate



5–15 bullet questions/assumptions list



Requirements:



Comfortable working inside PlanHub Takeoff (Estimation is a plus)



Strong plan-reading skills + attention to detail



Fluent in Excel/Google Sheets



Reliable internet + can handle large plan PDFs



Nice to Have:



Prior electrical takeoff experience (commercial TI, multifamily, retail, etc.)



Experience building repeatable estimate templates/assemblies (if using PlanHub Estimation)



Schedule / Volume:



Flexible hours



2–10 projects/month to start, can scale



Pay:



Hourly or per-project



We start with a paid test project



How to Apply (Required):



Describe your electrical takeoff experience



Confirm you can work inside PlanHub Takeoff (and Estimation if applicable)



Your rate (hourly/per-project)



Typical turnaround time for a 30–80 page plan set



Example of a takeoff/BOQ output (redacted is fine)



Screening Question:

“What steps do you follow to make sure you don’t miss devices/fixtures across multiple sheets and schedules?”

title: Landscape Architect
description:
Job Description: 

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Landscape Architect with at least 5 years of experience to join our design team. The ideal candidate will blend technical precision with creative flair, overseeing the development of comprehensive site plans that integrate complex hardscape features, aquatic elements, and regional horticulture.

This role requires a professional who is as comfortable navigating government zoning regulations as they are designing a custom fountain or selecting the perfect palette of Florida-native vegetation. You will be responsible for managing projects from initial concept through detailed construction documentation, ensuring every design is both beautiful and buildable.



Position Requirements:

* Degree in Landscape Architecture

* In-depth experience designing and preparing site plans and landscape/hardscape plans

* Ability to review and apply government regulations

* Knowledge and experience with hardscape and construction details

* Experience with hardscape materials, pools, and fountain design

* Knowledge of Florida vegetation and growing conditions

* Strong AutoCAD, Microsoft (Word and Excel) skills

* Working knowledge of graphic software programs (Adobe Photoshop, Sketchup, and PowerPoint)

* Ability to manage multiple priorities

* Portfolio of work samples

* Positive attitude and a strong work ethic.



* Minimum Experience: 

5 years 



* Minimum Education Level: 

Bachelor’s Degree 



* Required Major: 

Landscape Architecture 



Desired Qualifications: 

* Self-motivated

* Detail oriented

* Freehand illustration and rendering skills

* Good communication and verbal presentation skills





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."



IMPORTANT REMINDER: To advance in the screening process, you must submit the Podio Form. Timely completion is essential to guarantee your application receives prompt attention.



Podio Form Link: 
/webforms/
/

title: Site Planner & Project Manager
description:
Job Summary:



We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Site Planner. This role is responsible for site planning, design, and layout to secure approvals for commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential (single-family and multi-family) projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of zoning regulations, AutoCAD, and project design to ensure optimal land use while meeting client requests and regulatory requirements.





Key Responsibilities:

* Develop detailed site plans, layouts, and designs in alignment with project goals and regulatory requirements.

* Site plan design includes the placement of parking, buildings, sidewalks, utilities, tree mitigation areas, residential lots, and water retention/detention areas.

* Coordinate with architects, engineers, contractors, and government agencies to facilitate project design and approvals.

* Ensure compliance with zoning regulations, with a specific focus on Palm Beach County Land Development (Zoning) Code and the technical manual.

* Prepare and present site drawings and design recommendations to clients.

* Optimize land use while considering environmental impact, safety, accessibility, and cost-effectiveness.

* Participate in project planning meetings and provide expert advice on site planning issues.

* Utilize GIS, CAD software, and other planning tools to create site plans and analyses.

* Develop and maintain strong working relationships with municipal staff to facilitate project approvals.





Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Urban Planning, Civil Engineering, Architecture, Landscape Architecture, or a related field.

* Proven experience in site planning, land development, or a related discipline.

* Proficiency in AutoCAD (additional knowledge of GIS, SketchUp, or other relevant planning and design software is a plus).

* Strong knowledge of zoning laws, land use planning, environmental policies, and permitting processes, with familiarity in the site plan approval process.

* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for working with multidisciplinary teams.

* Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines effectively.

* Certification in planning or landscape architecture (e.g., PLA, AICP, LEED, or equivalent) is a plus.





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."



IMPORTANT REMINDER: To advance in the screening process, you must submit the Podio Form. Timely completion is essential to guarantee your application receives prompt attention.



Podio Form Link: 
/webforms/
/

title: PPC Expert for Shopify Ecommerce Store (B2B + D2C, PMAX, Google Shopping)
description:
Summary

We are looking for an experienced Google Ads PPC Specialist to manage and scale paid search for our Shopify-based ecommerce store. Our business serves both D2C customers and B2B/industrial OEM buyers, so strong experience in demand generation across both segments is essential.



You'll be responsible for refining our campaign structure, improving profitability, optimizing lead quality, and scaling our top-performing channels (Performance Max + Google Shopping).



This is a part-time (approximately 15 hours per week), ongoing engagement with weekly collaboration and bi-weekly reporting.



Responsibilities

-Core PPC Management

Manage and optimize Google Search, PMAX, and Google Shopping campaigns

-Build separate B2B vs. D2C funnels with clean keyword segmentation

Implement robust negative keyword strategies to prevent irrelevant traffic

-Conduct weekly keyword, search term, and placement optimizations

-Improve ROAS, lead quality, and conversion rate across all campaigns





Tracking & Analytics

-Audit and improve conversion tracking (GA4, enhanced conversions)

-Verify correct UTM tracking for purchases, form fills, RFQs, and B2B leads

-Set up custom reporting dashboards (Looker Studio)





Creative & Feed Optimization

-Advise on PMAX asset improvements, creative refresh cadence, and audience signals

-Optimize product feed for Google Shopping (titles, attributes, categories)





Reporting & Communication

-Provide bi-weekly performance reports with actionable insights

-Give clear recommendations for scaling, reallocation, and testing

-Communicate proactively about issues, opportunities, or performance shifts





Requirements

-4+ years managing Shopify E-commerce + Google Ads

-Proven expertise with Performance Max and Google Shopping

-Strong background in B2B demand generation (industrial/manufacturing highly preferred)

-Strong understanding of D2C ecommerce funnels (arts, crafts and DIY highly preferred)

-Proficiency with keyword research, auction insights, and segmentation

-Experience with GA4, tags, enhanced conversions, and remarketing

-Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn data into strategy

 -Fluent English + clear communicator



Bonus:

-Experience with SimilarWeb, SEMrush, Google Keyword Planner or keyword gap analysis

-Knowledge of OEM/industrial markets





What Success Looks Like

?Increased ROAS for PMAX + Shopping

Higher-quality B2B leads at efficient CPA

?Reduction of wasted ad spend on irrelevant queries

?Stronger segmentation between D2C and B2B audiences

?Clear, consistent reporting and transparent communication (Must be available on EST time zone)

title: Administrative assistant
description:
PermitFlow’s mission is to streamline and simplify construction permitting in the $1.6 trillion United States construction market. Our software reduces time to permit, supporting permitting end-to-end including permit research, application preparation, submission, and monitoring.



We’ve raised a $31m Series A led by Kleiner Perkins with participation from Initialized Capital, Y Combinator, Felicis Ventures, Altos Ventures, and the founders and executives from Zillow, PlanGrid, Thumbtack, Bluebeam, Uber, Procore, and more.



Our team is remote first and consists of architects, structural engineers, permitting experts, and workflow software specialists, all who have personally experienced the pain of permitting.



What You’ll Do:

Experienced Administrative Assistant



Experience managing teams



Strong communicator with excellent organizational skills and a flexible / self-motivated approach to business management



Communicate with 3rd parties through phone and



Support the company’s work to facilitate accelerating development and long-term success



What You Need:

A fast and reliable internet connection is required. Back up connection is recommended.



Laptop or Desktop with no less than 8 GB RAM, minimum of Intel Core i5 processor or equivalent.



A quality video camera is recommended for Zoo
etings



Noise cancelling microphone



Qualifications & Fit:

Proven experience in a similar role



Excellent organizational abilities



Outstanding communication and people skills



Good attention to detail



Computer literate; Familiarity with MS Office and common computer programs





Check out this page (
) to listen to what some of our international members have to say about working at PermitFlow!



You can submit your application at the following link:

title: Recruiter Experienced Creating and Posting Job Ads in US
description:
Position: Ad Copy Writer/Creator-Become Part of a team creating, posting and maintaining thousands of US Based Job Ads,



We are seeking a highly detail-oriented creative writing professional to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for writing compelling self- created ads for various job board websites. Your primary task will be to self- create new fresh compelling ad copy daily (Not looking for an AI Copy Cat) You will need to always be analyzing the market and geographical areas ads are being posted in so you can create ads that will attract high quality and high quantity of candidates for all types of positions. This position requires someone with strong attention to detail, a keen sense of how to create effective ad copy that will attract a high volume of quality candidates, and the ability to work efficiently in a high-volume, fast-paced environment.



Work Scope:

• Self-Create job ads daily

• Write compelling, original ad copy and job titles that attract quality candidates(Not looking for a Chat PGT Copy and Paster)

• Regularly update and optimize existing ads to maximize visibility

• Maintain and manage our ad tracking system/database to ensure performance

• Monitor ad performance and flag underperforming campaigns for revision



Qualifications:

• Experience with creating and posting jobs on platforms like Indeed, LinkedIn, ZipRecruiter, etc.

• Experience writing catchy, clear, and professional ad copy

• Have strong attention to detail and are organized with data

• Understand how to identify and attract the right type of candidates

• Thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

• Tech-savvy and familiar with spreadsheets or job ad management tools



Important:

• Prior experience in recruiting focused on ad creation and posting a high volume of ads daily in the US Market is a MUST

• Understanding of SEO or keyword optimization for job postings is a MUST



Why Join Us?

• Flexible work hours LONG TERM Opportunity

• Supportive, collaborative team culture

• Room for growth and learning in the recruiting & HR space

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
PermitFlow is looking for exceptional, driven tea
mbers to support the go-to-market team with acquiring new customers. This person will serve as an integral member of PermitFlow’s sales team, and will work in tandem with our account executives in driving revenue. You are excited by - and ideally have experience with - the fast-paced, high-impact nature of startups.



Responsibilities

• Dedication to conveying PermitFlow’s value in construction permitting

• Ability to work cross-functionally, develop customer relationships, and generate new business opportunities through technical forms of prospecting

• Generate new business opportunities through creative methods of outreach

• Execute on a personalized outreach strategy through outbound channels



Requirements

• Comfort speaking with decision makers that are part of the C-Suite/Executive Leadership Team

• A passion for networking, building relationships, and being part of a team

• Understanding of CRMs such as Hubspot and Salesforce

• Understanding of sales tools including
 automation, prospecting, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator

title: Quantity Surveyor / Office Engineer - Remote (Experience in JobTread)
description:
Application instructions below:



About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Quantity Surveyor/Office Engineer to join our dynamic team. This multifaceted role combines quantity surveying expertise with office engineering and financial administration, focusing on accurate cost estimation, project budgeting, and comprehensive project support. The successful candidate will work closely with our project managers, site teams, and clients to ensure precise cost control and seamless project delivery from concept to completion.



Key Responsibilities

Cost Estimation & Quantity Surveying



Project Estimating: Calculate materials, labor costs, and overall project budgets with precision

BOQ & BOM Preparation: Develop comprehensive Bills of Quantities and Bills of Materials for all projects

Job Pricing: Analyze construction plans and prepare detailed quantity requirements and pricing structures

Contract Analysis: Scrutinize maintenance costs, material expenses, and contracts to secure optimal deals

Tender Management: Analyze tenders and manage procurement processes for construction and design projects

Prepare accurate brickwork and blockwork quantity take-offs, including bricks, blocks, mortar, lintels, insulation, and related masonry components

Analyze brickwork labor and material rates to ensure competitive and accurate pricing

Estimating Tools: Utilize software including Simpro, JobTread, Bluebeam, PlanSwift, CostX, Measure Square, Stone Pro, and Microsoft Office to support estimating, budgeting, and project documentation.



Project Coordination & Client Management



Stakeholder Liaison: Coordinate with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors to ensure smooth project execution

Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, and risk assessments

Strategic Advisory: Advise managers and clients on cost improvements, new strategies, and savings opportunities

Change Management: Document design changes and update budgets accordingly

Material Management: Track materials inventory and coordinate ordering when required



Financial Administration & Office Support



Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and perform data entry for financial documentation

Administrative Support: Assist staff accountants and handle various office and financial tasks

Client Administration: Manage administrative tasks delegated by clients with efficiency and accuracy



Required Skills & Experience

Technical Requirements



Quantity Surveying: Proven experience in cost estimation, BOQ preparation, and quantity surveying methodologies

Construction Knowledge: Strong understanding of construction processes, materials, and industry standards

Financial Acumen: Experience with budget management, financial reporting, and cost control

Contract Management: Knowledge of construction contracts, procurement, and tender analysis

Simpro Experience: Hands-on experience using Simpro for job costing, project budgeting, invoicing, and workflow management



Professional Skills



Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities with exceptional attention to detail

Software Proficiency: Competency in quantity surveying software, spreadsheet applications, and financial systems

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client and contractor liaison

Organization: Outstanding organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

Adaptability: Flexibility to handle diverse administrative and technical tasks



What We Offer



Competitive salary package

Opportunity to work with self-builders across Ireland and the UK

Professional development and training opportunities

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment

Career growth potential within an expanding company

Involvement in diverse construction and visualization projects

Remote working flexibility with comprehensive project support systems

Experience working on international projects with diverse clients.



Instructions:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

This is also a great way to gain something besides money - i.e. learn about U.S. financial companies like hedge funds and private equity funds, as well as an exciting opportunity to work closely with some of the brightest minds on Wall Street in an informal work environment where collegiality and intellectual rigor are highly valued. We specialize in the financial services industry. But, no prior industry experience is required.

Honor Athletics is a Toronto-based sports/fitness brand with a multi-market global e-commerce operation. We sell primarily through Amazon and Shopify across North America, Europe, the UK, the UAE, and Australia. We scale through systems, discipline, and measurable performance, not luck.

title: DaVinci Resolve Video Editor (Remote) - Fluent English
description:
Remote, ongoing freelance work with the opportunity for growth and to move into part-time employment.



Fluent English (written and spoken) is required.

Applicants must be based in the Philippines.

Applications close: 30 March 2026



About Perspective Studios

We are a UK-based video marketing agency helping construction and trade businesses win more of the right work through high-quality video and advertising.



Our team produces:

Organic Growth content: brand and social videos created by our in-house team

Paid Growth content: short, high-impact Meta ads 
 and Instagram) that generate real leads

We are now looking for a detail-driven Video Editor who can join our remote team on a project-by-project basis, with ongoing repeat work and the opportunity to move into part-time employment as workload grows.



The role

You will edit vertical and square ad videos in various aspect ratios using DaVinci Resolve.

We shoot in Log, so you must understand how to convert Log footage, then colour correct and colour grade for a clean, natural, professional finish. Experience with mixed camera formats (S-Log/C-Log and common consumer/pro cameras) is ideal.

You must have your own editing equipment and software. We do not provide hardware, software, or internet access.



What you will be responsible for

Join brief meetings so you fully understand the script, offer, and what the edit needs to achieve.

Edit short-form ads (30 to 90 seconds) for construction and trade clients.

Select the most relevant B-roll to match dialogue and maintain audience retention.

Keep fundamentals tight, including eyelines, continuity, clean cuts, and story flow.

Polish audio so dialogue is clear and levels are consistent.

Convert Log footage correctly, then colour correct and colour grade for a consistent look across mixed cameras.

Add captions and on-screen graphics that suit Meta ad standards and the client brand.

Follow supplied scripts, creative direction, templates, and brand guidelines closely.

Attend quality control and feedback meetings when needed, then apply notes quickly and accurately.

Deliver fast, accurate edits on schedule.





Branding and client variation

We work with multiple clients and each one has their own branding. You must be comfortable switching brand packs and keeping everything consistent per client.

Updating titles, lower thirds, captions style, fonts, colours, and logos per client

Keeping calls to action clear, on-brand, and aligned to the brief





Workflow, templates, and delivery

We will train you on our workflows, templates, folder structure, QC process, review process, and delivery standards. Once onboarded, you must follow the system consistently.

Use our templates, caption styles, and export settings

Follow folder structure, naming, and version control

Run QC before submission (captions, audio, colour, framing, exports, brand checks)

Use only approved or licensed assets for copyright compliance

Deliver tidy handovers when a project is complete, including exports and organised project files





What we are looking for

Essential

Based: in the Philippines

Fluent English: (written and spoken)

DaVinci Resolve expertise: this is your main editing platform, including strong use of nodes

Confident working with Log footage: converting, colour correcting, and colour grading

Strong understanding of social media ads: pacing, hooks, captions, retention, and clear CTAs

Detail focused: cuts and B-roll must always align with the story or service being discussed

Communication: reliable, responsive, and open to feedback

Turnaround: can deliver quick edits while maintaining high quality

Working knowledge of DaVinci Fusion: for simple motion graphics (titles, callouts, basic animation)

Comfortable joining meetings: from brief to QC or feedback meetings, with some UK hours overlap

A reliable remote working set-up: you own your own equipment and software (we do not provide this)



Nice to have

Experience editing for construction, trades, or similar service-based industries

Basic motion graphics or caption animation skills inside DaVinci Resolve

Understanding of Meta ad compliance and formatting

Comfortable using YouTube and Vimeo to share work



Work arrangement

Type: Freelance, project-based (with the goal of part-time employment as workload grows)

Projects: typically batches of six one-minute ads at a time

Location: remote (Philippines-based only)

Timezone: must be available for occasional overlap with UK hours for feedback calls or revisions. 

Start: ASAP



How to apply

We hire based on who you are, how you think, and the quality of work you consistently deliver.

Please send all of the following:



1) A maximum 2 minute introduction video (most important)

Upload to YouTube or Vimeo and share the link.

In 2 minutes or less, tell us:

Who you are and where you are based in the Philippines

Why you want to work with Perspective Studios

Why this role fits you specifically

Your DaVinci Resolve experience, including workflow and any Fusion use

Your remote working setup (a quick overview is fine)

Your availability for UK overlap



This does not need to be overproduced. A simple, honest video recorded from your smartphone is better than a polished video edit.



2) CV in PDF or Word format

A brief CV covering your most relevant experience, what you did on each project, and what you are strongest at.



3) Portfolio links

Include 3 to 5 examples of short-form ads or promotional videos you personally edited.



4) Short cover letter (under one page)

In a short message (maximum one page), outline why you are right for this role and include:

Your typical turnaround time for six 60-second ads

Your rate structure (per video, per batch, or day rate)

Confirmation that DaVinci Resolve is your main editing platform



What you will get

Ongoing, reliable work with a growing UK agency

Clear briefs, templates, and feedback on every project

Consistent projects and a creative, respectful team environment

The opportunity to grow into a part-time position as workload increases

Competitive rates based on experience, speed, and quality



Job summary

Role: Video Editor (DaVinci Resolve)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Type: Freelance, ongoing project-based

Rate: Competitive, based on experience and speed

Hours: Flexible, with overlap for UK feedback

Start: ASAP

title: AutoCAD Design Engineer - Fire Protection System
description:
About Us:

We are a U.S.-based fire protection company specializing in fire sprinkler and fire alarm design, installation, and project management. Based in Los Angeles, we have been in continuous operation since 2002.



We are currently seeking a detail-oriented AutoCAD Designer (entry-level or experienced) to support our design department’s day-to-day operations.



We believe thriving employees create satisfied clients. As a fast-growing company, we seek driven professionals eager to take on challenges and build rewarding careers. At Radix, we foster strong relationships, promote from within, and invest in training and development to create clear paths for advancement.



Join a team that values people as much as performance—grow your career with Radix Fire Protection.



Job Summary:



Position Responsibilities will include (but not be limited to) the following:



• Prepare layouts, drawings, and designs of fire protection systems in accordance with NFPA-13 & 72 codes.

• Prepare fabrication listings, prepare material equipment submittals, and submit close-out packages.

• Responsible for ensuring plans are approved by the local City Fire Department.

• Fix any corrections from the city plan checker as needed.

• Assist with RFI (Request for Information).

• Prepare fabrication plans, material list, and close-out documents.

• Assist project management team with technical support.





Requirement:

• Engineering Degree

• Minimum 1 year experience with AutoCAD

title: Sales Pitch & Client Messaging VA (Trial Project)
description:
JOB POST (CLEAR + SIMPLE)



Read carefully.



I run a premium swim program and I’m hiring a VA to help me figure out the best way to explain and sell it.



Important:

I am not sure a PowerPoint is the final answer.

Your first job is to ask questions, listen, and help me d
 what the right tool even is (slides, script, one-pager, etc.).



If you think a PowerPoint is NOT the solution, I want you to say that.



WHAT YOU’LL DO (STEP 1 ONLY)



Join a Zoom call



Ask smart questions



Help me clarify:



The offer



The sales message



The best format to present it



Then (only after clarity):



Create a pitch asset (PowerPoint if appropriate)



TRIAL



Paid $5 trial



Trial = outline, notes, or rough concept



This is to see if you understand my vision



TIMELINE



Must be available within 48 hours



Speed matters



INTERVIEW



Live Zoom interviews



9:30 AM – 10:30 AM (New York time)



If you can’t attend, you must schedule an interview



REQUIREMENTS



Understand sales or persuasion



Comfortable saying “this isn’t the right approach”



Can ask good questions



Clear English communication



TO APPLY



Send:



A short message explaining how you approach figuring out a sales message



Your rate (hourly or per project)



Whether you can join Zoom today



One example of a time you told a client they didn’t need what they thought they needed



No long proposals. No templates.



IMPORTANT NOTE (THIS IS KEY)



We are not asking them to answer sales theory questions.

We are filtering for:



Thinkers



Communicators



People who challenge ideas respectfully

title: Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist
description:
Join Our Remote Accounting Team!

We are a fast-growing, boutique outsourced accounting firm supporting high-growth e-commerce and service-based businesses. While our name remains confidential for now, we’ve been behind the scenes helping some of the most exciting DTC brands scale with confidence through expert bookkeeping, financial systems, and strategic insights.



We are a remote-first company with a collaborative, client-first culture — and we’re looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.



We are seeking a detail-oriented Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist to own inventory accuracy, valuation, and reconciliation within our ERP environment for a fast-growing e-commerce business.



About the Role

The Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist sits at the intersection of accounting and operations, ensuring inventory data is complete, accurate, and properly valued to support reliable COGS, financial reporting, and month-end close. The ideal candidate is comfortable working independently, digging into variances, and partnering cross-functionally to resolve issues efficiently.



Core Responsibilities

**Inventory Recording & Accuracy

- Manage inventory transactions within an ERP system (Finaloop or comparable platforms such as NetSuite), including purchases, sales, returns, write-offs, and transfers

- Maintain perpetual inventory records and ensure alignment between operational data and the general ledger

- Review supporting documentation to validate accuracy across warehouses and distribution channels



**Inventory Valuation & Landed Costs

- Calculate and maintain landed costs, including freight, duties, and handling fees

- Ensure inventory is valued consistently using approved valuation methods and aligned with accounting standards

- Support reserves and adjustments for obsolete, slow-moving, or damaged inventory in coordination with Finance and Operations



**Reconciliations & Variance Resolution

- Perform regular inventory reconciliations between ERP, accounting records, and physical counts

- Investigate discrepancies and document root causes, partnering with operations and warehouse teams to resolve issues

- Ensure accurate cost allocations and transfers across systems



**COGS & Financial Reporting Support

- Support accurate calculation of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) for monthly close

- Prepare inventory-related schedules, reconciliations, and supporting documentation

- Assist Finance leadership with inventory analyses, reporting, and audit support as needed



**Systems, Tools & Analysis

- Utilize ERP and reporting tools to analyze inventory movements and trends

- Build and maintain Excel-based reports using advanced formulas and pivot tables (Power Query is a plus)

- Support data extraction and validation from distributor or fulfillment platforms when applicable



Qualifications

- 4–7 years of experience in accounting and inventory management, inventory accounting, or cost accounting

- Hands-on experience with ERP systems such as Finaloop, NetSuite, or similar platforms

- Strong understanding of ecommerce inventory flows, landed costs, and cost allocations

- Solid knowledge of inventory accounting principles and COGS

- Advanced Excel skills (LOOKUPs, Pivot Tables; Power Query a plus)

- Ability to work independently, investigate issues, and follow through to resolution



Why Join Accountally?

- Competitive Pay of $11 - $12/hr with performance-based growth opportunities

- Paid Time Off

- A Culture of Collaboration & Excellence built around service, innovation, and personal development

- Clear path to Accounting Manager within 12 - 24 months of employment

title: Staff Accountant
description:
What’s in it for you!

- Php 50-80K+

- Full healthcare

- 100% remote: beach, hills, anywhere

- 24 days off to live your way

- Refer friends, earn 30K PHP

-  Team fun: Meet in BGC for hangouts at rooftop bars, beach, sunset yoga, karaoke



About Me:

Mom, surfer, party-lover, and teller of jokes. I help the world’s biggest companies—and scrappy startups—make sense of their money as a fractional CFO. Big 4 alum, Berkeley & NYU MBA… If you’ve got a big sense of humor and want to learn finance, this is your place!



The Role

I’m looking for a Staff Accountant, who’ll support the company’s financial operations by managing credit card transactions, reviewing invoices, reconciling accounts, and assisting with month-end close processes. You’ll help maintain accurate records, support audits, and work with senior staff on projects and process improvements to ensure smooth and compliant financial operations.



What you’ll be doing

1. Corporate Credit Card Administration (Divvy)

- Manage and administer Divvy credit card transactions for all cardholders

- Review expense coding, receipts, and policy compliance

- Follow up with employees on missing receipts, incorrect coding, or unsupported charges

- Prepare and post monthly credit card expense journal entries



2. Accounts Payable Support

- Monitor and manage the Accounts Payable inbox

- Review vendor invoices for accuracy, completeness, and proper approval

- Route invoices for approval and resolve discrepancies with vendors and internal stakeholders

- Assist with timely processing of vendor payments



3. Bank Reconciliations

- Assist with monthly bank and cash account reconciliations

- Investigate and resolve reconciling items, timing differences, and variances

- Support month-end close activities related to cash and expense accounts



4. Accounts Receivable & Collections Support

- Assist with monitoring customer accounts and aging reports

- Support AR collections efforts, including customer follow-ups on past-due balances

- Help resolve billing questions and payment discrepancies

- Apply customer payments and assist with AR reconciliations



5. General Accounting Support

- Assist with month-end and quarter-end close processes

- Maintain accurate and organized accounting records and documentation

- Support audits and internal requests by providing schedules and supporting detail

- Collaborate with senior accounting staff on ad hoc projects and process improvements



What we’re looking for

- Experienced in Accounting

- Experience in Sage Intacct, Divvy

- Basic-Intermediate understanding of Excel

- Experience as a Staff Accountant

- Good interpersonal skills



Schedule: Full-time, PST

title: Social Media Specialist (Recruitment & Employer Branding)
description:
PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK:


/applyjob-noncaller-1



About Us:

With over 100 years of combined industry experience, the Community Minerals team specializes in the purchase of mineral or royalty rights all over the US. We have earned a stellar reputation with hundreds of satisfied customers and an “A” rating with the Better Business Bureau. With our proven track record, we continue to serve mineral owners in several states with transparency, accountability, and a personalized experience to meet individual needs.



Job Summary:

The Social Media Specialist – Recruitment & Employer Branding is responsible for strengthening Community Minerals’ employer brand and supporting contractor acquisition through strategic, creative, and data-driven social media initiatives. This role focuses on managing recruitment-focused social media channels, developing engaging hiring campaigns, and supporting recruitment marketing efforts to attract and engage qualified contractor talent. The role works closely with the Talent Acquisition team to ensure consistent messaging, strong candidate engagement, and effective promotion of open roles, events, and contractor milestones.



What You'll Do:

Recruitment & Employer Branding

- Manage and maintain recruitment-focused social media platforms, including
, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn, to attract and engage contractor talent.

- Develop and execute creative, platform-specific recruitment campaigns aligned with hiring needs and employer branding goals.

- Ensure all recruitment content reflects Community Minerals’ values, tone, and brand identity.



Content Creation & Community Management

- Create engaging social media content such as job ads, hiring announcements, recruitment videos, graphics, and campaign posts.

- Monitor and manage social media communities by responding to comments, messages, and inquiries in a timely and professional manner.

- Support internal engagement by posting contractor milestones such as birthdays, work anniversaries, promotions, and recognitions in the People & Culture Slack channel.



Career Page & Recruitment Tools

- Manage and update the company career page, including posting job openings, updating recruitment content, and publishing recruitment-related announcements or blogs.

- Create, upload, and manage AI voiceover recordings for VideoAsk’s general recruitment questions and role-specific screening questions.

- Coordinate closely with the recruitment team to ensure job postings are accurate, timely, and aligned with active hiring needs.



Recruitment Support & Events

- Support recruitment initiatives such as job fairs, campus hiring activities, and virtual or on-site recruitment events.

- Represent Community Minerals during recruitment events by engaging with potential contractors and promoting open opportunities.

- Assist with candidate sourcing, screening coordination, and engagement activities as needed.



Analytics & Reporting

- Track, analyze, and report on recruitment social media performance, including engagement, reach, follower growth, and campaign effectiveness.

- Provide insights and recommendations to improve recruitment marketing strategies based on data and trends.



Collaboration & Continuous Improvement

- Collaborate with Talent Acquisition, People & Culture, and Marketing stakeholders to align recruitment messaging and campaigns.

- Stay updated on recruitment marketing trends, social media best practices, and digital employer branding strategies.



What We're Looking For:

Education:

- Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.



Experience:

- Minimum of 2 years of experience in social media management, preferably with a recruitment or employer branding focus.

- Minimum of 2 years of experience supporting recruitment, talent acquisition, or HR-related initiatives.'



Technical Skills:

- Experience supporting job fairs, hiring events, or recruitment campaigns is an advantage.

- Experience in compensation research or recruitment market benchmarking is a plus.

- Strong proficiency in social media platforms:
, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn.

- Experience using content creation tools such as Canva and similar design platforms.

- Ability to track and analyze social media and recruitment metrics to support decision-making.



Soft Skills:

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Strong creativity and storytelling skills tailored to recruitment audiences.

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities.

- Proactive, adaptable, and solution-oriented mindset.

- Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.



Industry Knowledge:

- Understanding of recruitment marketing, employer branding, and talent acquisition trends.

- Awareness of contractor engagement practices and labor market dynamics.

- Familiarity with digital marketing strategies applied to recruitment.



What’s in it for you:

- Competitive Compensation: Earn $3.55 to $4.72 per hour, commensurate with your skills and experience.

- Work your way: Remote Work Set-Up enabling you to operate from the comfort and convenience of your own chosen workspace

- Flexible Healthcare Bonus (Philippines): A healthcare bonus you control. Use it for HMO coverage, life insurance, or set it aside as an emergency fund—whatever best supports your well-being. It’s entirely up to you.

- Success Incentives: Enjoy company bonuses and performance-driven rewards.

- Soar with Us: Opportunities for career growth and promotions await you.

- Positive Vibes Only: Experience a supportive and uplifting work culture.

- Annual Bonus: We value your dedication throughout the year, rewarding you with an annual performance bonus shared at the end of the year.

- Performance Raise: Your hard work doesn't go unnoticed. Be ready to seize opportunities for a salary increase based on your outstanding performance.

- Performance Incentives: We believe exceptional work deserves recognition. Performance incentives are awarded to individuals who demonstrate outstanding contributions, initiative, and results. It’s our way of celebrating excellence and motivating continued success.

- Discretionary Bonus: At Community Minerals, exceptional work doesn’t go unnoticed. Contractors who consistently go above and beyond may be rewarded with discretionary bonuses, a token of appreciation for outstanding contributions, impactful results, and dedication to excellence. Let your work speak, and the rewards will follow!



Other Requirements:

- Willing to work in US Business Hours (CST)

- Must have stable Internet and Power Connection

- Must have a Computer with at least 2 monitors set up, a stable Internet Connection



System Requirements:

To ensure optimal performance and functionality while using different web and application tools, please make sure that your syste
ets the following requirements:



Operating System:

- Windows: Windows 10 (64-bit) or higher

- macOS: macOS 11 (Big Sur) or higher



Processor:

- Intel: 8th Gen Core i3, i5, i7, or newer

- AMD: Ryzen 3 (2018) or newer



Memory (RAM):

- A minimum of 8 GB of RAM is required.

- Recommended: 16 GB RAM for multitasking and optimal performance

title: Sales VA
description:
We are hiring a Sales-Oriented Virtual Assistant who knows how to confidently handle

objections and close deals over the phone. You’ll be the first point of contact for leads

interested in our U.S.-based cleaning services, and your main goal is to convert those inquiries

into paying customers.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in sales conversations, knows how to build trust

quickly, and doesn’t shy away from tough questions or hesitations from prospects.



Key Responsibilities:

- Take inbound sales calls from interested leads and follow up with outbound calls when

needed

- Confidently pitch our services and walk customers through pricing and packages

- Handle common objections (pricing, scheduling, trust concerns) with professionalism

and ease

- Convert warm leads into scheduled jobs with a consistent close rate

- Manage CRM updates, lead tracking, and post-call notes

- Assist with scheduling, follow-up
s, and basic administrative tasks

- Maintain excellent customer service before, during, and after the sale



What We're Looking For:

- Fluent in English with strong conversational skills

- Proven ability to overcome objections and close sales on calls

- Comfortable talking to U.S. customers and building rapport quickly

- Detail-oriented with solid administrative follow-through

- Able to work independently and take initiative without constant supervision

- Experience with cleaning or home services (preferred but not required)



Technical Requirements:

- Minimum 30 Mbps wired Internet connection

- Quiet, professional work environment with no background noise

- Backup Internet and device for emergencies

Compensation & Hours:

- $5–$5.50 per hour (depending on experience)

- Full-time role

- Must be available during U.S. business hours (Pacific time)

- Commission's available as bonuses for top performers

- Bonuses provided for hitting key KPI's

- Looking for someone who wants to grow with the growth of the organization.



To Apply:

Submit a short voice or video message describing your experience with handling objections

and closing sales over the phone. Real examples or metrics from past roles are a plus. As well as why you would be a good fit for our company

title: Senior Mechanical / Product Design Engineer (3D Printing & Structural Design)
description:
Job Overview



We are an early-stage product company developing a next-generation, 3D-printed mobility device using high-performance composite materials (carbon-fiber-filled nylon / PPA-CF). We are looking for an experienced mechanical/product design engineer to join us on a short-term contract (up to 4 weeks) to help finalize and stabilize the mechanical design so it is test-worthy under real human loads.



This role is hands-on and engineering-driven. You will be working directly with the founder to improve stiffness, load paths, and durability while preserving the existing design language and aesthetics. This is not a cosmetic redesign or basic CAD task. If the engagement goes well, there is a strong possibility of extending this role into a longer-term position after our upcoming funding round.



Scope of Work (1 Month Contract with option for full time)



You will be responsible for:

Reviewing an existing 3D-printed chassis design and identifying structural weak points

Improving stiffness and load paths in load-bearing areas (lower frame, backrest, footrest)

Designing ribs, wall thickness strategies, and local reinforcements without changing the visual design language

Recommending print strategies (walls, infill, sectioning) for composite materials

Iterating designs based on real-world test feedback

Preparing print-ready CAD files for large-format 3D printing

This is a focused engineering sprint, not an ongoing support role.



Required Skills & Experience

We are looking for someone with real mechanical judgment, not just CAD skills.



We'd like to see:

Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience

Strong proficiency in Fusion 360 or SolidWorks

Experience designing load-bearing plastic or composite parts

Understanding of wall thickness, ribs, section modulus, and load paths

Experience designing for 3D printing / additive manufacturing

Ability to explain why a design decision is made, not just how



Strongly Preferred:

Experience with carbon-fiber-filled nylons or engineering plastics

Experience with FEA or basic stress analysis

Experience designing parts intended for real human loads

Medical device, mobility, automotive, aerospace, or industrial product background

What This Role Is NOT

Not basic STL modeling

Not rendering or visualization work

Not a purely aesthetic industrial design role

Not data entry or drafting

We are looking for an engineer who can think structurally and take ownership of mechanical decisions.



Contract Details



Duration: 1 Month (contract)

Hours: Flexible (outcome-focused, not clock-focused)

Compensation: Competitive, based on experience

Potential to convert to longer-term role after funding



How to Apply



Please include:

A short description of a structural or mechanical problem you’ve solved

The types of materials you’ve designed for (plastics, composites, metals, etc.)

Your primary CAD software

Any relevant portfolio images or screenshots (if available)

Applications that only say “I can do CAD” without explaining engineering experience will not be considered.

title: Financial Analyst with Salesforce Exp
description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.



Overview:





We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Financial Analyst to support our executive team. The ideal candidate will excel in data preparation, interpretation, and financial analysis, providing the CEO with actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Strong analytical skills, proficiency in data visualization, and the ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful reports are essential for this role.





Job Title: Financial Analyst





Location: Fully remote





Job Type: Full-Time



Strategic Recommendations:





Identify trends, key metrics, and opportunities for business growth based on data-driven analysis.

Provide actionable insights and recommendations to the CEO to optimize operations, revenue, and profitability.

Research market trends, competitor strategies, syndication and industry benchmarks to support strategic planning.





 Syndication Coordination:



Coordinate syndication activities, including preparing documentation and facilitating communication between lenders and investors.

Process syndication payments from lenders and distribute syndication payments to investors in   a timely manner.

Ensure compliance with syndication agreements and regulatory requirements.





Commissions Management: 



Calculate and manage commission payments

Track commission structures and ensure accurate and timely disbursement.





 Financial Reporting:





Prepare detailed financial reports

Generate reports on syndication activities, providing insights into performance and projections.

Create reports, charts, and presentations that effectively communicate findings to executives and stakeholders.

 



Excel Proficiency:



  Utilize advanced Excel functions for financial analysis and reporting.

  Build and maintain spreadsheets to streamline financial processes and reporting.

?



Requirements

Required Skills & Qualifications:





 Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.

 Proven experience (3+ years) in financial management.

 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including VLOOKUPs, PivotTables, and complex formulas).

 Strong understanding of financial principles and practices.



 Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

 Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently in a fast-paced environment.





 Desired Traits:



 Analytical thinker with problem-solving skills.

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

 Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.



 Adaptability to evolving responsibilities and business needs.





Benefits



Fun working environment

PTO

HMO

And More!



Join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our organization by attracting top talent and fostering a culture of excellence. Apply now to embark on an exciting career journey with us!

title: Content Writer / Communications Associate (No AI, Manual Writing)
description:
Parity Homes is seeking a creative and detail-oriented Content Writer / Communications Associate to support our growing need for high-quality written content across marketing, sales, and internal communications. In this role, you will craft clear and compelling messaging that strengthens our brand voice, deepens client engagement, and supports internal alignment across teams.



We are more than a homebuilder; we are reimagining how neighborhoods are valued and invested in. Our work centers on transforming long-abandoned Baltimore rowhomes into pathways to wealth and resilience for historically marginalized communities. Every tea
mber contributes to this mission--including through the stories we tell and the messages we share.



Key Responsibilities

High-Quality Written Content

Produce engaging content for
s, newsletters, blog posts, website pages, sales materials, and lead magnets.

Maintain a consistent brand voice across all communication channels.

Deliver polished, error-free writing with strong grammar, structure, and tone.



Internal & External Communications

Draft internal memos, updates, and documents to strengthen company-wide communication.

Create templates, announcements, and onboarding materials for client communication.

Develop and refine SOPs, handbooks, and process documentation.



Marketing & Social Media Support

Write and schedule social media content to improve engagement and brand visibility.

Support messaging for campaigns, content calendars, captions, and storytelling.

Contribute creative direction for messaging angles and content themes.



Brand & Messaging Alignment

Ensure all written materials reflect Parity Homes' values, voice, and brand standards.

Maintain messaging guidelines, templates, and communication frameworks.

Collaborate with leadership to refine tone, value propositions, and messaging pillars.



Research & Insights

Conduct topic, keyword, and competitor research to support content strategy.

Stay current on trends in real estate, construction, and residential development.

Translate complex concepts into simple, engaging, audience-friendly messages.



Process & Quality Improvement

Implement proofreading, version tracking, and review workflows to ensure quality.

Recommend improvements to messaging processes and documentation systems.

Support cross-functional teams with ad hoc writing needs and special projects.



Qualifications

Required

5+ years of experience in content writing, communications, or marketing.

Portfolio with strong writing samples (marketing,
, long-form, or internal communications).

Excellent command of English with strong grammar, editing, and storytelling skills.

Ability to write in multiple tones--professional, conversational, technical, and brand-driven.

Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple deadlines.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, fully remote environment.

Strong research skills and ability to learn real estate, construction, or operational topics.



Preferred

Has experience working EST Business Hours

Experience in public relations, press, or external communications.

Familiarity with HubSpot, ClickUp, Google Workspace, or content management tools.

Experience with
 marketing, newsletters, or social media content planning.

Basic understanding of SEO principles and keyword usage.



Compensation, Growth, and Benefits

Competitive compensation based on experience.

Opportunity for performance-based bonuses as the company grows.

Direct mentorship from the Founder and CEO.

20 days of paid time off.

title: Digital PR & Authority Link Builder
description:
City-Focused Digital PR & Authority Link Builder



Type: Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term

Location: Philippines preferred

Salary: 50,000–80,000 PHP/month (based on experience)

Hours: 40/week



Overview



We’re hiring a City-Focused Digital PR & Link Builder to strengthen Hellamaid’s authority at the city level.



This role is about earning real, local, high-authority links that help our city pages rank, not generic homepage links.



What You’ll Own 

- City-specific backlink strategies (e.g., Calgary, Toronto, Vancouver)

- Local digital PR and outreach

- Mentions from local media, blogs, organizations, and institutions

- City-relevant authority links to service pages

- Repeatable city-level link acquisition systems



What We’re Looking For

- Experience with local or city-based link building

- Strong outreach and relationship-building skills

- Understands local relevance > raw DR

- Can think in campaigns, not one-off links



How to Apply (Required)



Send:

1) Your CV or examples of past city-level placements

2) A Loom video (under 5 minutes) explaining:

- How you would build city-relevant authority links to this page

- Page to review: 

- Who you’d reach out to in Edmonton, what the angle is, and why it works



Applications with a Loom video will have a better response.

title: VA For Growing Online Jewelry Company
description:
General Virtual Assistant – E-Commerce, Operations & Marketing Support

Full-Time: 30–40 hours/week  |  Schedule: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST  |  Pay: $6–8 USD/hour (based on experience)

I’m hiring a detail-driven, dependable Virtual Assistant to support my e-commerce and jewelry business. This role is for someone who’s organized, proactive, and comfortable handling both operations and customer communication. This is a long-term position, not a short-term task-based role.

Core Responsibilities

  • Manage and maintain Shopify product listings (Shopify experience is REQUIRED)
  • Communicate with vendors regarding ordering, payments, and follow-ups
  • List items for sale in group pages
  • Respond to and manage customer inquiries professionally and promptly
  • Maintain and update spreadsheets, task managers, and operational tools
  • Help maintain regular customer newsletters and communications
  • Assist with campaigns and broadcasts using GoHighLevel
  • Provide general personal and business support as needed
  • Ensure tasks, follow-ups, and projects stay on track

Required Experience & Skills

  • Shopify experience is a MUST (applications without this will not be considered)
  • Strong written English communication skills
  • Experience managing customer messages/inquiries
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and reliable
  • Comfortable working independently and following systems
  • Ability to work 30–40 hours/week starting at 9:00 AM CST

Preferred (Not Required, But a Plus)

  • GoHighLevel experience (preferred, not required)
  • Experience supporting newsletters/customer broadcasts
  • Experience with TikTok (posting, engagement, or account support)
  • Experience assisting with or hosting live webinars (Zoom/live trainings/launches)

Technical Requirements (Required)

When applying, you must include the following:

  • Type of computer you use (laptop or desktop)
  • Operating system (Windows or Mac)
  • RAM and storage (drive) specifications
  • Internet speed test results (upload/download)

Applications missing these details will not be reviewed.

Application Instructions (VERY IMPORTANT)

To filter out generic applications, please include a short written introduction answering:

  1. Your Shopify experience and the specific tasks you handled
  2. Any experience with GoHighLevel, newsletters, TikTok, or webinars
  3. Confirmation you can work 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST, 30–40 hours/week

If you’re organized, tech-comfortable, and take pride in keeping things running smoothly, I’d love to review your application. Apply with all required details to be considered.

title: URGENT: Executive Assistant (with Sales or Marketing Exp)
description:
We are seeking a proactive, research-driven Executive Assistant to provide dedicated support to our CEO. This is a high-impact, long-term role focused on administrative excellence, strategic project sourcing, CRM management, and executive communication. You will act as the CEO’s right hand—ensuring no lead, task, or opportunity is missed while supporting multiple growth initiatives across the business.



This role is ideal for someone resourceful, detail-obsessed, and confident navigating online portals, handling global correspondence, and managing complex workflows.



Responsibilities:



Monitor procurement portals and online platforms to identify new project opportunities

Flag EOIs and gather documentation for proposal teams

Conduct market, industry, and client research

Manage executive
 correspondence and outreach

Communicate with partners and prospects via phone,
, and social channels

Maintain CRM records (GoHighLevel) for leads, SMS, WhatsApp, and social interactions

Track follow-ups and ensure no task is overlooked

Provide executive-level administrative support and calendar management

Keep Notion and internal databases updated in real time

Coordinate with internal teams to meet deadlines

Support documentation of SOPs and internal workflows



Requirements:

2+ years Executive Assistant experience supporting senior leadership

2+ years Sales or Marketing Experience

Strong research and sourcing skills

Experience with GoHighLevel, Notion, Asana, or other CRM tools

Vocal and confident without being aggressive, able to defend points logically, with strong critical and analytical thinking skills

Excellent written and verbal English communication

Detail-oriented with a zero-error mindset

Comfortable making calls and handling executive communications

Willing to work EST hours reliably

Looking for long-term stability and growth





Schedule & Location:

Type: Full-Time, Dedicated



Hours: Monday through Saturday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST for the first month only. After that, the schedule will switch to a standard 5-day workweek.



Location: Remote



Benefits & Compensation:

Generous Paid Time Off (PTO)

Holiday Pay

Employee Referral Program with bonuses

Fully Remote Work Setup

Structured and professional team environment



To Apply: Answer the screening questions below





1. Link to your CV

2. 1-minute video introduction

3. Can you tell me your exp in Sales or Marketing?

4. Name the CRM platforms you’ve used (GoHighLevel, Salesforce, 
, etc.)

5. Are you available to work Monday through Saturday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST for the first month?

5. Are you comfortable with occasional schedule adjustments (with advance notice) to meet urgent project deadlines?

6. Are you comfortable using a time-tracking tool?



Once we’ve assessed your submission, we’ll be in touch and schedule an interview later between 11AM-1PM EST. I will send you a booking link.



Thank you!

title: Recruiter
description:
We’re seeking an experienced Recruiter with outstanding people skills to join our team. As a Recruiter, you’ll work to attract excellent job candidates, conduct interviews, and identify future hiring needs.



You’ll need a wide variety of skills to succeed as a Recruiter: excellent communication skills, knowledge of social media best practices, and superb multitasking skills, among others.



Recruiter Responsibilities

- Collaborate with department managers to identify employment needs and candidate requirements

- Work with department managers to develop job descriptions

- Share job descriptions through posting on various recruitment databases, social media, and online employment forums

- Monitor applications and conduct phone screenings and interviews with suitable candidates

- Evaluate applicant knowledge and skills, along with work experience, to select the strongest candidate for the position

- Conduct background screenings as required

- Prepare employment offers, answering questions as needed, and scanning in returned paperwork

- Assist in onboarding new employees

- Promote employee retention 

- Provide hiring and retention reports to management as needed



Recruiter Requirements 

- [5+] years experience as a Recruiter

- Experience with Application Tracking Software (ATS)

- BA/BS in human resources, business, or related field

- Good with people

-  Excellent communication and organizational skills

- Strong decision-making skills 

- Proficient with applicant tracking software and Microsoft Office Suite

- Must have availability work Tues-Sat US CST
